'''Libatius Borage''' was a [[South America]]n [[wizardkind|wizard]], widely considered "''one of the world's most famous [[potioneer]]s''".<ref name="PM">{{WW|castelobruxo}}</ref>

==Biography==
In his youth, he attended the [[wizarding school]] of [[Castelobruxo]], in [[Brazil]].<ref name="PM"/>

Among his many published works are ''[[Advanced Potion-Making]]'', ''[[Asiatic Anti-Venoms]]'' and ''[[Have Yourself a Fiesta in a Bottle!]]''<ref name="PM"/> — the first and second of which are used at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], as a textbook for [[Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test|N.E.W.T.]]-level classes,<ref name="HBP9">{{HBP|B|9}}</ref> and as a reference text for [[Ordinary Wizarding Level|O.W.L.]]-level classes,<ref name="OP16">{{OOTP|B|16}}</ref> respectively.

Despite Borage's accomplishments, [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] [[Potions Master]] [[Severus Snape]] seemed to be more adept at [[Potions (class)|potion-making]] than even him, adding many footnotes to his own copy edition of Borage's book, significantly improving it.<ref name="HBP9"/>

In the [[1980s]], Borage's portrait hung at the [[Hippogriff Clubhouse]].<ref name="HM">{{HM}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Potion]]s''': Borage was a highly accomplished and skilled [[potioneer]] in his lifetime, having written several books on the subject and was considered to be one the most famous potioneers in the world.<ref name="PM"/>

==Etymology==
Libatius Borage's name probably derived from libation, a ritual offering of drink to the gods, and Borage, an edible herb believed to bestow excitement and courage in the hearts of those who consumed it.

==Appearances==

*''[[The Art of Harry Potter Mini Book of Graphic Design]]''
*{{HM}} {{Portrait}}

}}'''Borys the Brute''' was a  [[hypnosis|hypnotist]] in the [[1920s]].

==Biography==
He was part of the [[Circus Arcanus]], a travelling freak show, which billed him as "perfidious" and warned people to "take heed of his artful deception."<ref name="poster">[http://store.minalima.com/shop/fantastic-beasts/limited-edition-prints/no-maj-street-posters/circus-arcanus-museum-of-human-oddities-poster/ MinaLima Store - Circus Arcanus - Museum of Human Oddities Poster] {{see image|File:Circus Arcanus.png}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Considering that the Circus Arcanus was magical, it seems likely that Borys could perform a [[magic]]al form of [[hypnosis]], possibly similar to that of [[Wampus cat]]s.

{{Quote|A paunchy man, holding a large black camera that was smoking slightly, was watching Fleur out of the corner of his eye.|Description|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}

'''Bozo''' was a photographer for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''. He appeared to be associated with [[Rita Skeeter]].

==Biography==
===1992===
{{Quote|Out of the way, there. This is for the ''Daily Prophet''.|Bozo treats Ron Weasley inconsiderately in pursuit of the perfect shot|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}Bozo<ref>{{PM}} - [http://www.pottermore.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/daily-prophet-photographer Daily Prophet Photographer]</ref> covered [[Gilderoy Lockhart]]'s book-signing at [[Flourish and Blotts]] in [[1992]], and was so single-mindedly focused on getting a good shot at one point that he backed into [[Ronald Weasley]], stepping on his foot as he snapped at him to get out of the way. When Lockhart saw that [[Harry Potter]] was in the crowd, he pulled Harry to the front and shook his hand, deliberately giving the photographer an opportunity to take pictures he felt would be "worth the front page."<ref>{{COS|B|4}}</ref>
===Triwizard Tournament===
Bozo was present at the [[wand weighing ceremony]] preceding the 1994 [[Triwizard Tournament]], accompanying Rita Skeeter to do a piece on the tournament for the ''Prophet''. He appeared to be entranced by [[Fleur Delacour]], as he attempted to bring her into greater prominence of the group shots he was taking, and was watching her out of the corner of his eye during the ceremony.<ref name=GOF18>{{GOF|B|18}}</ref>

Later that school year, Bozo accompanied Rita on a visit to the [[Three Broomsticks Inn]]. While there, Rita conferred with Bozo on the possibility of spinning a story out of [[Ludovic Bagman]] being pursued by a group of [[goblin]]s.<ref>{{GOF|B|24}}</ref>

==Physical appearance==
Bozo was described as ''"paunchy"''.<ref name=GOF18/>[[File:Photographer.jpg|thumb|The photographer in ''Chamber of Secrets'']]
==Etymology==
*A bozo is a foolish or incompetent person.<ref>[http://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/Bozo Bozo on the Merriam-Webster dictionary]</ref>
*The Tagalog word ''boso'' which means 'to maliciously watch/peek at somebody through a hole or slit.'<ref>[http://translate.sandayong.com/TRANSLATE/cebuano/english/boso Filipino - English definition of Boso]</ref>
*[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bozo_the_Clown Bozo] is also the name of an iconic American clown, and is at times considered a generic term for a clown.

==Behind the scenes==
*Bozo was portrayed by [[Peter O'Farrell]] in {{COS|FA}} and [[Robert Wilfort]] in {{GOF|FA}}.
*The photographer from ''Chamber of Secrets'' is not identified as the same wizard as Bozo in the books. {{PM}}, however, confirms them to be the same character by giving them a singular entry that describes them being the same person.
*In the second novel as well as the GBA version of the video game, Bozo was shown to have a rude personality, but in the film adaptation, he appears to have good manners.

}}'''Rudolf Brand''' was a [[Germany|German]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who was the [[Quidditch]] [[Captain]] of the [[Heidelberg Harriers]]. Following a seven-day match against the [[Holyhead Harpies]] in [[1953]], he proposed to his opposite number, [[Gwendolyn Morgan]]. She, in response, concussed him with her [[Cleansweep Five]] [[broomstick]].<ref name="QTA7">{{QTA|R|7}}</ref>

==Etymology==
"Rudolf" is from the Germanic name ''Hrodulf'', which was derived from the elements ''hrod'' "fame" and ''wulf'' "wolf". It was borne by three kings of Burgundy, as well as several Habsburg rulers of the Holy Roman Empire and [[Austria]].

==Appearances==

Surely you can sort out — well — anything!|Cornelius Fudge|The trouble is, the [[Death Eaters|other side]] can do magic too, Prime Minister.|The Prime Minister and [[Cornelius Fudge]]|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince}}
This '''Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland''', usually just referred to as the '''Prime Minister''' led the [[Great Britain|United Kingdom]] during [[1996]].<ref name="HBP1">{{HBP|B|1}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Meeting with the 'Other Minister'===
{{Dialogue a-b-a|Cornelius Fudge|The Minister of Magic only reveals him--or herself to the Muggle Prime Minister of the day. We find it the best way to maintain secrecy.|Prime Minister|But then, why hasn't a former Prime Minister warned me?|My dear Prime Minister, are you ever going to tell anybody?|The Prime Minister and [[Cornelius Fudge]]|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince}}

Before becoming Prime Minister, this man had a very hard and gruelling campaign in the 1980s. On the day he won the election in the early [[1990s]], he was greeted by the currently incumbent [[Minister for Magic]], [[Cornelius Fudge]], who told him about the [[Wizarding world|world of magic]]. The Muggle Minister was actually better at accepting this than his [[Prime Minister's predecessor|predecessor]], who thought Fudge was an attempt to sabotage the Prime Minister's career, and tried to throw the wizard out the window. The Prime Minister then tried to pretend none of this had happened. Despite Fudge's claim that they would probably never meet again after the first introduction, circumstances, essentially all the [[Second Wizarding War|Dark activities of the wizarding world]], colluded to render this statement invalid, much to the Prime Minister's discomfort.<ref name="HBP1"/>

In [[1993]], Fudge met with the Prime Minister to inform him that [[Sirius Black]] [[Azkaban escapes|escaped]] from [[Azkaban]].<ref name="HBP1"/> Since Black was convicted of murdering [[Peter Pettigrew]] and [[Peter Pettigrew's unidentified victims|twelve Muggle bystanders]] on a London street, and was thus a severe threat to both communities, Fudge felt that it was important that the Muggle Prime Minister be informed.<ref name="HBP1"/> As such, the event of his meeting was recorded in the [[Daily Prophet]].<ref name="PA3">{{POA|B|3}}</ref> Subsequently, the Prime Minister put out a warning to the Muggle communities that Black was a known serial killer, but not specifically a wizard.<ref name="POA2">{{POA|B|2}}</ref><ref name="HBP1"/>

In [[1994]], Fudge met with the Prime Minister to discuss the events of the [[Quidditch World Cup]], where several [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]s had been tortured by [[Death Eaters]], but declared that everything was fine and was being dealt with (i.e. covered up). He also informed the Prime Minister that they would be bringing three [[dragon]]s and a [[sphinx]] into the country, and as they were classified as highly dangerous creatures, it was in the rules that the Muggle Prime Minister had to be informed.<ref name="HBP1"/>

===Second Wizarding War===
[[File:Daily Prophet Prime Minister.jpg|300px|thumb|The [[Daily Prophet]] reports [[Rufus Scrimgeour|Scrimgeour's]] meeting with the Prime Minister]]

Early in [[1996]], Fudge met with the Minister to inform him of the mass breakout from Azkaban. Then, later in [[1996]], the Prime Minister was under pressure after the collapse of the [[Brockdale Bridge]], an alleged hurricane that had devastated parts of the South-West of [[England]], and two highly publicised murders one of which had taken place around the corner from [[Prime Minister's office|10 Downing Street]]. He was informed by the former [[Minister for Magic]] [[Cornelius Fudge]] that [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and his [[Death Eaters]] were responsible for these events, and introduced him to his own replacement as Minister for Magic, [[Rufus Scrimgeour]]. Scrimgeour told him that his Junior Minister, [[Herbert Chorley]], had been put under a poorly cast [[Imperius Curse]], which was the real reason he had been acting like a duck, and that he was being transferred to St Mungo's. Scrimgeour also informed him that his new secretary, [[Kingsley Shacklebolt]], was actually a highly skilled [[Auror]], placed there for his security.<ref name="HBP1"/>

Early in [[1997]], Scrimgeour met with the Prime Minister to inform him about the terror and all the deaths, including a [[Unidentified Muggle family|Muggle family]]; this meeting was briefly mentioned in the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' as an 'exclusive' story.<ref name="DHF1">{{DH|F1}}</ref>

His fate following the [[Second Wizarding War]] is unknown.

==Behind the scenes==
*The Prime Minister is never named in the series, and may be intended to be a fictional character. Since the Harry Potter series is set mostly in the 1990s the most likely real-life candidate would be [[wikipedia:John Major|Sir John Major]], the Prime Minister of Britain from 1990 to 1997. However during the last half of {{HBP}} and {{DH}}, there was a change of government in Britain and [[wikipedia:Tony Blair|Tony Blair]] became Prime Minister, serving from 1997 to 2007. Additionally, Fudge refers to his predecessor as "he", when in real life, it would have been [[wikipedia:Margaret Thatcher|Margaret Thatcher]].
*Winston Churchill was the [[Great Britain|British]] Prime Minister during [[Gellert Grindelwald|Grindelwald]]'s reign of terror in the [[1940s]], and would have had to cope with that while presiding over the largest Muggle war in history.
*It is unknown if he ever met [[Pius Thicknesse]], who briefly became Minister for Magic in 1997. It is highly unlikely, since Thicknesse was under the control of Lord Voldemort and likely would have not collaborated with the Prime Minister, let alone the fact that he was in control of the Muggle communities.
*Given that the Harry Potter series is fictional, it is entirely possible that this Prime Minister, and thus the previous Prime Minister as well, are none of the real life Prime Ministers of the United Kingdom, but entirely fictional ones with different names and identities. As Britain had, up until that date, had but one female Prime Minister, the pronoun "she" would be rather conclusive as to identity in the real-world.

'''Karl Broadmoor''', along with his brother, [[Kevin Broadmoor|Kevin]], was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[Beater]] for the [[Falmouth Falcons]] from [[1958]] to [[1969]]. Karl and Kevin earned no less than fourteen suspensions for their violent play and constant rule-breaking.<ref>{{QTA|R}}</ref>

==Etymology==
"Karl" is a German and Scandinavian form of ''Charles''. This was the name of seven emperors of Austria. Other famous bearers include Karl Marx (1818-1883), the German philosopher and revolutionary who laid the foundations for communism, and Karl Jaspers (1883-1969), a German existentialist philosopher.

'''Kevin Broadmoor''', along with his brother, [[Karl Broadmoor|Karl]] was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[Beater]] for the [[Falmouth Falcons]] from [[1958]] to [[1969]]. Kevin and Karl earned no less than fourteen suspensions for their violent play and constant rule-breaking.<ref>{{QTA|R}}</ref>

==Etymology==
"Kevin" is an anglicised form of the Irish name ''Caoimhín'', derived from the older Irish ''Cóemgein'', composed of the Old Irish elements ''cóem'' "kind, gentle, handsome" and ''gein'' "birth". Saint Caoimhín established a monastery in Glendalough, [[Ireland]] in the [[First millennium A.D.|6th century]] and is the patron saint of [[Dublin]]. It became popular in the English-speaking world outside of Ireland in the [[20th century]].

==Appearances==
*{{QTA|R}}
*{{HM}} {{Mention}}

'''Rupert "Axebanger" Brookstanton''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He was one of the individuals that [[Hermione Granger]] considered could be the mysterious [[Regulus Black|R.A.B]].<ref>{{HBP|B|30}}</ref>

==Etymology==
"Rupert" is a low German form of ''Robert''. The name was introduced to England in the 17th century by the military commander Prince Rupert of the Rhine, a nephew of Charles I.

'''Gordon Brown''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] British politician and [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]] sometime before the [[1990s]]. In July of [[1996]], chancellor [[Alistair Darling]] announced "controversial changes" to the [[capital gains tax]]. [[Mark Constantine]] told ''[[The Guardian]]'' that the measures would alienate the business community that Gordon Brown, as Chancellor, had fought to attract to the [[Labour Party]].<ref>{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:TheGuardian.png|this image]])</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
{{Quote|Hello Jo. I have just returned from India, China, other countries during the course of the last year, and every young person I've met, has been reading your books. You have done more for literacy and reading and helping young children start to read than I believe anybody in our country, indeed, anybody on this continent. So congratulations on your latest book. We're incredibly proud of what you've achieved.|Gordon Brown, "Harry Potter: A Blue Peter Special".|http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2007/0720-bluepeter.html}}
*The listing of [[Wikipedia:Gordon Brown|Gordon Brown]] as Chancellor of the Exchequer sometime before 1996 is anachronistic, as Brown ''was'' the chancellor at the time.
*[[J. K. Rowling]] has been a long-term friend of Gordon Brown, his family, and his party, donating £1 million to the Labour Party in [[September]] of [[2008]], being present during the birth of his son Fraiser, and supporting both him and his actions in various public statements.
*When asked what [[Hogwarts Houses|house]] she would sort Gordon Brown into if she were the [[Sorting Hat]], J. K. Rowling went with [[Gryffindor]], though she merely based her choice on the fact that both Gryffindor and the Labour Party use red for their colours.<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2007/0720-bluepeter.html 'Harry Potter: A Blue Peter Special.' Blue Peter (CBBC), July 20 2007.]</ref>

'''Mr Brown''' was a [[pure-blood]]<ref name="HPM"/> [[Wizardkind|wizard]], husband of [[Lavender Brown's mother|Mrs Brown]] and father of [[Lavender Brown|Lavender]]. In [[1993]], he and his wife sent a letter to Lavender, informing her that her pet [[rabbit]] [[Binky]] had been killed by a [[fox]].<ref name="POA8">{{POA|B|8}}</ref>

Prior to that school year, either Mr Brown or his wife signed a [[Hogsmeade permission form]] for Lavender.<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

On [[2 May]], [[1998]], his daughter died during the [[Battle of Hogwarts]] when she was attacked by [[Fenrir Greyback]].<ref name="PageToScreen">{{HPPS}}, page 215 - "Jessie Cave was also happy to come back, even knowing that Lavender Brown wasn't going to survive the final film. "She's not very lucky," the actress understates. "She doesn't meet a nice ending. She gets eaten by Fenrir Greyback. Cave recalls her death scene, which took several nights of shooting. "I had the most amazing prosthetic of a scar that looks so scary, it looked like I was actually mauled to death." </ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Lavender's parents are only mentioned in the French version of {{POA}}.

==Appearances==

'''John Buchanan'''<ref>[https://familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.1.1/XYK5-Q6P "Scotland, Births and Baptisms, 1564-1950," index, FamilySearch, Angus Buchanan, 15 Jan 1847]</ref> (c. [[1804]] - [[1 July]], [[1861]])<ref>[http://www.geni.com/people/John-Buchanan/6000000004044562628 "John Buchanan, Provost of Inveraray"] at [http://www.geni.com/family-tree/start Geni]</ref> was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who lived in the [[19th century]]. He was the husband of [[Angus Buchanan's mother|Mrs Buchanan]] and the father of eleven children, including [[Hamish Buchanan|Hamish]], [[Flora Buchanan|Flora]], and [[Angus Buchanan|Angus]].

==Biography==
The [[Buchanan family|Buchanans]] were a [[wizardkind|wizarding]] family with a long history. By the mid-[[19th century]], they had resided in a village in the [[Scottish Borders]] for many generations and were shunned by their [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] neighbours, who did not know that they were [[magic]]al. They had a reputation for being extremely large, aggressive, and drinking excessively, which lead the Muggle villagers to conclude that Buchanan children were sent to correctional facilities or institutionalised when they [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|mysteriously disappeared at eleven]].

Mr Buchanan and [[Angus Buchanan's mother|his wife]] had a noisy, chaotic home filled with eleven children. Described as a "fierce" and "proud" man, he held strong anti-[[Squib]] views, boasting that no Squib had ever been born into the Buchanan line, and asserting that the birth of a Squib meant that a wizarding family was "in decline" and deserved to be "winnowed out." However, he and his wife did not notice when their third-born son, [[Angus Buchanan|Angus]], failed to display signs of magical ability like all of his other siblings.

Angus, being the kindest and largest of the Buchanan children, was well-liked by his brothers and sisters. Mr Buchanan's children thus went to elaborate lengths to conceal Angus's Squib status from him and his wife. His daughter [[Flora Buchanan|Flora]] forged a [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] [[Hogwarts acceptance letter|acceptance letter]] for her younger brother, and, on [[1 September]], [[1858]], the day that eleven-year-old Angus was due to begin his [[first year]] at Hogwarts, his son [[Hamish Buchanan|Hamish]] carried his little brother to [[Hogwarts Castle]] on his [[Hamish Buchanan's broomstick|broomstick]].

The ruse was revealed when the [[Sorting Hat]] declined to sort Angus. News soon reached Mr Buchanan and his wife by [[owl]]. Humiliated, he refused to allow his son into the house when he finally arrived home on foot, telling him never to show his face again and chasing him away with [[curse]]s.

After his disownment, Angus made his own way in the Muggle world, eventually coming to play for the [[Scottish rugby team]]. Mr Buchanan forbade his other children from ever seeing Angus again, but, despite this, all ten of them turned out to support their brother at the Scottish team's first international match.<ref name="Pottermore">{{WW|scottish-rugby}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*While this individual is never explicitly named on {{PM}}, [https://familysearch.org/pal:/MM9.1.1/XYK5-Q6P Angus Buchanan's birth record] says his father was called "John Buchanan".

==Appearances==

'''Burgock''' was a [[Goblin]] who worked at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]] at some point in [[1990]]. Like most goblins, he was rather suspicious of most [[Wizardkind|wizards]], including the [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] students that visited the bank looking for [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]]. He did, however, appear quite friendly with his colleague and fellow goblin, [[Odbert]].<ref name="HM6">{{HM|6|The Dragon's Treasure|1}}</ref>

Burgock suffered from a [[bronze]] [[allergy]]; for that reason, he made an effort to propose the abolishment of the [[knut]].<ref name="HM6"/>

[[Belvina Black]] married [[Herbert Burke]], and they had three children: '''two sons''' and [[Belvina Burke's daughter|one daughter]]. They were all [[pure-blood]] and related through Belvina to the [[House of Black|Black family]].

These two [[Wizardkind|wizards]] were grandsons of famous [[Phineas Nigellus Black]], who was a [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]]. They likely attended the school.

They had a [[Belvina Burke's daughter|sister]].<ref name="BFT">''[[House of Black|Black family tree]]''</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
It is possible that one of the sons is Caractacus Burke, yet this is unconfirmed. However, this would mean that Caractacus could not possibly be the founder of [[Borgin and Burkes]] which would suggest that it was another relative; possibly [[Herbert Burke]], that founded the shop.

{{Quote|Caractacus Burke was not famed for his generosity.|[[Albus Dumbledore]] describing Burke's greedy personality|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince}}
'''Caractacus Burke''' (fl. [[1846]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who was one of the original founders of [[Borgin and Burkes]].<ref name=shop /> Caractacus was one of the people [[Albus Dumbledore]] interviewed to find out more about [[Tom Riddle|Voldemort's]] past. Dumbledore learned from Caractacus' memory that [[Merope Riddle|Merope Gaunt]] came to him when she was destitute, and sold him [[Salazar Slytherin's Locket]] for ten [[Wizarding currency|Galleons]]. Dumbledore apparently had a low opinion of him, while not directly calling Burke a greedy man, he strongly implied it by saying that it had been the kind of reputation Burke had earned.<ref name="HBP13">{{HBP|B|13}}</ref>

After [[Tom Riddle]] had graduated from [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]], Burke hired him to research and acquire items for him. Riddle had done a very good job at this, and Burke was very surprised when Tom Riddle disappeared out of the blue one day without tending any notice to him.<ref name="HBP20">{{HBP|B|20}}</ref>

What ultimately happened to Burke is unknown, but by [[1992]], the shop seemed to be exclusively operated by Mr [[Borgin]].<ref name="COS4">{{COS|B|4}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Early life===
Burke was born in or before 1846.<ref name=DOB />

===As shop-owner===
{{Quote|Yes, we acquired it in curious circumstances. It was brought in by a young witch just before Christmas, oh, many years ago now. She said she needed the gold badly, well, that much was obvious. Covered in rags and pretty far along ... going to have a baby, see. She said [[Salazar Slytherin's locket|the locket]] had been Slytherin's. Well, we hear that sort of story all the time, 'Oh this was [[Merlin]]'s, this was, his favourite teapot,' but when I looked at it, it had his mark all right, and a few simple spells were enough to tell me the truth. Of course, that made it near enough priceless. She didn't seem to have any idea how much it was worth. Happy to get ten [[Galleon]]s for it. Best bargain we ever made!|Caractacus Burke on his encounter with [[Merope Riddle|Merope Gaunt]]|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince}}

In [[1863]], Burke founded the shop [[Borgin and Burkes]] with his partner [[Borgin]]. The shop is located in [[Knockturn Alley]], an infamous street specialising in shops that sell [[Dark Arts]] items When Burke ran the shop he was known for taking advantage of people and driving hard bargains. This was demonstrated when, in [[December]], [[1926]], he was visited by [[Merope Riddle|Merope Gaunt]], a [[pure-blood]] descendant of [[Salazar Slytherin]]. Merope was destitute, and heavily pregnant with [[Tom Riddle]]. She wished to sell an [[Salazar Slytherin's Locket|artefact]], the locket that had belonged to her famous ancestor. Burke was hesitant to accept her claims, having heard many such tales, but a few spells were able to confirm that she was telling the truth. He took advantage of her ignorance and desperation and paid her much less than its true value, about 10 [[Galleon]]s worth. Burke later sold the locket to [[Hepzibah Smith]], though he was desperate to get it back due to the historical value.<ref name="HBP13"/>

In [[1945]], Burke hired [[Tom Riddle]], the son of the woman who sold Slytherin's locket to him (a fact Burke never knew). Burke tasked the young Riddle to persuade people to sell their valuable artefacts to the shop, a feat Tom was very skilled in. One such task was to persuade Hepzibah to sell a [[Hepzibah Smith's goblin-made armour|goblin-made armour]], which Burke had to make an improved offer at 500 galleons. Shortly after this, Hepzibah died from an alleged accidental poisoning and during the investigations Riddle disappeared without so much as a resignation notice, much to Caractacus' astonishment.<ref name="HBP20"/>

It's unknown what happened to Burke after Tom left, though by the [[1990s]] [[Borgin]] appeared to run the shop alone.<ref name="COS4"/> It's also unknown if he recognised Lord Voldemort as his former employee or if he was still alive to see him wage war. Though Dumbledore's speaking about Burke in past tense in [[1997]], is an indication that he was deceased by then.<ref name="HBP13"/>

==Etymology==
[[wikipedia:Caratacus|Caractacus]] was a British hero who fought the Roman invaders. Burke is reportedly named after [[Wikipedia:Burke and Hare murders|Irishman William Burke]], a bizarre serial killer who, with help from a partner, murdered dozens of people in Edinburgh in the late 1820s, selling the bodies as fresh cadavers to a local medical school. 'Burk' or 'berk' is also a British term for an annoying and stupid person, with an original meaning in Cockney Rhyming Slang which is far stronger. Caractacus was also the first name of the character played by Dick Van Dyke in the film ''Chitty Chitty Bang Bang''.

'''Herbert Burke''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who married the pure-blood witch [[Belvina Black]]. Given that Belvina was not disowned by her [[House of Black|family]], who believed strongly in [[Blood status|blood purity]], it is likely that Herbert was a [[pure-blood]]. The couple had [[Belvina Burke's sons|two sons]] and [[Belvina Burke's daughter|one daughter]].<ref>[[House of Black|Black family tree]]</ref> Herbert may be related to [[Caractacus Burke]] of [[Borgin and Burkes]].

==Etymology==
"[[wikipedia:Herbert (name)|Herbert]]" is derived from the Germanic elements ''hari'', "army" and ''beraht'', "bright". The Normans introduced this name to England, where it replaced an Old English cognate ''Herebeorht''. In the course of the Middle Ages it became rare, but it was revived in the 19th century.

There was a real person with this name, [[wikipedia:J. Herbert Burke|J. Herbert Burke]].

''Burke'' means "fortified hill".<ref>[[wikipedia:Burke (surname)|Burke (surname)]]</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP|F}} {{Comment|Appears on Black family tapestry}}
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}

'''Haniball Carathi''' was an artist who worked in an unknown period. One of his known works was a "little piece" of "our Ladie" (i.e., [[Mary]]) with the presumably infant [[Jesus]] "upon her right hand." A catalogue listing for this work was incorporated into the label of the [[Belch Powder]] box.<ref>''Label Collection'' book in the {{HPWC}} box set {{see image|File:BelchPowder.jpg}}.</ref>

'''Mauricio Carneiro''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] fashion designer. Some of his creations were were featured in the [[Costume Materialization]] collection opening that was held on [[28 September]], [[1997]], along with other designs from fellow fashion designers [[Emma Vane (Muggle)|Emma Vane]] and [[Julia Dehoff]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} {{see image|File:CostumeMaterialization.jpg}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was named after Mauricio Carneiro, who worked as a costume illustrator for every [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' film]] from ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Goblet of Fire]]'' onward, and as a costumer for ''[[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)|Order of the Phoenix]]'' and ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Half-Blood Prince]]''.<ref>"[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1769188/ Mauricio Carneiro]" on IMDb</ref>

}}'''Oliver Cartwright'''<ref name="LE">{{HPLE}}</ref> was a [[Wizardkind|wizarding]] painter. He painted the [[portrait]] of [[Tobias Misslethorpe]] that hung at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="LE"/>

==Etymology==
"Oliver" is from ''Olivier'', a Norman French form of a Germanic name such as ''Alfher'' or an Old Norse name such as ''Áleifr''. The spelling was altered by association with Latin ''oliva'' "olive tree". In the [[Middle Ages]] the name became well-known in Western Europe because of the French epic ''La Chanson de Roland'', in which Olivier was a friend and advisor of the hero Roland.

In England Oliver was a common medieval name, however it became rare after the 17th century because of the military commander Oliver Cromwell, who ruled the country following the civil war. The name was revived in the [[19th century]], perhaps in part due to the title character in [[Charles Dickens]]' novel ''Oliver Twist'' ([[1838]]).

==Appearances==
*''[[Harry Potter (film series)|Harry Potter]]'' films {{Comment|Name seen on portrait}}

The only '''son''' of [[Caspar Crouch]] and [[Charis Black]] was a [[pure-blood]] wizard.<ref name="BFT">[[House of Black|Black family tree]]</ref> He had [[Caspar Crouch's daughters|two sisters]].

==Behind the scenes==
*It is possible that Caspar Crouch’s son was [[Bartemius Crouch Senior|Bartemius Crouch Snr]], who is described as an "elderly man" at the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup]]. This is supported by the fact that he and [[Bartemius Crouch Junior|his son]] were the last of their family. However, Caspar Crouch’s wife, [[Charis Black|Charis]], was born in [[1919]], so her son could be born no earlier than [[1936]], which makes it unlikely that he would be described as "elderly" in [[1994]]. But Rowling wrote all but the first chapter of ''Goblet of Fire'' in the third-person limited point-of-view, which means that the description of Crouch as "elderly" actually represents [[Harry Potter|Harry Potter’s]] perception. A 58-year-old man might appear "elderly" to a 14-year-old boy, and it is also quite plausible that the tribulations Crouch went through during the First War would have prematurely aged him. Also, terms like "elderly" can be loosely used, without kind of mathematical rigour, especially by young people; for instance, [[Walburga Black]] in [[Walburga Black's portrait|her portrait]] was described as "old", despite not being more than sixty-years-old when the portrait was made<ref>[[House of Black#Black family tree|Black family tree]]</ref>. It should also be taken into account that Rowling's maths on the Black family tree are characteristically bad; [[Pollux Black|two]] [[Cygnus Black III|people]] become fathers at the age of thirteen. Charis and her son might have been intended to be older than they appear to be.
*If Caspar Crouch's son is Barty Crouch Snr, then Barty Crouch and Arthur Weasley are first cousins and Crouch's personal assistant Percy Weasley is his first cousin once removed. This relationship is not mentioned at all in {{GOF}}, though neither Crouch nor Arthur would be proud to admit that their mothers were daughters of the notorious [[House of Black]].

==Appearances==
*''[[J. K. Rowling's official site|J. K. Rowling Official Site]]''

{{Quote|...there are few pure-blood families to whom I am not related.... A pity.... that the same cannot be said for you. ''‘Parents professions: greengrocers’''.|[[Dolores Umbridge]] during [[Mary Cattermole]]'s trial|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows}}
The '''father''' of [[Mary Cattermole]] was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[greengrocer]], as was his [[Mary Cattermole's mother|wife]].<ref name="DH13"/>

Their daughter was a [[Muggle-born]] witch who eventually married [[Reginald Cattermole]] and had three children. Her [[blood status]] caused her trial with the [[Muggle-Born Registration Commission]] in [[1997]], when [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] infiltrated the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]]. On her questionnaire, she mentioned her parents' professions, which was inadvisable, as it made it extremely obvious to the unsympathetic regime at the time that she had no blood ancestry. Fortunately, [[Harry Potter]], [[Hermione Granger]], and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]], who were all in disguise, saved Mary from going to prison and advised her to flee the country.<ref name="DH13">{{DH|B|13}}</ref>

'''Arturo Cephalopos''' was a [[wandmaker]] in the [[19th century]]. During this period, [[silver lime]] was fashionable as a [[wand wood]]. He claimed that its alleged association with [[divination]] was "a falsehood circulated by merchants like [[Gerbold Ollivander]], who have overstocked their workshops with it and hope to shift their surplus." However, according to Gerbold's grandson [[Garrick Ollivander]], Cephalopos was a "slipshod wandmaker" and "an ignoramus," who, to no one's surprise, went out of business.<ref name="wands">Pottermore wand wood information (transcription available [http://archive.is/20130109102909/lady-slytherin-forever.tumblr.com/post/8977740275/wand-woods-off-of-pottermore here])</ref>

==Etymology==
Cephalopos might be of Greek origin (at least in his ancestry), as his surname's etymology (as well as surname formation) suggests.
*"''Arturo''" is the Italian/Spanish form of "Arthur", whose meaning is unknown. It could be derived from British ''art'' "bear" combined with ''viros'' "man", or it could be related to Irish ''art'' "stone". Alternatively it could be related to an obscure Roman family name ''Artorius''. Arthur is the name of the central character in Arthurian legend, a 6th-century king of the Britons who presided over the knights of the Round Table.
*"''Cephalopos''" is a likely Greek compound word (though it resembles nothing like a modern Greek surname):
**"''cephalo''" from the Ancient Greek κεφαλή ‎(''kephalḗ''), meaning "head" (in biology, the "brain"), and is the origin of the English prefix "cephalo-" & suffix "-cephalic" .
**"''pos''" from either:
***πούς ‎(''poús''), meaning "leg/foot" (and thru its derivative "ποδός" (''podós''), the origin of the English prefix "-pod")
***πως ‎(''pōs''), Greek adverb meaning "how?" or "in what way?"
**Put together, "''cephalopos''" suggests an individual with a low intelligence, essentially a foreshadowing of his character ("ignoramus") & fate (his wand business came under).

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}

An '''official''' who presided over ceremonies such as weddings and funerals, this [[Wizardkind|wizard]] was described as being small and tufty-haired, with a singsong voice.<ref name="DH8">{{DH|B|8}}</ref>

==History==
In the summer of [[1997]], he presided over the [[Funeral of Albus Dumbledore|funeral]] of [[Albus Dumbledore]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]]<ref name="HBP30">{{HBP|B|30}}</ref> and at the [[Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour|wedding]] of [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]] and [[Fleur Delacour]] at [[the Burrow]].<ref name="DH8" /> Given his occupation, he may be an employee of the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]].

==Behind the scenes==
*The uncredited role of "Wizard Priest"<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4413907 Mick Fryer-Kelsey's profile on IMDb]</ref> was played by [[Mick Fryer-Kelsey]] in the [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1|first part of the film adaptation]] of {{DH}}. In his Twitter profile, Fryer-Kelsey clarified that he played the man that appears in "''the [[:File:DH-harry-potter-16204581-400-264.jpg|wedding picture of Luna and her father]]''" that featured in an [http://harrypotter.wikia.com/wiki/Wedding_of_William_Weasley_and_Fleur_Delacour?oldid=612088 old revision] of the [[Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour]] article here at the [[Main Page|Harry Potter Wiki]].<ref>[https://twitter.com/tramp666 mick fryer-kelsey (@tramp666)] on Twitter: [https://twitter.com/tramp666/status/119512732029562880 "the wedding picture of Luna and her father i'm the one int middle,"]</ref><ref>[https://twitter.com/tramp666 mick fryer-kelsey (@tramp666)] on Twitter: [https://twitter.com/tramp666/status/119508389175894017 "Photo in Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour on Harry Potter Wiki"]</ref>

'''Mauricius Carneirus''' was a [[wizardkind|wizarding]] pick-up guru.<ref name="artifactvault">{{HPV|A}} {{see image|File:HowToWooWitches.jpg}}</ref> He developed the "[[Carneirus Method]]" of wooing witches, which was covered in his book, ''[[How to Woo Witches]]''.<ref name="artifactvault" />

This '''individual''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who, in [[1544]], held the post of [[Chief Warlock]] of the [[Wizengamot]].<ref name="WonderbookGameDeubt">[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qFbYrN1bPJg&feature=related "Wonderbook - E3 2012: Game Debut"] from [http://www.youtube.com/user/gametrailers?feature=watch GameTrailers]</ref>

On [[16 July]], [[1544]], the Chief Warlock was invited by [[Jarleth Hobart]] to witness his "maiden flight" — a public demonstration of his own revolutionary [[Levitation Charm]] on himself. Hobart climbed onto the roof of his local church and, after several speeches and a rousing performance of the national anthem he leapt and, having cast the spell, was left hovering in mid-air. At first, he seemed to have succeeded<ref name="WonderbookGameDeubt"/> but, after having spent nearly three minutes watching him hanging in mid-air, the crowd grew impatient to see him move somewhere, and booed him.

In response to the catcalls, Hobart tried to move in midair, and started performing vigorous swimming movements, which produced no effect. Mistakingly believing that his clothes were making him heavier and impeding his movement, Hobart stripped thus making him fall ten feet onto the ground below, as it were the clothes that were holding him up in the air — ''they'' had been charmed by the Levitation Charm, not Hobart himself. He fell completely naked on the ground, breaking sixteen bones, and went on the receive a fine for "outrageous silliness" from the Chief Warlock. 

Hobart returned home, humiliated, where he realised that his spell could make objects levitate for varying lengths of time, depending on the skill of the spellcaster and on the weight of the object. He also concluded that small animals or even children could be levitated, but that they had no control whatsoever of their movement once airborne.

After realising that the spell was best used on inanimate objects (and small animals, but they do not have any control of their movement once airborne), Hobart made a second announcement, and an even larger crowd gathered to see his second demonstration of the spell (hoping for another laugh at his expense). Hobart's demonstration was, at first, by far more successful than the first one: he showed the onlookers how he could easily levitate objects ranging from small rocks to fallen trees. Hobart decided that, for a finale, we would levitate the Chief Warlock's hat — what he managed to levitate, however, was the Chief's wig, exposing his bald head to the gathered crowd. The Chief was not amused, and was determined to [[Duelling|duel]] Hobart, but the warlock levitated the Chief's robes over his head, and ran for it.

'''Jeremy Clarkson''' is a [[Great Britain|British]] broadcaster and journalist best known as the co-presenter of the [[television]] programme ''[[Top Gear]]''. In [[2015]], the [[wikipedia:BBC|BBC]] announced it was cancelling Clarkson's contract after he verbally and physically attacked one of the show's producers, thus leading to an [[Internet|online]] petition to reinstate him.<ref name="twitter"/>

Among those who signed the petition was [[Vernon Dursley]], who stated that ''Top Gear'' was the only reason he paid his [[wikipedia:television licence|television licence]], which all British households are required to pay yearly in order to legally view television broadcasts.<ref name="twitter">[https://twitter.com/jk_rowling/status/622157481582698496 Tweet from J.K. Rowling]</ref>

}}'''João Coelho''' was a [[South America]]n [[wizardkind|wizard]] who, as of [[2016]], was the Captain of the [[Tarapoto Tree-Skimmers]], a world-renowned [[Quidditch]] [[Quidditch#Known Quidditch teams|team]] from [[Peru]]. He received his magical education at [[Castelobruxo]] in [[Brazil]].<ref name="WW">{{WW|castelobruxo}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*"''João''" (pronounced [ʒwɐ̃u̯]) is the Portuguese form of the name [[John (disambiguation)|John]]. "''[[Wikipedia:Coelho (surname)|Coelho]]''" (pronounced [kwˈe.ʎu]) is a Brazilian and Portuguese surname, and it translates as "rabbit".

==Behind the scenes==
*While his name is of Portuguese origin and [[Brazil]] is the only Portuguese-speaking country in South America, he captained a [[Peru]]vian Quidditch team. His attendance of Castelobruxo gives no indication of his nationality, as the school accepts students from all over South America.

'''Mark Constantine''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] entrepreneur and the co-founder of the [[Lush]] cosmetics company. In July of [[1996]], [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]] [[Alistair Darling]] announced "controversial changes" to the [[capital gains tax]]. Mark Constantine told ''[[The Guardian]]'' that the measure would alienate the business community that [[Gordon Brown]], as Chancellor, had fought to attract to the [[Labour Party]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:TheGuardian.png|this image]])</ref>

{{Quote|"Who else had a key, then? There's been a spare key hanging in the gardener's cottage as long as I can remember! Nobody forced the door last night! No broken windows! All Frank had to do was creep up to the big house while we was all sleeping...|Cook at the Hanged Man|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}

The '''cook''' working at [[The Hanged Man]] was a resident of [[Little Hangleton]] in [[1943]]. When all three [[Riddle family|Riddles]] living in the area were murdered in their own [[Riddle House|house]], and [[Frank Bryce]] was framed for the murder (the real murderer being [[Tom Riddle|Voldemort]]) the townsfolk gossiped about it all around town. That night, many residents converged at the Hanged Man, the local tavern, to voice their opinions, the cook being one of them. He, like the rest, believed Frank had committed the murder.<ref>{{GOF|B|1}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*His statement about knowing of a key hanging in Frank's shed implies that he had visited the place at least once.

'''Buckley Cooper''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who wrote to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' advice page.<ref name="DP">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[1 June]], [[1999]], Problem Page</ref> He had a long-running feud with his [[Buckley Cooper's brother|brother]] and wanted to know if the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] would ignore it if he got revenge for the [[curse]]d [[broomstick]] he had been sent by abducting his brother's children and turning them into [[vampire]] [[ferret]]s. In his reply, [[Dempster Wiggleswade]] warned Cooper not to go through with these actions.<ref name="DP" />

'''Howland Coopey''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who sent a letter to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'s'' advice column<ref name=":0">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[1 June]], [[1999]], Problem Page</ref>. He was sick and wanted to know if the symptoms he was experiencing — a green-and-purple rash between his toes and sparks coming out of his nostrils when he sneezed — were cause for concern. In his reply, [[Helbert Spleen|Professor Spleen]] informed Coopey that he was suffering from a ''"simple case"'' of [[Dragon Pox]]<ref name=":0" />. Oddly, despite Dragon Pox being potentially fatal, Professor Spleen does not recomned he go to St Mungo's, but rather to "immerse [his] nose continually in ice cold water<ref>https://www.hp-lexicon.org/thing/problem-page/im-turning-purple/</ref>."
==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]''

'''Gregory Cotton''' (fl. [[1999]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[Seeker]] for the [[Appleby Arrows]].<ref name="wizardsc">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/c.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: C]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref> 

==Biography==
During a match with the [[Pride of Portree]], he collided with the opposing team's Seeker, [[Dougal McBride]], while both were locked in a race to catch the [[Golden Snitch]].<ref name="wizardsc" /><ref name="wizardsm">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/m.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: M]" on The Harry Potter Lexicon</ref><ref name="dp">"[http://www.hplex.info/about/sources/source_dp.html Daily Prophet newsletters]" on The Harry Potter Lexicon</ref> Cotton came out with the Snitch in his hand, but an altercation with McBride ensued, during which [[jinx]]es were illegally exchanged, and McBride [[transfiguration|transfigured]] Cotton's head into a cabbage.<ref name="wizardsc" /><ref name="dp" /> McBride defended his actions to the referee, [[Josiah Plunkett]], by claiming that Cotton had hit him with a [[Jelly-Fingers Curse]] during the race for the Snitch, and thus deserved to be "cabbaged."<ref name="wizardsm" /><ref name="wizardsp">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/p.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: P]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Gregory" is the English form of Latin ''Gregorius'', which was from the Late Greek name Γρηγοριος (''Gregorios''), derived from γρηγορος (''gregoros'') meaning "watchful, alert". This name was popular among early Christians, being borne by a number of important saints including Saint Gregory Thaumaturgus (3rd century), Saint Gregory of Nyssa (4th century), Saint Gregory of Nazianzus (4th century), and Saint Gregory of Tours (6th century). It was also borne by the 6th-century pope Saint Gregory I the Great, a reformer and Doctor of the Church, as well as 15 subsequent popes.

'''Stuart Craggius''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] whose name was carved into wood panelling on a wall of [[Sybill Trelawney|Professor Trelawney]]'s [[Divination]] classroom.<ref>{{POA|F}} - Chapter 21 (''Professor Trelawney's Prediction'')</ref>

==Etymology==
From an occupational surname originally belonging to a person who was a steward. It is ultimately derived from Old English ''stig'' "house" and ''weard'' "guard". As a given name, it arose in 19th-century Scotland in honour of the Stuart royal family, which produced several kings and queens of Scotland and Britain between the 14th and 18th centuries.

==Behind the scenes==
*This character's name is presumably a tribute to [[Stuart Craig]], who was the production designer on of all the ''Harry Potter'' [[Harry Potter (film series)|films]].

==Appearances==
*{{POA|F}} {{C|Name seen on wood panelling}}

'''Mr Creevey''' was the father of [[Colin Creevey|Colin]] and [[Dennis Creevey]]. A [[Non-magic people|Muggle]], Mr Creevey was employed as a [[milk]]man, and was astonished to learn that his elder son, Colin, was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. Colin sent plenty of photographs home to his father during his [[first year]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in [[1992]], a high proportion, presumably, of [[Harry Potter]], who was an object of near-worship for young Colin.<ref name="COS6">{{COS|B|6}}</ref>

{{Quote|Just as the human mind cannot comprehend time, so it cannot comprehend the damage that will ensue if we presume to tamper with its laws.|Professor Saul Croaker on [[time]] travel|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}
'''Professor Saul Croaker'''<ref name="PM" /> (fl. 1994) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[Unspeakable]] for the [[Department of Mysteries]], having spent his entire career studying [[time]]-[[magic]].<ref name="PM" />

==Biography==
[[Professor Croaker’s law]] was named for him. Croaker attended the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup]] final, either attending with or meeting fellow Unspeakable [[Broderick Bode]]. Croaker was among the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry]] employees that passed by the [[Weasley family]]'s campsite.<ref name="GOF7">{{GOF|B|7}}</ref>

==Etymology==
A ''"Croaker"'' is someone who habitually predicts evil; it has that sense because croaking is a noise made by [[crow]]s and [[raven]]s, who are considered [[death]] omens, as they are carrion eaters.

{{Quote|Powerful infatuation can be induced by the skilful [[potioneer]], but never yet has anyone managed to create the truly unbreakable, eternal, unconditional attachment that alone can be called love.|Hector Dagworth-Granger regarding love|The Tales of Beedle the Bard (real)}}
'''Hector Dagworth-Granger''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], the founder of the [[Most Extraordinary Society of Potioneers]].<ref name="HBP9"/>

==Biography==
He was known to understand that no such [[Potion|elixir]] has been created to control and create [[love]] (as [[love potion]]s only induce powerful infatuations). Among many other leading potioneers, Hector Dagworth-Granger doubted that it was possible to create such a truly unbreakable and eternal affection.<ref name="TBBE">{{TBB|E}}</ref>

In [[1996]], [[Horace Slughorn]] asked [[Hermione Granger]] if she was related to Dagworth-Granger during their first [[Potions (class)|potions]] lesson in her sixth year. She replied that she did not believe so, since she was [[Muggle-born]].<ref name="HBP9">{{HBP|B|9}}</ref> However, Hermione's closest magical ancestors were probably [[Squib]]s and would have lost all knowledge of [[magic]] from their family. Hence, Hermione could be related to him.

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Potion]]s''': Dagworth-Granger was a highly accomplished and knowledgeable [[potioneer]], and was the founder of the [[Most Extraordinary Society of Potioneers]], showing his expertise in the field.<ref name="HBP9"/><ref name="TBBE"/> In particular, he had considerable knowledge on the nature of [[love potion]]s and their effects.<ref name="TBBE"/>

==Etymology==
*The name "Hector" is the Latinized form of Greek ‘Εκτωρ (''Hektor''), which was derived from ‘εκτωρ (''hektor'') "holding fast", ultimately from εχω (''echo'') meaning "to hold, to possess". In Greek legend Hector was one of the Trojan champions who fought against the Greeks and was the brother of [[Wikipedia:Paris_(mythology)|Prince Paris]]. After he killed Achilles' friend Patroclus in battle, he was himself brutally slain by Achilles, who proceeded to tie his dead body to a chariot and drag it about. Paris then in turn slew Achilles with a poisoned arrow that he shot at Achilles' only vulnerable point, his ankle.
*The name "Hector" also appears Arthurian legends belonging to King Arthur's foster father. Hector has occasionally been used as a given name since the Middle Ages, probably because of the noble character of the classical hero. It was historically common in Scotland, where it was used as an Anglicised form of Eachann.

==Appearances==
*{{HBP}} {{1st Mention}}
*{{TBB}} {{1st}}

'''Alistair Darling''' was a British politician and [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]] in the mid-to-late [[1990s]]. In July of [[1996]], Darling announced "controversial changes" to the [[capital gains tax]]. As the protests grew louder, shadow chancellor [[George Osborne]] said his party would be campaigning to overturn this measure. These events were covered by ''[[The Guardian]]''.<ref>{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:TheGuardian.png|this image]])</ref> He was also one of the many people who attempted to have the [[portrait in the Prime Minister's office]] removed, although he like all of the others failed to do so.

==Behind the scenes==
*The listing of [[Wikipedia:Alistair Darling|Alistair Darling]] as the Chancellor of the Exchequer in 1996 is anachronistic, as Darling was only appointed to the office in [[2007]]. Indeed, at the time, was a member of [[Wikipedia:Tony Blair|Tony Blair]]'s Shadow Cabinet as the Shadow Chief Secretary to the Treasury.

==Appearances==

{{Quote|Caradoc Dearborn, disappeared six months after the photograph, we didn't ever find his body...|Caradoc's disappearance|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}
'''Caradoc Dearborn''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and member of the original [[Order of the Phoenix]]. He fought in the [[First Wizarding War]] and was presumably murdered by [[Death Eaters]] before the end of the war. His body was never found.<ref name="OOTP9"/>

==Biography==
During the [[First Wizarding War]], Caradoc became a member of the [[Order of the Phoenix]], an organisation led and founded by [[Albus Dumbledore]], in order to oppose the [[Tom Riddle|Dark Lord Voldemort]] and his [[Death Eaters]].<ref name="OOTP9"/>

During the height of the conflict, Caradoc vanished and was never heard from afterwards. According to [[Alastor Moody]], he disappeared six months after the photograph of the original Order was taken. His body was never found and he was presumed dead.<ref name="OOTP9">{{OOTP|B|9}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Magic]]al skills''': To be a member of the [[Order of the Phoenix]], it is highly likely that Caradoc was a talented wizard and most likely used his magical ability in a number of battles against the [[Death Eaters]] before his untimely death.<ref name="OOTP9" />

==Etymology==
[[Wikipedia:Caradoc|Caradoc]], sometimes known as ''Caradog'', was one of the Knights of the Round Table in Arthurian legend. He was also a semi-legendary ancestor of the mediaeval kings of the Welsh [[Wikipedia:Kingdom of Gwent|Kingdom of Gwent]]. ''Caractacus'' is the Latinized form of Caradoc.<ref>[http://webspace.webring.com/people/ge/edgarbook/names/frames.html Edgar's Name Pages]</ref>

{{Dialogue a-b-c|Waiter|Dragon tartare?|Hermione Granger|No, I'm fine. Thank you.|Waiter|Just as well. They give one horribly bad breath.|Waiter and Hermione Granger|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)}}
This '''waiter''' served food and drinks at the [[Slug Club]] [[Christmas]] [[Slug Club Christmas party|party]] in [[1996]] along with [[Neville Longbottom]] and [[Waiter serving Dragon Tartare|another waiter]]. He was seen passing by when [[Horace Slughorn]] and [[Harry Potter]] were having their picture taken. He offered [[dragon tartare]] to [[Harry Potter]] and [[Hermione Granger]]. Both passed, and the waiter told them this choice was for the better, as the ''hors d'oeuvre'' gave one ''"terribly bad breath."'' However, upon hearing this, Hermione took the entire plate, hoping to repel the unwelcome attentions of her date, [[Cormac McLaggen]]. He was later seen decorating a plate of food.<ref name="HBPF">{{HBP|F}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This waiter is played by [[Mark Lockyer]] in {{HBP|FA}}.
*In the book, house elves are the entirety of service staff at the party.

{{Quote|Monsieur Delacour was nowhere near as attractive as his wife; he was a head shorter and extremely plump, with a little, pointed black beard. However, he looked good-natured. Bouncing towards Mrs Weasley on high-heeled boots, he kissed her twice on each cheek, leaving her flustered.|Harry Potter's first impression of Monsieur Delacour|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows}}
'''M. Delacour''' was a [[France|French]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], married to the [[half-Veela]] witch [[Apolline Delacour]]. He and Apolline had two daughters, [[Fleur Delacour|Fleur]] and [[Gabrielle Delacour|Gabrielle]]. Both of whom loved him dearly and affectionately referred to him as "''papa"''.<ref name="DH6" /> In 1997 Fleur married [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]] and through this marriage the family became in-laws of the Weasleys.

==Biography==
===Early life===
Little is known of Monsieur Delacour's earlier life, including where he received his education, where he was born and what his childhood and early adulthood were like. There is no indication of his profession.

At some point throughout his life, he met [[Apolline Delacour|Apolline]], who he married and who therefore took his name.<ref name="DH6"/> With her, he had two daughters, [[Fleur Delacour|Fleur]] and [[Gabrielle Delacour|Gabrielle]], both of whom eventually attended [[Beauxbatons Academy of Magic]].

===1995===
In [[1995]], he and his wife travelled to [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in [[Scotland]], where they visited Fleur there, before she took part in the Third Task of the [[Triwizard Tournament]].<ref name="GOF31">{{GOF|B|31}}</ref>

===Fleur's wedding===
His elder daughter Fleur was twenty years old when she finally wed [[William Weasley]] on [[1 August]], [[1997]].<ref name="DH6"/> Monsieur Delacour and his wife arrived shortly before the wedding to assist with the preparations, and proved to be kind, polite and extremely helpful.<ref name="DH6"/> He declared absolutely everything to be "''charmant''," and on the day before the wedding gifted an [[enchanted razor]] to [[Harry Potter]] for his seventeenth birthday.<ref name="DH6"/>

M. Delacour was last seen listening to [[Kingsley Shacklebolt]]'s warning, delivered through his [[Patronus Charm|Patronus]] which took the form of a [[lynx]], shortly before the [[Death Eaters]] attacked the wedding.<ref name="DH8"/> He, his wife and his children survived the attack and went into hiding, Fleur to [[Shell Cottage]] with her husband and the Delacours back to [[France]].<ref name="DH8">{{DH|B|8}}</ref>

Through his [[Fleur Delacour|oldest daughter]] and his [[William Weasley|son-in-law]], he was the maternal grandfather of [[Victoire Weasley|Victoire]], [[Dominique Weasley|Dominique]] and [[Louis Weasley]].

==Physical appearance==
Monsieur Delacour was extremely short and quite plump, with a little, very pointed black beard.<ref name="DH6"/> He gave an appearance of being a kind and jovial person, although it was noted that he was not quite as attractive as his wife.<ref name="DH6"/> He wore high-heeled boots and had a very deep voice.<ref name="DH6"/>

==Personality and traits==
Monsieur Delacour was extremely pleasant, kind and helpful, keen to assist with the wedding preparations for his daughter Fleur and pronouncing absolutely everything from the bridesmaid's shoes to the seating plan to be "''charmant''."<ref name="DH6"/> He argued with his hosts [[Arthur Weasley|Arthur]] and [[Molly Weasley]] in a futile attempt to have them stay in their own bedroom.<ref name="DH6"/> He was also a very loving father, as both his children affectionately called him "''papa.''"

==Behind the scenes==
*M. Delacour is not known to have visited Fleur during the [[Triwizard Tournament]]. His wife and his younger daughter both visited (and Gabrielle participated in the Second Task), but M. Delacour is notably not mentioned during their visit before the Third Task; however, it is possible he visited at another time and Harry simply did not notice him.
*In the film, M. Delacour has short, neat grey hair and is clean-shaven, and is also quite tall, being taller than [[Arthur Weasley]], whose height is noted to be quite grand in the books. He does not appear in the video game instalment of the seventh book.

==Appearances==
*{{DH}} {{1st}}
*{{DH|F1}}

}}'''Simon Dentata''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and the author of ''[[The Owl Airforce|The Owl Airforce: True Life Tales of War in Europe]]''. The book, published sometime prior to [[December]] [[1926]], explored real tales about magic involvement in the [[First World War]], one instance being the actions of an [[owl]] airforce.<ref>[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: Character Guide]] - {{see image|File:The Owl Airforce.png}}</ref>

{{Quote|Bartemius! Not trying to lure [[Harry Potter|Potter]] into one of the Ministry's summer internships, are we? The last boy who went into the Department of Mysteries never came out!|[[Bartemius Crouch Junior|Barty Crouch Jnr]] (impersonating [[Alastor Moody]]) to [[Bartemius Crouch Senior|Barty Crouch Snr]]|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)}}
This '''boy''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and summer intern at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] sometime before early [[1995]] and worked in the [[Department of Mysteries]]. He went missing within the Department and was never found.<ref name="GOFF">{{GOF|F}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This is possible that he fell into [[veil]] in [[Death Chamber]] and thus [[Death|died]], which could explain his strange disappearance.
*It is unclear why The Ministry of Magic would allow summer interns to work in a highly classified department. Perhaps this statement might not be true at all and was only spoken by [[Bartemius Crouch Junior]] to try and insult his father.

==Appearances==

'''Philbert Deverill''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who was the manager of [[Quidditch]] [[Quidditch team|team]] [[Puddlemere United]]<ref name=":0">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[8 February]], [[1999]], Page 3</ref>. He once said to the [[Daily Prophet]] that Puddlemere United would change their robe colours from mud-brown to something "''more striking''"<ref name=":0" />. He was as mystified as everyone else when his side hit a winning streak.

==Etymology==
The name "Philbert" is an early variant of ''Filibert'' altered by association with Greek φιλος (''philos'') "dear, beloved". This was the name of a 7th-century Frankish saint. Another famous bearer was Philibert de l'Orme (1510-1570), a French Renaissance architect.

==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]''

==Notes and references==

}}'''Fernando Diaz''' was a [[Brazil]]ian [[wizardkind|wizard]] and a [[Chaser]] for the [[2014]] [[Brazilian National Quidditch team]]. He, along with fellow Chaser [[Alejandra Alonso]], was described as one of [[Brazil]]'s finest by [[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]] for her article in the [[Daily Prophet]] on the [[American National Quidditch team|USA]]-Brazil game.<ref name="Insider">[http://insider.pottermore.com/2014/05/read-ginny-potters-match-reports-from.html "Read Ginny Potter's match reports from the 2014 Quidditch World Cup every day this week"] at [http://insider.pottermore.com Pottermore Insider]</ref>

During the [[BRAZIL VERSUS HAITI|Brazil vs Haiti]] match, him and his fellow Brazil Chasers, [[Alejandra Alonso]] and [[Gonçalo Flores]], made as many as thirty attempts to score during the beginning of the game, although they only made ten goals. [[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]] also commended all three Brazilian Chasers for keeping their heads during the [[BRAZIL VERSUS WALES|Brazil vs Wales]] match that was deemed the most contentious match of the tournament. 

In the semifinal match between Brazil and the [[United States of America]], Diaz and Alonso both dropped the [[Quaffle]] twice, something that was common in that match due to the nerves associated with the possibility of Brazil's reaching the World Cup final for the first time since [[1982]].

==Etymology==
*[[Wikipedia:Diaz|Diaz]] is a common Spanish surname, cognate to the Portuguese and Brazilian [[Wikipedia:Dias|Dias]].

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}

{{Quote|Shooting stars down in Kent — I’ll bet that was Dedalus Diggle. He never had much sense.|Dedalus's excitable personality|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}

'''Dedalus Diggle''' (fl. [[1964]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and a member of the [[Order of the Phoenix]], who fought in the [[First Wizarding War|First]] and the [[Second Wizarding War]] against [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and the [[Death Eaters]]. He was a member of the [[Advance Guard]] in [[1995]]<ref name="OOTP3"/> and he fought in several battles of both wars. He also escorted the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]] to a safe place in [[1997]].<ref name="DH3"/>

==Biography==

===Early life===
Dedalus was born in [[1964]] or earlier into a wizarding family.<ref name="blood"/>

===First Wizarding War {{c|1970s-1981}}===
Dedalus lived in [[Kent]] and never had any sense, according to [[Minerva McGonagall]]. He became a member of the [[Order of the Phoenix]], an organisation led and founded by [[Albus Dumbledore]], in order to oppose [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and his [[Death Eaters]]. He was thought to have been responsible for a downpour of shooting stars in [[Kent]] to celebrate the downfall of [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]], an act that was deemed foolish and irresponsibly by [[Minerva McGonagall]].<ref name="PS1">{{PS|B|1}}</ref>

===Between the wars {{c|1981-1991}}===
{{Quote|A tiny man in a violet top hat had bowed to him once while out shopping with Aunt Petunia and Dudley. After asking Harry furiously if he knew the man, Aunt Petunia had rushed them out of the shop without buying anything.|Dedalus greeting a young Harry Potter while shopping|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}
[[File:Digel.jpg|205x205px|thumb|left|Dedalus at the [[Leaky Cauldron]] in [[1991]]]]
Dedalus was presumably one of the members of the Order of the Phoenix assigned to discreetly keep a close eye on [[Harry Potter]] seen as he once met the Boy-Who-Lived during his early childhood in a shop. He bowed to Harry, for which his [[Petunia Dursley|Aunt Petunia]] furiously interrogated him as to how Diggle knew him.<ref name="PS2">{{PS|B|2}}</ref><ref name="PS5"/>

He met Harry formally on the day [[Rubeus Hagrid]] first brought Harry into the [[Leaky Cauldron]] on their way to purchase school supplies, and shook his hand about five times.<ref name="PS5">{{PS|B|5}}</ref>

===Second Wizarding War {{c|1995-1998}}===
{{Dialogue a-b|Remus Lupin|And this is Kingsley Shacklebolt — Elphias Doge  — and Deadlus Diggle|Dedalus Diggle|We've met before|Harry being introduced to the Advance Guard|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}
[[File:B5C3M1 Advance Guard at Privet Drive.jpg|250x250px|thumb|The [[Advance Guard]] inside 4 Privet Drive, preparing to escort Harry Potter to safety]]

Diggle rejoined the Order to fight in the [[Second Wizarding War]], after Lord Voldemort's [[Return of Lord Voldemort|rebirth]]. In [[1995]], Diggle was part of the Advance Guard escorting Harry from [[4 Privet Drive|Privet Drive]] to [[12 Grimmauld Place]], along with fellow members [[Remus Lupin]], [[Alastor Moody]], [[Nymphadora Tonks]], [[Kingsley Shacklebolt]], [[Sturgis Podmore]], [[Hestia Jones]], [[Elphias Doge]], and [[Emmeline Vance]].<ref name="OOTP3">{{OOTP|B|3}}</ref>

====Dursleys' departure====
{{Quote|I see you are packed and ready. Excellent! The plan, as Harry has told you, is a simple one. We shall be leaving before Harry does. Due to the danger of using magic in your house – Harry being still under-age, it could provide the Ministry with an excuse to arrest him – we shall be driving, say ten miles or so, before Disapparating to the safe location we have picked out for you. You know how to drive, I take it?|Dedalus explaining the departure plan to the Dursleys|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}
Diggle, along with [[Hestia Jones]], was assigned by the [[Order of the Phoenix]] to manage the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]]' departure from [[4 Privet Drive|Privet Drive]]. When he and [[Hestia Jones]] arrived, he greeted the Dursleys as "''Harry Potter's relatives''", something that annoyed [[Vernon Dursley]]. In an attempt to make conversation, he also commented that all the knobs and buttons in a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] car would confuse him. He also sported a large [[Dedalus Diggle's pocket watch|pocket watch]] kept in his waistcoat that shouted at him to "''Hurry up!''" when late.<ref name="DH3">{{DH|B|3}}</ref>

His house was [[Attack at Dedalus Diggle's house|burned down]] by [[Death Eaters]] after the [[Fall of the Ministry of Magic]], in an attempt to harm members of the Order. Diggle was not present, as he was in hiding with Hestia and the Dursleys.<ref name="DH11">{{DH|B|11}}</ref>

==Physical appearance==
Diggle was described as a tiny, excitable man who often wore a purple [[top hat]].<ref>{{OOTP|B|3}} - "Harry Potter!” squeaked an excited voice, the moment Harry had opened the door; a small man in a mauve top hat".</ref>

==Personality and traits==
Diggle was a person who was often very cheerful, enthusiastic and friendly. He was excited when he learned about Voldemort's downfall, and he very much admired Harry Potter.<ref name="PS5"/> He also thought that he would flatter [[Vernon Dursley]] by telling that it was very clever to drive, and that he could not drive a car, however, this simply angered Vernon. Diggle also thought that he and [[Hestia Jones]] would be best friends with the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]], showing he was a very friendly and good-natured wizard, but also perhaps somewhat naive, as he did not expect the Dursleys to be as unpleasant as they really were.<ref name="DH3"/> He was also perhaps somewhat clumsy and careless, as Minerva McGonagall told Albus Dumbledore she never thought he had much common sense, when telling Dumbledore she believed him to be responsible for causing a downfall of shooting stars across Kent, a feat which was witnessed by Muggles and regarded as highly unusual.<ref name="PS1"/>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Magic]]al aptitude''': It is likely that Dedalus Diggle was a fairly talented [[Wizardkind|wizard]], having become a loyal member of the [[Order of the Phoenix]] and survived the [[First Wizarding War]], in which he actively participated in the efforts to free the [[Wizarding world|magical community]] from the grasp of the [[Dark Arts|Dark Forces]] under [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s command. He was presumably also a very capable [[Duelling|duellist]], having survived that long. It was also widely thought of that he was responsible for magically causing a downfall of shooting stars across [[Kent]] celebrating Voldemort's defeat in early [[November]] [[1981]], an act both considered impressive but also irresponsible by other wizards, particularly [[Minerva McGonagall]].<ref name="PS1">{{PS|B|1}}</ref>
*'''[[Defence Against the Dark Arts]]''': Dedalus was well versed in defensive magic, with him authoring an article for the wizarding magazine [[Spellbound (magazine)|''Spellbound'']] on the subject of [[Counter-jinxes]]. Years later, this article helped [[Calamity Investigator]]s of the [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]] in addressing the [[Calamity]] by teaching them how to more effectively break through the defences of their magical adversaries.<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>
*'''[[Charm]]s''': Dedalus was capable of producing a non-corporeal [[Patronus Charm]],<ref name="LEGOY2"/> a highly advanced piece of magic and a mark of superior magical ability.
*'''[[Flight|Flying]]''': Dedalus was an accomplished [[broomstick]] flyer; he was a member of the [[Advance Guard]] who successfully escorted Harry Potter to 12 Grimmauld Place via broomstick flight.<ref name="OOTP3"/>

==Possessions==
*'''[[Wand]]''': Diggle owned a wand, which was of an unknown length, [[Wand wood|wood]] and [[Wand core|core]].<ref name="LEGOY2"/>
*'''[[Top hat]]''': Dedalus owned a mauve top hat, which he wore as a member of the [[Advance Guard]].<ref name="OOTP3"/>
*'''[[Dedalus Diggle's pocket watch|Pocket watch]]''': Diggle owned a [[magic]]al pocket watch that was capable of speech, which would inform him of his schedule when he was running late.<ref name="DH3"/>
*'''[[Dedalus Diggle's house|House]]''': Diggle owned a house somewhere in [[Kent]], [[England]]. In [[1997]], it was [[Attack at Dedalus Diggle's house|broken into and burned down]] by [[Death Eaters]].<ref name="DH11"/>

==Relationships==
===Harry Potter===
{{Dialogue a-b-a|Diggle|Delighted, Mr Potter, just can't tell you, Diggle's the name, Dedalus Diggle.|Harry Potter|I've seen you before! You bowed to me once in a shop.|He remembers! Did you hear that? He remembers me!|Diggle officially meets Harry|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}[[File:Harry Potter movies hbp promostills 6.jpg|201x201px|thumb|[[Harry Potter]]]]
After learning that Voldemort had lost his powers, Diggle widely admired [[Harry Potter]], because he was the reason of Voldemort's downfall. He also once bowed to Harry in a shop sometime in Harry's childhood, but Harry didn't know who he was and why he bowed to him.<ref name="PS2"/><ref name="PS5"/>

Harry officially met Diggle in [[1991]], at the [[Leaky Cauldron]]. He was surprised when Harry told that he remembered him.<ref name="PS5"/> Diggle was also a member of the Advance Guard, a group of members of the Order that came to escort Harry from [[4 Privet Drive]] to [[12 Grimmauld Place]]. He got angry when [[Remus Lupin]] attempted to introduce Diggle to Harry, as they had already met.<ref name="OOTP3"/> Diggle met Harry again in [[1997]], when he and [[Hestia Jones]] came to rescue the Dursleys from Death Eaters.<ref name="DH3"/>

===Albus Dumbledore===
[[Albus Dumbledore]] knew Diggle through the [[Order of the Phoenix]]. They probably fought along in several battles, and, after Voldemort's first defeat, Diggle was excited. When [[Minerva McGonagall]] disapproved Diggle's behaviour (because she thought that he could be seen by [[Non-magic people|Muggles]]), Dumbledore justified him, telling that "We've had precious little to celebrate for eleven years."<ref name="PS1"/> Dumbledore and Diggle also fought along in the [[Second Wizarding War]]. It is unknown how Diggle reacted when he learned about Dumbledore's death.

===The Dursleys===
{{Quote|Good day to you, Harry Potter’s relatives!|Dedalus greeting the Dursleys in 1997|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows}}
[[File:Dursley Family.jpg|220px|thumb|left|The [[Dursley family]]]]
Diggle first met the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]], a Muggle family, in [[1997]]. Diggle, along with fellow member of the Order [[Hestia Jones]], went to the Dursleys' house to help them hide from [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and his Death Eaters. [[Vernon Dursley]] was a Muggle who disliked wizards and magic in general.<ref name="DH3"/>

Diggle attempted to flatter Vernon by telling him that he was very clever for being able to drive, and that he himself could never drive a car. That made Vernon very angry, saying that "he didn't know even how to drive!" Despite this, Diggle thought that he and the Dursleys would be best friends. It is unknown what happened after their departure. However, it is possible, though unlikely, that they became friendly after that.<ref name="DH3"/>

===Order of the Phoenix members===
[[File:Order of the Phoenix – first generation.jpg|250x250px|thumb|The first [[Order of the Phoenix]]]]
Diggle possibly knew all the members of the [[Order of the Phoenix]], and had a good relationship with [[Harry Potter]] and [[Albus Dumbledore]], as well as other members.

He appears to have had a good relationship with fellow members [[Remus Lupin]], [[Kingsley Shacklebolt]], [[Alastor Moody]], [[Nymphadora Tonks]], [[Elphias Doge]], [[Sturgis Podmore]], [[Emmeline Vance]], and [[Hestia Jones]], as they were all members of the [[Advance Guard]] in [[1995]].However, when Remus Lupin introduced Diggle to Harry Potter, Diggle got angry, saying that they had already met.<ref name="OOTP3"/> Diggle and Hestia Jones were also the ones who helped the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]] hide from [[Death Eaters]] in [[1997]].<ref name="DH3"/>

Emmeline Vance was killed by Death Eaters in [[1996]], as were [[Alastor Moody]] in [[1997]], and [[Remus Lupin]] and [[Nymphadora Tonks]] in [[1998]]. It is unknown how Diggle reacted when he learned of their deaths.

[[Minerva McGonagall]] disapproved of Diggle's excited behaviour after Voldemort's first defeat, but Albus Dumbledore justified him, telling that the wizards had years to celebrate something. Minerva and Diggle were both members of the second [[Order of the Phoenix]] and fought in several battles.<ref name="PS1"/>

==Etymology==
*Daedalus (the more common spelling) was a craftsman and inventor in Greek mythology. He fled Greece and went to the island of Crete. There he built the labyrinth, a maze that held the Minotaur, a monster man with the head of a bull. Daedalus tried to escape King Minos of Crete, so he built wings of wax and feathers for himself and his son, Icarus. They flew like birds into the sky. Icarus flew too closely to the sun, fell into the ocean, and drowned.
*Diggle may refer to the English word giggle, meaning to laugh.

==Behind the scenes==
*Dedalus Diggle is portrayed by [[David Brett]] in {{PS|FA}}.
