{{Dialogue a-b|Mr Granger|Is this in [[Australia]]?|Mrs Granger|Looks wonderful, doesn't it?|Mr Granger and his [[Hermione Granger's mother|wife]] looking at houses|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1}}
'''Mr Granger''' (temporarily known as '''Wendell Wilkins''')<ref name="DH">{{DH}}</ref> was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]], the husband of [[Hermione Granger's mother|Mrs Granger]], and father of [[Hermione Granger|Hermione Jean Granger]]. Working as a [[dentist]] alongside his wife, he and his family lived in a [[Grangers' house|house]] located on the outskirts of [[London]].

He and his wife were proud and accepting of their daughter's identity as a [[Wizardkind|witch]], which explained some strange things which happened around her when she was a child. They entered the magical world in [[1992]] to buy Hermione's school supplies, and were assisted by [[Arthur Weasley]].<ref name="COS">{{COS}}</ref> Several years later, however, Hermione was forced to alter her parents' memories and give them new identities as Wendell and Monica Wilkins, to protect them from the [[Death Eaters]].<ref name="DH" />

After the [[Second Wizarding War]] ended, Hermione found Mr Granger and his wife in [[Australia]] and returned their memories.{{fact}} They gained grandchildren through Hermione and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]]'s marriage, [[Rose Granger-Weasley|Rose]] and [[Hugo Weasley|Hugo Granger-Weasley]].<ref name="DH" /><ref name="A1">"[https://www.pottermore.com/news/cursed-child-first-look-at-weasleys-in-character New Cursed Child character portraits of Ron, Hermione and Rose Granger-Weasley]" on {{PM}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Early life===
{{Dialogue a-b|Hermione Granger|Well, both my parents are dentists.|Professor Slughorn|Fascinating, and is that considered a dangerous profession?|Hermione talking to [[Horace Slughorn]] about her parents|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)}}[[File:Grangers.jpg|250px|thumb|left|Mr Granger with is wife in the early 1980s]]

Mr Granger was born to [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] parents, at least one of whom may have been descended from a Squib.

Mr Granger was a well-qualified individual who held a career in [[dentist]]ry. This was presumably how he met [[Hermione Granger's mother|his wife]], who was in the same profession.

He and his wife both achieved a Licentiate in Dental Surgery, earning the prefix of "doctor" and married, living in a [[Grangers' house|house]] on a street somewhere in England.

===Fatherhood===
{{Quote|The Forest of Dean. I came camping here once, with my mum and dad.|Hermione mentioning her parents during the Horcrux hunt|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows}}[[File:Harry-potter-deathly-hallows1-mr_granger.jpg|231x231px|thumb|Mr Granger standing next to his daughter]]

On [[19 September]], [[1979]] they had a daughter, [[Hermione Granger|Hermione Jean Granger]]. The couple chose a "nice, unusual" first name that others had difficulty pronouncing because they "''liked to prove how clever they were''."<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/1999/1099-pressclubtransc.htm J. K. Rowling 1999 National Press Club luncheon Q&A]</ref>

The couple gave Hermione a [[Hermione Granger's bedroom|bedroom]] on the first floor of their house,<ref name="DHPO">{{DH|F1}}</ref> and they lived happily for many years.

At some point, Mr and Mrs Granger took Hermione camping in the [[Forest of Dean]].<ref name="DH" /> They also went to a theatre on [[Shaftesbury Avenue]] in [[London]],<ref name="DHPO" /> and at least once went to [[Tottenham Court Road]] with her.<ref name="DH" />

Hermione attended a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] school and was rather bright for her age. Hermione tells Horace Slughorn that one time whilst at work, her father was bitten by a [[Robbie Fenwick|boy]] and had to be taken to hospital to receive several stitches.

===Discovering the wizarding world===
{{Quote|I've tried a few simple spells myself and they've all worked for me. Nobody in my family's magic at all, it was ever such a surprise when I got my letter, but I was ever so pleased, of course, it's the best school of witchcraft there is I've heard-- I've learned all the course books by heart, of course.|Hermione regarding her Hogwarts acceptance letter|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}At some point prior to [[1 September]] [[1991]], Mr Granger and his wife were visited by a staff member from [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], who gave them the letter inviting their daughter to the school. This visit revealed their daughter, Hermione, to be a [[Muggle-born]] [[Wizardkind|witch]], something that apparently came as quite a surprise. Hermione, at least, was shocked, but very pleased, and her parents were supportive of her.<ref name="PS">{{PS}}</ref>

====1991-1992====
[[File:Harry-potter2-diagon_ally.jpg|250px|thumb|left|Hermione and her parents in Diagon Alley]]

In [[1991]], Mr Granger and his wife accompanied their daughter to [[Diagon Alley]] to purchase her school supplies, including her wand from [[Ollivanders]].

Mrs and Mr Granger were separated from their daughter after she took the [[Hogwarts Express]] to her new school. They were bemused by Hermione's new identity, but were proud of her, as she had memorised all of her school books before leaving.<ref name="PS" />

Mr and Mrs Granger corresponded with Hermione by owl post while she was at school<ref name="OTP">{{OOTP}}</ref> and took her for a holiday to France in the summer of 1993.<ref>{{POA}}</ref>

====1992-1993====
{{Quote|[Arthur Weasley] was distracted almost at once by the sight of Hermione's parents, who were standing nervously at the counter that ran all along the great marble hall, waiting for Hermione to introduce them.|Description|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}For the [[1992–1993 school year]], Mr and Mrs Granger had to purchase more school equipment for their daughter. Firstly, in order to buy the supplies, they went to [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]] to exchange [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[Muggle money|money]] for [[wizarding currency]].

There, they met her friends Harry Potter and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]], as well as Ron's family. Ron's father, [[Arthur Weasley]], was obsessed with Muggles. Arthur was fascinated by the ten-pound notes that Mr Granger had in his hand, asked them all about their money, and took them out for a drink.<ref>{{COS}}</ref>

[[File:Harry-potter2-mr_&_mrs_granger.jpg|250px|thumb|Mr and Mrs Granger talking with Arthur Weasley in [[Flourish and Blotts]]
]]

The Grangers went with the [[Weasley family|Weasleys]] to Flourish and Blotts to purchase spellbooks with their new money. [[Gilderoy Lockhart]] was there doing book signings, which Mr and Mrs Granger queued up for with the Weasleys. When [[Lucius Malfoy]] approached Arthur and began arguing, Mr Granger and his wife watched apprehensively. Being a pure-blood supremacist, Malfoy scorned Arthur for being in the Grangers' company, glancing at them. The two wizards proceeded to argue with each other, before [[Rubeus Hagrid]] stopped them.

The Grangers left with the Weasleys, shocked and frightened by what they had just witnessed. They went to the [[Leaky Cauldron]] Inn, sitting by the fireplace, before saying farewell to the Weasleys and [[Harry Potter]] and leaving with their daughter for the Muggle world. After the school term ended, Mr and Mrs Granger took Hermione on holiday to [[France]] during the summer holidays. There, Hermione ate [[bouillabaisse]], which she liked the taste of.<ref name="GOF">{{GOF}}</ref>

====1995-1996====
{{Dialogue a-b|Harry Potter|What are you doing here? I thought you were skiing with your mum and dad.|Hermione Granger|Well, to tell the truth, skiing's not really my thing. So I've come for Christmas... Anyway, Mum and Dad are a bit disappointed, but I've told them that everyone who's serious about the exams is staying at Hogwarts to study. They want me to do well, they'll understand.|[[Hermione Granger|Hermione]] speaking with Harry about her holiday|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}During the [[1995–1996 school year]], Mr and Mrs Granger arranged a skiing trip over the [[Christmas holidays]]. However, Hermione told them at the last minute that she wanted to stay at Hogwarts in order to study hard for her fifth year exams, the Ordinary Wizarding Levels, which are roughly equivalent to [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] O-Levels. Mr Granger and his wife were both disappointed, but, because they wanted their daughter to achieve good grades, they understood. Hermione instead ended up going to [[12 Grimmauld Place]] to cheer up Harry, who had been refusing to speak to any of the house's occupants<ref name="OTP" /> and spent Christmas with the [[Weasley family]].

====1997-1998====
[[File:Harry-potter-deathly-hallows1-memory_charm.jpg|250px|thumb|left|Hermione modifying her parents' memories]]

In [[1997]], Hermione modified her father's memory so that he believed he was Wendell Wilkins, who didn't have a daughter and who wanted to live in [[Australia]], and did the same to her mother so that she believed she was Monica Wilkins. This was to protect her parents from [[Death Eaters]] during the worst of the [[Second Wizarding War]], as their daughter was very close friends with [[Harry Potter]] and she was a Muggle-born.<ref>{{DH}}</ref>

===Later life===
Sometime after the war ended in 1998, Hermione found him and restored his memories back to their original state.<ref name="BLC">[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2007/0730-bloomsbury-chat.html "J.K. Rowling and the Live Chat, Bloomsbury.com, July 30, 2007 (2.00-3.00pm BST)"] at [http://www.accio-quote.org/index.html Accio Quote]</ref> Later in his life he would become a grandfather to [[Rose Granger-Weasley|Rose]] and [[Hugo Granger-Weasley|Hugo Weasley]] and the father-in-law of [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]].

==Relationships==
===Family===

====Granger family====
{{Quote|They are a bit bemused by their odd daughter but quite proud of her all the same.|A description of the Grangers' relationship with Hermione|J. K. Rowling}}[[File:Hermione Granger HBP.jpg|thumb|201x201px|[[Hermione Granger]], his daughter and only child]]Mr Granger's relationship with his wife is largely unknown, though they were presumably happy together. They both worked as [[dentist]]s together, and frequently went on holidays, such as the one to [[France]]. The two of them appeared to have a shared taste in real estate, as they both commented on a house in [[Australia]] that was being shown on [[television]].

His relationship with Hermione was presumably a good one. Hermione was deeply upset about the [[False memory charm]] that she put on her parents. Mr Granger was also disappointed when she did not come with him and his wife to [[France]], but he wanted her to do well in her [[Ordinary Wizarding Level]]s and accepted that.

====Weasley family====
{{Quote|But you're ''Muggles''! We must have a drink! What's that you've got there? Oh, you're changing Muggle money? Molly, look!|[[Arthur Weasley]] looking at Mr Granger's money|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}[[File:Weasley Wizarding Vacation in Egypt.png|226x226px|thumb|left|The Weasleys]]

Mr and Mrs Granger first met the [[Weasley family]] in [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]], where they stood nervously waiting for their daughter to introduce them.

The couple came to trust the Weasleys very much, allowing their daughter to stay at their house over the holidays, prior to the school term, and to go to the [[Quidditch World Cup]] in [[1994]].

The two families were brought even closer when Hermione married [[Ronald Weasley]] and had [[Rose Granger-Weasley|Rose]] and [[Hugo Granger-Weasley|Hugo]].

==Behind the scenes==
[[File:Mister Granger Hermione COS 1.jpg|165px|thumb|Hermione Granger with her parents in 1992]]
*Mr Granger was portrayed by [[Tom Knight]] in {{COS|FA}}, but he was replaced by [[Ian Kelly]] for {{DH|F1}}<ref>[http://www.iankelly.net/home_actor/ IanKelly.net]</ref>.
*In the earliest draft of {{PS}} the Potters lived on an island, and the Grangers lived on the shore nearby. When Voldemort killed James and Lily, Mr Granger noticed an explosion. He got on his boat and rowed out to the island to see what had happened, and found Harry.<ref>[http://www.jkrowling.com/textonly/en/extrastuff_view.cfm?id=1 J.K.Rowling Official Site]</ref>
*In the first part of the film adaptation of the final book, Hermione vanishes from all the photographs kept in the Granger house after she cast the [[Memory Charm]] on Mr and Mrs Granger. She was upset by what she had done to her parents, and cried several times afterwards. The Death Eater [[Corban Yaxley|Yaxley]] can be seen in a deleted scene entering the empty home in search of Hermione.
*It is possible his "Wendell Wilkins" alias may be a reference to {{wplink|Wendell Wilkie}}, an American politician who ran unsuccessfully for president against Franklin Delano Roosevelt in 1940.

This '''[[giant]]''' was the father of [[Grawp]], stepfather of [[Rubeus Hagrid]] and husband of [[Fridwulfa]]. His height was unknown, but according to [[Hermione Granger|Hermione]], most giants were around 20 feet tall (6 meters). Grawp's height ("only" 16 feet tall) may have indicated that his father was shorter than average, or Grawp could simply be shorter than his father.<ref name="OOTP30">{{OOTP|B|30}}</ref>

It's unknown if he is still alive as Hagrid never noted his presence in the [[Giant colony]] or lack-thereof. It's also unknown if he was one of the giants who joined [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and the [[Death Eaters]] or if he was one of the few who hid out in the surrounding caves, assuming he was still alive at that point.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Richard Griffiths''' (fl. [[1997]]) was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] actor who had a large part in ''[[Equus]]'', a play that was staged sometime in the late [[1990s]]. There was a poster mentioning him at [[Luchino Caffe]] in the summer of [[1997]].<ref name="DHpt1">{{DH|F1}} {{see image|File:Deathly Hallows Equus poster.jpg}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This mention is an obvious reference to [[Richard Griffiths]], the actor who played [[Vernon Dursley]] in the [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]] and who also had a part in ''[[Wikipedia:Equus (play)|Equus]]'' in the 2007 revival.

==Etymology==
The name "Richard" means "brave power", derived from the Germanic elements ric "power, rule" and hard "brave, hardy".

'''Gringotts Guards'''<ref>{{DH|G2}}</ref> are [[Wizardkind|wizards]] who are assigned to guard the entrance of [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank|Gringotts]], the bank of the [[wizarding world]].

==History==
During the [[Death Eaters]]' reign over the wizarding world, security was tightened, and guards used [[Probity Probe]] to search anyone attempting to enter the bank.

On [[1 May]], [[1998]] [[Marius]] and [[Unidentified Gringotts guard (I)|another guard]] were [[Confundus Charm|confunded]] by [[Harry Potter]], who [[Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank (1998)|broke into Gringotts]] with [[Hermione Granger]] (disguised as [[Bellatrix Lestrange]]) and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]] (disguised as Dragomir Despard), and the former-employee [[Griphook]], in order to steal one of [[Tom Riddle|Voldemort]]'s [[Horcrux]]es from the [[Lestrange Vault]].

This '''unidentified goblin''' worked in the capacity of Head [[Goblin]] of [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]] in the early [[1990s]].<ref name="PS5"/>

==Biography==
[[File:HeadGoblin Gringotts.jpg|140px|thumb|right|The Head Goblin at Gringotts]]
On [[31 July]], [[1991]], this goblin summoned [[Griphook]] to aid [[Harry Potter]] and [[Rubeus Hagrid]] in performing their withdrawals in Gringotts.<ref name="PS5">{{PS|B|5}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*It is unknown if he was still employed at Gringotts, because he was not seen among the other Goblins when Harry and his friends broke into the bank on [[1 May]], [[1998]].<ref name="DH26">{{DH|B|26}}</ref>
*The Head Goblin was portrayed by [[Warwick Davis]], who also portrayed [[Professor]] [[Filius Flitwick]]. Davis went on to play [[Griphook]] in the [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows (film)|film adaptation]] of {{DH}}.
*This goblin's role in the story is replaced by [[Griphook]] in most [[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (video game)|video game adaptations]].

These three '''individuals''' were [[giant]]s who served under [[Gurg]] [[Karkus]] in the [[Giant colony]]. One of them were able to understand [[human]] language and translated what [[Rubeus Hagrid]] and [[Olympe Maxime]] said to Karkus. When [[Golgomath]] killed Karkus and became the new Gurg, the group had to serve under him instead. When Hagrid and Maxime visited them, they wanted to kill the visitor, but when Hagrid talked to them, the translator-Giant translated to the other Giants. For the first few days, the three got along well with the two envoys, but when Golgomath ordered his subordinates to raid the caves for any traitors, due to siding with the [[Death Eaters]], and decided to hunt down Hagrid and Maxime, the giants had no more loyalty to the [[Order of the Phoenix]].<ref name="OOTP20">{{OOTP|B|20}}</ref>

'''Galvin Gudgeon''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who was the [[Seeker]] for the [[Chudley Cannons]]<ref name="DP" /> [[Quidditch]] [[Quidditch team|team]] in the [[1990s]]. Whilst playing in a match against the [[Tutshill Tornados]], Gudgeon fell off his [[Broomstick]] trying to catch a passing bumble-bee.<ref name="DP" />

In [[1998]] he performed terribly when the Cannons were defeated by the [[Appleby Arrows]]. During the game, the [[Golden Snitch|Snitch]] bounced off his nose twice. Cannons manager [[Ragmar Dorkins]] felt he had to tell the team's fans that "turning him into a toad will not help his game."<ref name="DP">''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[31 July]], [[1998]], Page 2''</ref>

'''Arnold Guzman''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who was the [[United States of America|American]] Emissary to the [[International Confederation of Wizards]] in [[1927]].

==Biography==
In 1927, Guzman attended a hearing at the [[British Ministry of Magic]], being a part of a committee comprised of himself, the [[Department of Magical Law Enforcement|Head of the Department of Magical Law Enforcement]], [[Torquil Travers]], and [[Rudolph Spielman]] of the International Confederation Wizards. The subject of the hearing being over the possible appeal of [[Newton Scamander|Newt Scamander]]'s international travel ban. Scamander's appeal was ultimately denied by Guzman and the other committee members.<ref>{{COG|S}}, Scene 19</ref>

==Personality and traits==
Arnold was a calm, but prim and very determined person, fearing the [[Global Wizarding War]] that [[Gellert Grindelwald]] had begun, as Arnold valued peace and diplomacy.

==Behind the scenes==
*Guzman is played by [[Cornell John]] in the [[Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald|second instalment]] of the ''[[Fantastic Beasts (film series)|Fantastic Beasts]]'' film series.<ref>name=''IMDB''>[https://www.imdb.com/title/tt4123430/fullcredits?ref_=tt_ov_st_sm ''Full Credits''] at '''[https://www.imdb.com IMDB]'''</ref>

'''Timothy Hale''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked for the [[British Ministry of Magic]] as an [[Auror]].

==Biography==
[[File:London Five Missing.png|150px|thumb|The ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' reports the disappearance of Timothy Hale, among others]]
He was one of the [[Auror]]s who mysteriously vanished during the [[London Five]] sometime during the mid-to-late [[2010s]]. His disappearance occurred within a few hours of the other four Aurors. It was the first instance of people having gone mysteriously missing since the [[Second Wizarding War]], and hence came as a great shock to the [[Wizardkind|wizarding community]] of Great Britain at large. An investigation was launched by the [[British Ministry of Magic]] to try and locate Hale and his fellow victims. As time passed, however, the Ministry met a dead end when the trail went cold, and it was generally felt by many that the chance of finding Hale grew increasingly smaller, causing the despair of his family to increase and turn into outrage when the case was closed. As [[Gareth Greengrass]] indeed speculated, it is very likely that Hale was deceased, as of [[2018]], though there was a small chance he was still alive.<ref name="WU trailer img">{{WU}} {{See image|file:WU trailer documents ref.png}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{WU}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Ciceron Harkiss''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who gave [[Ambrosius Flume]] his first job after an introduction by [[Horace Slughorn]].

==Appearances==
*{{HBP}} {{Mention}}

==Etymology==
: "a local guide in Italy," 1726, from Italian cicerone, from Latin Ciceronem, from the name of the great Roman orator.<ref>http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=cicerone</ref>
: "eloquent," a reference to Roman statesman and orator Marcus Tullius Cicero (106-43 B.C.E.); also often known as Tully in early Modern English writers; Cicero being a cognomen of the genus Tullia.<ref>http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?term=Ciceronian&allowed_in_frame=0</ref>

'''Kenneth Hastings''' was an [[Australia]]n [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as a [[Chaser]] on the [[Australian National Quidditch team]] during the four-hundred and twenty-second [[Quidditch World Cup]], in [[1994]].<ref>{{QWC}}</ref>

During the [[1996–1997 school year]], Hastings' [[Chocolate Frog Card]] could be won by beating [[Neville Longbottom]] at a [[duelling]] challenge.<ref>{{HBP|G}} {{C|NDS edition}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Kenneth" is the anglicised form of both ''Coinneach'' and ''Cináed''. This name was borne by the Scottish king Kenneth (''Cináed'') mac Alpin, who united the Scots and Picts in the 9th century. It was popularised outside of Scotland by Sir Walter Scott, who used it for the hero in his novel ''The Talisman'' (1825). A famous bearer was the British novelist Kenneth Grahame (1859-1932), who wrote ''The Wind in the Willows''.

'''Mr Haywood''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] man from the [[Great Britain|United Kingdom]]. He married a [[muggle-born]] [[Penny Haywood's mother|witch]] and had two [[half-blood]] [[wizardkind|witch]] daughters, [[Penny Haywood|Penny]] and [[Beatrice Haywood|Beatrice]].<ref name="HM5">{{HM|5}} [[History of Magic]]</ref>

His wife took him flying on a [[broomstick]] once, which scared him too much to try again.<ref>{{HM|1}} onward, Flying Lessons in general</ref>

He started playing [[Christmas]] music in [[October]], which drove his wife mad.<ref>{{HM}}, Christmas decorating activity</ref>

This '''[[Wizardkind|wizard]]''' was appointed [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] before [[Armando Dippet|Professor Dippet]].

==Biography==
This wizard became the [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] at an unknown point in history, although it is known his tenure was before that of [[Armando Dippet]]. After his [[death]], his [[portrait]] was hung in the [[Headmaster's office]], in order to give advice to the current head.<ref>''{{DH|F2}} (The Prince's Tale)''</ref> At the top of his golden frame is printed ''"Seraphini Cherubini Throni"'' which translates roughly as ''"angelic cherub throne"''.<ref>{{MHP}} - {{See image|File:Unidentified_Resting_Headmaster_with_frame.png}}</ref>

A portrait also hung in the [[Lower Chambers Portrait Corridor]] next to a [[Portrait of a bearded man holding a book]] in [[Hogwarts Castle]] during the [[1993–1994 school year]]. He was portrayed to have been resting in an armchair.<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

'''Ralph Heidelberger''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as [[Keeper]] on the [[American National Quidditch team]] during the four-hundred and twenty-second [[Quidditch World Cup]], in [[1994]]. He wore a helmet with a brown [[pumpkin]] design on it.<ref name="QWC">{{QWC}}</ref>

By the year [[1996]], he was immortalised on a [[Chocolate Frog Card]] for his achievements in the sport of [[Quidditch]].<ref name="HBPG">{{HBP|G}}</ref>

It is unknown whether his ancestors came from [[Heidelberg]] home of the [[Heidelberg Harriers]].

==Etymology==
*The name "Ralph" is contracted form of the Old Norse name ''Rádúlfr'' (or its Norman form ''Radulf''). It was introduced into England by Scandinavian settlers before the Norman conquest, though afterward it was bolstered by Norman influence. In the Middle Ages it was usually spelled Ralf, but by the 17th century it was most commonly Rafe, reflecting the normal pronunciation. The Ralph spelling appeared in the 18th century. A famous bearer of the name was Ralph Waldo Emerson (1803-1882), an American poet and author who wrote on transcendentalism.
*See [[Radulf]], its Latin form Radolphus [http://harrypotter.wikia.com/wiki/Radolphus_Pittiman][http://harrypotter.wikia.com/wiki/Radolphus_Lestrange]) and its Spanish form [[Raul Almeida]].

==Appearances==
*{{QWC}} {{1st}}
*{{HBP|G}} {{FWC}}

'''Martin "Tiny" Helstrom''' was Nordic [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as [[Keeper]] on the [[Nordic National Quidditch team]] during the four-hundred and twenty-second [[Quidditch World Cup]], in [[1994]].

During the [[1996–1997 school year]], Helstrom's [[Chocolate Frog Card]] was able to be won by beating [[Ronald Weasley]] at a [[duelling]] challenge.<ref>{{HBP|G}} {{c|NDS edition}}</ref>
 
==Etymology==
*The name "Martin" comes from the Roman name Martinus, which was derived from Martis, the genitive case of the name of the Roman god MARS. Saint Martin of Tours was a 4th-century bishop who is the patron saint of France. According to legend, he came across a cold beggar in the middle of winter so he ripped his cloak in two and gave half of it to the beggar. He was a favourite saint during the Middle Ages, and his name has become common throughout the Christian world.
*Helstrøm is a Danish surname, possibly indicating that Martin is Danish. It is also a surname of the Norwegian chef Eyvind Hellstrøm.

*{{HBP|G}} {{c|NDS edition}} {{FWC}}

{{Quote|Percy got an owl from my dad for being made prefect, but they couldn't aff — I mean, I got [[Peter Pettigrew|Scabbers]] instead.|Ronald Weasley tells Harry Potter about Hermes|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}

'''Hermes''' (fl. 1991-1995) was a [[screech owl]] belonging to [[Percy Weasley]]. Hermes was purchased for Percy by [[Arthur Weasley|his father]] as a reward for becoming a [[Gryffindor]] [[prefect]] in his fifth year at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].

In [[1993]], Hermes was stacked along with [[Hedwig]] and other belongings at the [[Leaky Cauldron]] before the departure to [[King's Cross Station]].<ref name="POA5">{{POA|B|5}}</ref>

In [[1995]], Percy used Hermes to deliver [[Percy Weasley's letter to Ronald Weasley (1995) II|a letter]] to his brother [[Ronald Weasley|Ronald]], advising him not to trust [[Harry Potter]] any longer and side with [[Dolores Umbridge]] and the [[British Ministry of Magic]].<ref name-"OOTP14">{{OOTP|B|14}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*{{wplink|Hermes}} (Ἑρμής) was the messenger of the gods in Greek mythology. Coincidentally, this is also the origin of the name "Hermione". This is very fitting for Percy, as he and Hermione always got along well at school, and given Percy's pompous nature, he would prefer to name his owl after a divine messenger.

}}'''David Heyman''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Non-magic people|No-Maj]] and the commissioner of the [[New York Police Department]] in [[1926]].<ref name="itmfb">''[[Inside the Magic: The Making of Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]'', page 47</ref><ref name="poster2">[https://www.flickr.com/photos/hummelissa/31348693721/ Prop photo poster] from hummelissa on Flickr</ref>

==Biography==

He signed a wanted poster issued for [[Newton Scamander|Newt Scamander]] and [[Jacob Kowalski]] on [[6 December]] 1926. It advised that, in the event of the pair's capture, he should be immediately contacted by [[telephone]] at 3100 Heyman.<ref name="itmfb" /><ref name="poster2"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was named after [[David Heyman]], the producer of all eight [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]], as well as ''[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]''.

'''Bob Hitchens''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]<ref>{{HPFW}}</ref><ref>The hand-drawn tree by J.K. Rowling expressly states that Bob Hitchens is a Muggle, and as her word is the highest form of canon, we know he is a Muggle.</ref> who married the [[Wizardkind|pure-blood witch]] [[Iola Black]], the youngest sister of famous [[Phineas Nigellus Black]]. Their [[marriage]] caused her to be struck off the [[Black Family Tapestry|Black family tree tapestry]].<ref>''[[House of Black]]''</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*It was not clear at first whether Hitchens was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] or a [[Muggle-born]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. Although the partial family tree on the Harry Potter Lexicon lists him as a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]], it does the same for [[Muggle-born]] wizard [[Edward Tonks|Ted Tonks]], possibly indicating that the [[House of Black|Blacks]] did not draw a distinction between Muggles and Muggle-borns. However, in the partial tree written by [[J. K. Rowling]] given in the {{HPFW}}, Ted Tonks is listed as a Muggle-born and Hitchens as a Muggle.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP|F}} {{Comment|Appears on Black family tapestry}}

'''Oakden Hobday''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He may be a relative of [[Hilliard Hobday|Hilliard]], [[Violetta Hobday|Violetta]], and [[Egmont Hobday]].

==Behind the scenes==
*Professor Hobday was one of two names which [[J. K. Rowling]] considered giving to the [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] [[professor]] in [[Harry Potter]]'s [[fifth year]] when she was planning {{POA}}.<ref>"[http://www.hp-lexicon.org/about/sources/jkr.com/jkr-com-trans-jottings1.html More idle jottings (Page 1)]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Oakden" began as a surname and was derived from Ogden, the name of several places in England, which means "oak valley", from the Old English words ''ac'', "oak", and ''denu'', "valley".<ref>"[http://www.surnamedb.com/surname.aspx?name=oakden Oakden]" on The Internet Surname Database</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{C|Early drafts (planned only)}}
*''[[J. K. Rowling's official site|J. K. Rowling Official Site]]''

This '''unidentified individual''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who was [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] sometime before [[Armando Dippet]]. After his death, his [[portrait]] hung in the [[Headmaster's office]] in order to give advice to the current Head.<ref name="interview">In an [http://www.the-leaky-cauldron.org/2007/10/20/j-k-rowling-at-carnegie-hall-reveals-dumbledore-is-gay-neville-marries-hannah-abbott-and-scores-more interview], J.K. Rowling stated, "all the portraits you see in the Headmaster's study are all Headmasters and mistresses who died."</ref><ref>{{COS|F}} DVD (Disc 2 - ''Dumbledore's Office'')</ref>

An inscription on his portrait read "Atatis XXXV,"<ref>See [[:File:Unidentified Headmaster1.jpg|this image]].</ref> indicating that he was aged thirty-five when the portrait was painted, as ''atatis'' is a Latin form of "aetatis", meaning "at the age of."<ref name="Wikipedia">[[Wikipedia:List of Latin phrases:A|List of Latin phrases:A]] at [[Wikipedia:Main Page|Wikipedia]]</ref>

The inscription on his frame reads ''"Suprem Aeris regio Aquce Salsa Regio Vegetabis Pura".''<ref>{{MHP}} - {{See image|File:Pink-faced_headmaster-frame.png}}</ref>

'''John Homme''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and painter. He painted the [[portrait]] of [[Percival Pratt]], which he signed in the lower right corner, opposite the subject's name on the left.<ref>See [[:File:JohnHSignature.jpg|this image]] and [[:File:PercivalPratt.jpg|this image]].</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "John" is the English form of Iohannes, the Latin form of the Greek name Ιωαννης (Ioannes), itself derived from the Hebrew name יוֹחָנָן (Yochanan) meaning "Yahweh is gracious".

The '''fiancé''' of [[Honoria]] was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked in the [[Improper Use of Magic Office]]. Honoria called off their engagement, telling people it was because she learned "he had a [[Hairy Heart]]" (a [[Wizarding world|wizarding]] expression for an unfeeling person), but rumour had it that she had really been disturbed to catch him in the middle of fondling some [[Horklump]]s.<ref name="TBB">{{TBB|E}}</ref>

{{Quote|Hooky the House-Elf!|[[Hermione Granger]] after finding his statue|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (video game)}}
'''Hooky''' was a famous [[house-elf]], though what he achieved or was well-known for is unknown.

A small statue of Hooky was located in the [[dungeons]] of [[Hogwarts Castle]], at the bottom of a corridor full of [[Wiggenweld Potion]]s, [[Potions (class)|Potions]] equipment, and ingredients. However, it is unlikely that he worked there at the [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|school]] due to [[Hermione Granger]]'s absent knowledge of his kind in the castle.

Hooky's statue was one of those required by Hermione in order to complete a challenge set by [[Fred Weasley|Fred]] and [[George Weasley]] during the [[1993–1994 school year]]. Every time she found a set of three statues, she was allowed to read a chapter of ''[[The Dark Forces: A Guide to Self-Protection]]''.

'''Horace''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who was employed by the [[Flume family|Flumes]] at [[Honeydukes|Honeydukes Sweetshop]] in the [[1990s]].<ref>[http://www.imsdb.com/scripts/Harry-Potter-and-the-Prisoner-of-Azkaban.html ''Prisoner of Azkaban'' script] on IMSDb</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual is mentioned only in the script of ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]''.

==Etymology==
The name "Horace" is the English and French form of Horatius, and the name by which the Roman poet Quintus Horatius Flaccus is commonly known those languages. In the modern era it has been used as a given name since the Renaissance, in honour of the poet.

'''Mr Hornby''' was the brother of [[Olive Hornby]]. [[Myrtle Warren|Moaning Myrtle]] showed up uninvited at his wedding because she was haunting Olive, his sister, and apparently made a scene to remind Olive of the bullying she put up with when she was still alive. It was so big of a mess that Olive had to get help from the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] in getting rid of the troublesome [[ghost]].<ref name="GOF25">{{GOF|B|25}}</ref>

[[London]] |died = [[19 November]], [[2006]] |blood = [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] |marital = Married |nationality = |alias = |title = |signature = |species = [[Human]] |gender = Male |height = |weight = |hair = |eyes = |skin = |family = [[Kay Hurwitz]] (wife) |romances = |animagus = |boggart = |wand = |patronus = |job = [[Violin]]ist |house = |loyalty = }} '''Emanuel Hurwitz''' ([[7 May]], [[1919]] — [[19 November]], [[2006]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[violin]]ist who lead several orchestras and ensembles.[http://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/emanuel-hurwitz-425144.html Emanuel Hurwitz's obituary] by Margaret Campbell in ''The Independent'' On Sunday, 7 May in a year prior to [[1997]], at 7:30 in the evening, Emanuel and his wife, [[Kay Hurwitz|Kay]], a [[viola|violist]], gave a performance of [[Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart|Mozart]]'s ''[[Mozart's Sinfonia Concertanti|Sinfonia Concertanti]]'' at [[St. Mary's Church Hall]].{{HPLE|G}} {{see image|File:Emanuel&KayHurwitzConcertPoster.jpg}} The performance was directed by [[Alec Webb]], and the [[Dollis Chamber Ensemble]] accompanied the couple for the first time ever. [[Hermione Granger]] had a poster for this concert stuck up on the bulletin board in [[Hermione Granger's bedroom|her bedroom]] in the [[Granger family]]'s [[Grangers' house|house]].{{DH|F1}} ==Behind the scenes== *In real life, Emanuel and Kay Hurwitz are, respectively, the stepgrandfather and grandmother of [[Miraphora Mina]], a graphic artist who worked on all eight [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]].See [[Talk:Emanuel Hurwitz]]. Mina likely created the prop concert poster featured in {{DH|F1}} as a tribute to them. ==Appearances== *{{DH|F1}} {{Mentioned on a poster}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hurwitz, Emanuel}} [[pt-br:Emanuel Hurwitz]] [[Category:British individuals]] [[Category:Males]] [[Category:Married individuals]] [[Category:Muggles]] [[Category:Musicians]]"}]}}}}

[[Australia]], [[Oceania]] |died= |blood= |marital= |alias= |title= |signature= |hidep= |species=[[Human]] |gender=Male |height= |hair= |eyes= |skin= |hidef=hide |family= |hidem=hide |animagus= |boggart= |wand= |patronus= |hidea= |job=*[[Chaser]] for the [[Australian National Quidditch team]] (c. [[1966]]) *[[International Director]] of the [[International Confederation of Wizards Quidditch Committee|ICWQC]] ([[1971]]-[[1974]]) |house= |loyalty= }} {{Quote|​''[The crowd is]'' the only thing I don't like about Quidditch.|Royston Idlewind in [[1971]].|Pottermore}} '''Royston Idlewind''' was a former [[Quidditch]] player in the [[1960s]], the star [[Chaser]] of the [[Australian National Quidditch team|Australian team]]. In [[1971]], he was appointed [[International Director]] of the [[International Confederation of Wizards Quidditch Committee]], but later resigned after the draconian regulations regarding crowd control he imposed were flouted ''en masse'' by the spectators of the final of the [[1974 Quidditch World Cup|Quidditch World Cup]] in [[1974]].[https://web.archive.org/web/20160307004515/https://www.pottermore.com/writing-by-jk-rowling/history-of-the-quidditch-world-cup History of the Quidditch World Cup] from {{PM}} (via The Internet Archive) ==Biography== ===Quidditch career=== Royston Idlewind was born in [[Australia]], sometime before [[1949]]. In the [[1960s]], he was "Australia's star [[Chaser]]" — in which capacity he was noted to have endured many [[jinx]]es, something that fuelled his dislike of spectator crowds later in his life. He was also part of the winning [[Australian National Quidditch team|Australian]] squad during the [[1966 Quidditch World Cup]]. ===As International Director of the ICWQC=== In [[1971]], Royston Idlewind was named [[International Director]] of the [[International Confederation of Wizards Quidditch Committee]]. Upon his contentious appointment, he immediately issued the statement that the only thing he disliked about [[Quidditch]] was the crowds, thus gaining the [[wizarding world]]'s dislike and distrust — this petty dislike soon turned into outright hostility when Idlewind passed a number of draconian regulations on crowd control, the worst of which was the ban of all wands from the stadium except those carried by [[International Confederation of Wizards Quidditch Committee|ICWQC]] officials. Many fans threatened to boycott the [[1974 Quidditch World Cup]] in protest, but seeing as empty stands were Idlewind's secret ambition, their strategy was not effective. The World Cup duly commenced and the crowds that attended carried with them not their [[wand]]s, but a new style of musical instrument called a [[Dissimulator]]: a tube-like object that issued bright lights and colourful puffs of smoke in national colours and emitted loud cheers for the teams being supported. For the first few matches of the tournament, very few wizards showed up, but those that did brought along Dissimulators, enlivening the match considerably. The Dissimulator craze grew, as did the crowds. On the day of the final match between [[Syria]] and [[Madagascar]], the stands were packed with a record crowd of wizards, each carrying his own Dissimulator. When Royston Idlewind appeared in the [[Top Box]], a hundred thousand Dissimulators emitted loud raspberries turned back instantly into the wands they had been concealing all along. Humiliated by the mass flouting of his pet law, Royston Idlewind resigned immediately, among celebrations. ===Later life=== {{Quote|A wand ban doesn't look so stupid now, does it?|Royston Idlewind, quoted by the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'', August, [[1994]].|Pottermore}}Idlewind seemed to have retired from public life sometime after that. After the incident of the [[Reappearance of the Dark Mark]], shortly after the final of the [[1994]] [[Quidditch World Cup]], he re-emerged briefly to give a statement to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' about how the latest goings-on proved him right about how wands should be confiscated during international Quidditch matches. ==Appearances== *{{PM}} {{Mention}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Idlewind, Royston}} [[de:Royston Idlewind]] [[es:Royston Idlewind]] [[pl:Royston Idlewind]] [[fr:Royston Idlewind]] [[pt-br:Royston Idlewind]] [[ru:Ройстон Идлвайнд]] [[Category:Australian individuals]] [[Category:Chasers]] [[Category:International Confederation of Wizards members]] [[Category:Males]] [[Category:Wizards]]"}]}}}}

'''Professor'''<ref name="HPLE"/> '''Arsenius Jigger''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and an author specialising in [[Potions (class)|Potions]] and [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]].

==Biography==
In his lifetime, he wrote several books in the fields of [[Potion]]s and [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]], having written: ''[[Magical Drafts and Potions]]'',<ref name="PS5">{{PS|B|5}}</ref> ''[[Potion Opuscule]]'',<ref name="hppts">{{HPPS}}, p. 504 {{see image|File:PotionOpuscule.jpg}}</ref> and ''[[The Essential Defence Against the Dark Arts]].''<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

Arsenius Jigger also contributed to ''[[Transfiguration Today]]'' in the [[1920s]] such as the article ''[[Lycanthropy]] v. [[Werewolf]]ry''.<ref name="FBF">{{FB|F}} {{see image|File:TransfigurationToday.png}}</ref> He was also, at an unknown point, a professor of [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="HPLE"/> A shop in [[Diagon Alley]], [[London]]  bears the name [[Slug & Jiggers Apothecary|Slug and Jiggers]], and may have been founded or owned by him.

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Defence Against the Dark Arts]]''': Jigger was an expert in defensive [[magic]], having written the well-regarded DADA textbook ''[[The Essential Defence Against the Dark Arts]]'', and was even the [[Professor]] of this subject at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] at an unknown point, showing his highly proficient knowledge in defending oneself against the [[Dark Arts]].<ref name="HPLE"/>
*'''[[Potion]]s''': Jigger was highly accomplished in the [[magic]]al art and [[science]] of potion-making, having written two Potions books in his lifetime, ''[[Magical Drafts and Potions]]''<ref name="PS5"/> and ''[[Potion Opuscule]]'',<ref name="hppts"/> the former of which was used as Hogwarts textbook in the [[Potions (class)|subject]].<ref name="PS5"/>
*'''[[Transfiguration]]''': Jigger was also knowledgeable of this notably very advanced, difficult and scientific branch of [[magic]], having contributed to the Transfiguration academic journal ''[[Transfiguration Today]]'', with an article regarding [[Werewolf|Werewolves]] and [[Lycanthropy]], showing he was well informed of the nature of [[Human Transfiguration]], a particularly hard form of transfiguration.<ref name="FBF"/>

==Etymology==
*Arsenius may be derived from the word "arsenious" meaning "containing arsenic", a very poisonous metallic element. Arsenius may also be be a reference to the famous physicist and chemist {{Wplink|Svante Arrhenius}}, most widely known for formulating the first modern definition of acids and bases in molecular terms.
*A jigger can refer to a liquid measurement that is used often for liquor, or a measuring cup specifically for measuring that amount of liquid. In the [[United States of America]], a jigger usually holds 1.5 fluid ounces (44 ml).<ref>{{Wikilink|Jigger (bartending)}}</ref> In modern bartending, a jigger is 50 ml.

'''Johannes Jonker''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Muggle-born|No-Maj born]] [[wizardkind|wizard]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s">{{WW|1920s-wizarding-america-en}}</ref> He, along with [[Shikoba Wolfe]], [[Thiago Quintana]], and [[Violetta Beauvais]], was one of four [[wandmaker]]s who served [[North America]] in the early [[20th century]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

==Biography==
Jonker was [[Muggle-born|born to No-Maj parents]]. His [[Johannes Jonker's father|father]] was a successful cabinet maker, which presumably gave him early experience with wood-working, and allowed him to become a skilled wandmaker in his own right.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" /> Jonker's [[wand]]s were in great demand and could be easily identified by the [[mother-of-pearl]] inlay they typically contained.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" /> Jonker experimented with several different [[wand core]]s before settling on [[Wampus cat hair|hair]] of the [[Wampus cat]] as his preferred kind.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

By [[1926]], he was a known wandmaker and listed on the [[Magical Congress of the United States of America]]'s [[Wand permit]] form.<ref name="FBF">{{FB|F}} {{see image|File:Wand Permit - full.png}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Wandlore]]/[[Wandmaker|Wandmaking]]''': Jonker was an accomplished and skilled wandmaker in his time, with his [[wand]]s being highly popular in [[North America]], showing his talent in this field. He was also knowledgeable of [[Wand core]]s and experimented with several kinds of core in his wands.<ref name="pottermore-1920s"/>

==Etymology==
*The surname "Jonker" is a variation of the Netherlands title "jonkheer", meaning "young lord", and can be a honorific or occupational surname indicating an ancestor that served a jonkheer.

==Behind the scenes==
*As a [[Muggle-born]], it is unknown how, or if, he was recruited to [[Ilvermorny School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] because of [[Rappaport's Law]] restriction on the interaction of wizards with his muggle family.

==Appearances==

*{{WW}} {{Mention}}

'''Albert Jorkins''' was the husband of [[Primrose Jorkins]], and the father of [[Grimwold Jorkins|Grimwold]], [[Granville Jorkins|Granville]], and [[Griselda Jorkins|Griselda Harmonia]]. Along with his wife, he announced the birth of his youngest daughter, Griselda, in the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''.<ref name="DP">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[8 February]], [[1999]], Page 2</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Albert" comes from the Germanic name Adalbert, which was composed of the elements adal "noble" and beraht "bright". This name was common among medieval German royalty. It was introduced by the Normans to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Æðelbeorht. Though it became rare in England by the 17th century, it was repopularized in the 19th century by the German-born Prince Albert, the husband of Queen Victoria.

==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]'' {{1st Mention}}

{{Quote|Think big! Think bigger than you have ever thought before! Let us see, this night, magic on such a scale that future generations will envy us for having witnessed such greatness!|The judges of the contest|Wonderbook: Book of Spells}}
These '''individuals''' were [[Wizardkind|wizards]] chosen to judge the [[1379 duelling contest|international duelling contest]] held on [[Dartmoor]], in [[1379]]. They all were distinguished [[warlock]]s and sorcerers from several different nations.<ref name="WBoS">{{WBS}}</ref>

==Biography==
After the [[wizardkind|wizards]] arrived, the [[duelling]] competition duly commenced. The duelling was noted, by witnesses, to have been of a standard that few had ever seen before. As the contest progressed, only four contestants remained: the [[England|English]] witch, [[Elizabeth Smudgling]], and three [[wizardkind|wizards]].<ref name="WBoS"/>

Before the four semi-finalists began their duels, the judges intervened with rousing speeches, telling them to think big and to display great magical prowess in the three duels that would follow.<ref name="WBoS"/>

[[File:1379 Third Vs Smudgling.png|250px|thumb|right|The judges look on as [[Elizabeth Smudgling]] disarms the [[Third semi-finalist of the 1379 duelling contest|third semi-finalist]]]]
When the [[Third semi-finalist of the 1379 duelling contest|third semi-finalist]] defeated the [[Second semi-finalist of the 1379 duelling contest|second semi-finalist]] by conjuring a powerful cyclone, the judges were blown away, as were most of the spectators, and several trees. It took several hours for everyone to regroup. Frightened of what the third wizard might do for his encore against [[Elizabeth Smudgling]], the last remaining contestant, the judges attempted to talk her out of duelling him, telling her that it might be easier if they simply gave him the cup before anyone else got hurt, but she refused.<ref name="WBoS" />

[[Elizabeth Smudgling|Smudgling]] [[Disarming Charm|Disarmed]] the wizard in the duel that ensued, making her the winner of the contest, for which the judges awarded her the title of "[[Supreme Dueller]]".<ref name="WBoS" />

==Behind the scenes==
*When the [[Second semi-finalist of the 1379 duelling contest|second semi-finalist]] conjures a violent storm during his duel against the [[Third semi-finalist of the 1379 duelling contest|third semi-finalist]], the judges open [[Wikipedia:Umbrella|umbrellas]] and continue looking on at the duel. The scene is set in [[1379]]; in the Middle Ages, Europeans depended on cloaks, not umbrellas, for protection against storms. Indeed, umbrellas were virtually unknown in western Europe until the mid-[[17th century]]. It is possible, however, that Goshawk took a creative liberty with the re-telling of the competititon for humerous effect.

==Appearances==
*{{WBS}} {{1st}}

'''Karkaroff's Aide''' (b. prior to [[October]] [[1977]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who attended [[Durmstrang Institute]] as a student during the mid-[[1990s]] and served as the aide of former [[Headmaster]] [[Igor Karkaroff]] during the time of the [[Triwizard Tournament]].

==Biography==

===Early Life===
Karkaroff’s Aide was born sometime before 1976 in an unknown European country. He attended Durmstrang Institute sometime during the late 80’s and early 90’s. While at Durmstrang, he befriended Viktor Krum and Igor Karkaroff. He graduated sometime before 1994 and later became Igor Karkaroff’s aide.

===Triwizard Tournament===
In October 1994, he travelled with his school to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where his school was to compete in the Triwizard Tournament. Unlike the other students, he didn’t put his name in the Goblet of Fire as he was a past student.<ref>https://hpana.com/news/18938</ref>

At the Yule Ball, Karkaroff’s Aide went with an unknown Beauxbatons Girl. They can be seen dancing at the ball and later with the other Durmstrang students when the Weird Sisters played. Later on, he asked Parvati Patil for a dance. They could be seen walking away, laughing and smiling.

He sat between Viktor Krum and Parvati Patil when Albus Dumbledore informed the students about the cause of the death of Cedric Diggory in the Great Hall at Hogwarts. It’s possible he had a romance with Parvati after the ball as they were sitting together. He later returned to Durmstrang with Igor and the other students at the end of the school year.

==Physical appearance==
He had oily jet black hair, hazel eyes, a hooked nose, high cheekbones, a moustache, and facial hair on his chin and jawline.

==Behind the scenes==
*Karkaroff's Aide was portrayed by [[Tolga Safer]] in {{GOF|FA}}. Tolga Safer auditioned for the role of [[Viktor Krum]] but did not get the part, mainly because he did not look like the character. [[Mike Newell]], the director, was so impressed with Tolga's acting that he made the role of Karkaroff's Aide especially for him.
*At least on occasion during filming, Tolga hung out with [[Stanislav Ianevski]], doing card tricks among other means of killing time. This can be seen on the bonus DVD for the film.
*In {{LEGO|Y1}}, this character may have been made more generic, being simply called "Durmstrang Student".
*It is possible that this individual is [[Poliakoff]]. However, this individual is trusted by Karkaroff, whereas Poliakoff is regarded by him as a "disgusting child" so this in highly unlikely.

==Appearances==
{{Imagecat|Images of Karkaroff's Aide}}[[File:Karkaroff's_Aide.jpg|thumb|right|Karkaroff's Aide]]

*{{HPV|CH}}

The '''father''' of [[Kevin]] was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He attended the [[Quidditch World Cup]] final in [[1994]] with his [[Kevin's mother|wife]] and two-year-old son named [[Kevin]], staying in a [[Kevin's family's tent|large, pyramid-shaped tent]]. Early in the morning, his young son got hold of his [[wand]], and played with it outside the family's tent. His wife caught the boy in the act, and, from the way she scolded him, it was apparent that this was not the first time something like this had happened.<ref>{{GOF|B|7}}</ref>

This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Kazu_Kibuishi","to":"Kazu Kibuishi"}],"pages":{"155968":{"pageid":155968,"ns":0,"title":"Kazu Kibuishi","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"{{Out of universe}}{{Person infobox |name=Kazu Kibuishi |image=KazuKibuishi.jpg |bgcolor1= |bgcolor2= |birthname=Kazuhiro Kibuishi |born= [[8 April]], [[1978]][[wikipedia:Kazu Kibuishi|Wikipedia]]
Tokyo, [[Japan]] |died= |nationality= [[United States of America|American]] |residence= |gender= Male |eyes= |hair= |height= |family= |alias= |occupation=Cover Artist }} {{Quote|The ''Harry Potter'' covers by Mary GrandPré are so fantastic and iconic. When I was asked to submit samples, I initially hesitated because I didn't want to see them reinterpreted! However, I felt that if I were to handle the project, I could bring something to it that many other designers and illustrators probably couldn't, and that was that I was also a writer of my own series of middle grade fiction. As an author myself, I tried to answer the question, ‘If I were the author of the books - and they were like my own children - how would I want them to be seen years from now?' When illustrating the covers, I tried to think of classic perennial paperback editions of famous novels and how those illustrations tend to feel. In a way, the project became a tribute to both ''Harry Potter'' and the literary classics.|Kazu Kibuishi on being asked to illustrate the ''Harry Potter'' series[http://mediaroom.scholastic.com/press-release/scholastic-unveils-first-seven-new-covers-harry-potter-books-celebration-15th-annivers Scholastic Unveils First of Seven New Covers for the Harry Potter Books in Celebration of the 15th Anniversary of Harry Potter - Scholastic.com]|}} '''Kazu Kibuishi''', a 4th-generation [[Japan]]ese-[[United States of America|American]], is an author and illustrator. Best known for his graphic novel ''Amulet'', Kibuishi was commissioned by [[Scholastic]] to illustrate special edition [[cover art]] for the fifteenth anniversary of the [[Harry Potter (book series)|''Harry Potter'' series]]. These special editions were released on [[27 August]] [[2013]].[http://www.amazon.com/Harry-Potter-Deathly-Hallows-Rowling/dp/0545583004/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1361919373&sr=1-1&keywords=harry+potter+and+the+deathly+hallows Amazon.com - ''Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows'' reissue] The cover art all of the titles was released in advance online, with that for the final title, {{DH}} released on [[31 July]] ([[Harry Potter]]'s birthday), 2013. These special editions retain the original interior illustrations by [[Mary GrandPré]].[http://www.amazon.com/Harry-Potter-Sorcerers-Stone-Rowling/dp/0545582881/ref=sr_1_2?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1365140187&sr=1-2&keywords=harry+potter+and+the+sorcerer%27s+stone Amazon.com - ''Sorcerer's Stone''] - "Inside is the full text of the original novel, with decorations by Mary GrandPré." ==Biography== Kazu was born in Tokyo, Japan on [[April]] [[8 April|8]] [[1978]]. He and his family moved to the [[United States of America|United States]] in [[1981]] and grew up near [[Los Angeles]], [[California]]. He began drawing comics at the age of 5. Despite his passion for drawing, Kazu decided not to attend art school and enrolled at the University of California Santa Barbara, where he graduated with a degree in Film Studies in [[2000]]. He pursued a career in the animation industry but found his way back to drawing comics. He currently works as a full-time graphic novelist, living in the Pacific Northwest with his wife, Amy Kim Kibuishi, and their children. He works alongside her and [[Jason Caffoe]].https://www.boltcityproductions.com/ ==Gallery== [[File:HARRY POTTER The Most Extraordinary Adventure of All Time|335px|thumb|center|Book Trailer]] Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone – Scholastic Fifteenth Anniversary Edition (Paperback).jpg|''Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone'' Harry-potter-new-chamber-of-secrets-cover-630.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets'' normal_potter_cover_3_CROP_article568-large.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban'' normal_kkhp4.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire'' normal_NY41373.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix'' Hbp 15 anniversary.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince'' Kkhp7-lg.jpg|''Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows'' Normal_boxset~0.jpg|Harry Potter Box Set Normal_kkhp-box-back-lg.jpg|Harry Potter Box Set ==External links== *[http://www.boltcity.com Kazu Kibuishi's official site] *[https://twitter.com/boltcity Kazu Kibuishi's official Twitter account] *[https://www.goodreads.com/author/show/27372 Kazu Kibuishi's official Goodreads account] ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kibuishi, Kazu}} [[ru:Казу Кибуиши]] [[Category:Illustrators (real-world)]] [[Category:Males]]"}]}}}}

'''Jimmy Kiddell''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[wandmaker]] who owned the shop [[Jimmy Kiddell's Wonderful Wands]] in [[Diagon Alley]]. He is presumably an inferior wandmaker to [[Garrick Ollivander]] as most wizard children get their wands at [[Ollivanders]].<ref name="PSF">{{PS|F}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Jimmy Kiddell might be a reference to [[Wikipedia:Jimmy Kimmel|Jimmy Kimmel]], an American television host and comedian, currently hosting ''Jimmy Kimmel Live!'', a late-night talk show that airs on ABC.

This unnamed '''Station Guard''' was employed at [[King's Cross Station]], [[London]], during at least the [[1990s]] through the [[2010s]].

==Biography==
===1991===
{{Dialogue a-b|Harry Potter|Excuse me sir. Can you tell me where I might find Platform 9¾?|Station guard|9¾? Think you're being funny do you?|Harry, searching for Platform 9¾|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (film)}}

[[Harry Potter]] first met the station guard in [[1991]], while trying to find his way to [[King's Cross Station#Platform 9¾|Platform 9¾]]. When Harry mentioned the name of the platform, the guard thought Harry was mocking him, because, not being a wizard, he did not know it existed.<ref>{{PS|F}}</ref>

[[File:Station guard 1.jpg|170px|thumb|right|The station guard in 1991]]

===1992===
{{Dialogue a-b|Station guard|What d'you two think you're doing?|Harry Potter|Sorry. Lost... lost control of the trolley|The guard's reaction to [[Harry Potter|Harry]] and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron]]'s collision with a wall|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)}}

In [[1992]], Harry and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]] tried entering Platform 9¾, but were prevented from doing so as the entrance had been magically blocked by the [[House-elf]] [[Dobby]]. The station guard saw the two boys running into the wall and asked them what they were doing. Harry got away, telling him that the two lost control of their trolleys.<ref>{{COS|F}}</ref>
[[File:Statios.jpg|170px|thumb|In 2017]]

===2017===
In [[2017]], this individual was still employed at [[King's Cross Station|King's Cross]].

==Behind the scenes==
*The station guard was portrayed by [[Harry Taylor]] in ''[[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (film)|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone]]'', ''[[Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (film)|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets]]'' and {{DH|F2}}.
*He originally appeared in the Epilogue scene at King's Cross station, but he was cut from the second shoot of the scene.
*The guard is also a playable character in the consoles versions of the LEGO video games.
*In {{LEGO|Y2}}, despite being a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] he appears in [[Platform Nine and Three-Quarters]] and in the [[Hogsmeade station]].

{{Quote|Yet more controversy in Patagonia: the outcome of the USA versus Jamaica clash is under investigation due to the sudden collapse of Kquewanda Bailey, the Jamaican Keeper, who toppled from her broom shortly before US Chaser Quentin Kowalski scored their ninth goal.|[[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]], "[[USA VERSUS JAMAICA (I)|USA VERSUS JAMAICA]]" (''[[Daily Prophet]]'', [[16 May]] [[2014]])|Pottermore}} 
'''Quentin Kowalski''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as a [[Chaser]] for the [[2014]] [[American National Quidditch team]]. During the fourth match of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup|427th Quidditch World Cup]], US versus [[Jamaican National Quidditch team|Jamaica]], Kowalski scored the ninth and final US goal.<ref name="usa-v-jam">{{PM}} - [[USA VERSUS JAMAICA (I)]] (Archived)</ref>

==Biography==
Just before Kowalski scored the goal, however, Jamaican [[Keeper]] [[Kquewanda Bailey]] unexpectedly toppled unconscious from her broomstick. The convenient timing of Bailey's unconsciousness aroused suspicion of foul play,<ref name="usa-v-jam"/> but the [[International Confederation of Wizards' Quidditch Committee|ICWQC]] later confirmed that Bailey was suffering from an infected [[Sasabonsam]] bite, sustained during the disastrous World Cup opening ceremony.<ref name="usa-v-jam2">{{PM}} - [[USA VERSUS JAMAICA (II)]] (Archived)</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*He may be a descendant of [[Queenie Goldstein]] and [[Jacob Kowalski]]. Their marriage would have been in violation of [[Rappaport's Law]] in the [[1920s]], but they could have left the country to marry or been married secretly. The law was repealed in 1965, after which Queenie and Jacob would have been free to live openly in the [[United States of America]] as husband and wife with their descendants. 

==Appearances==

*{{WW}} {{Mention}}

'''Mr Krum''' (fl. [[1977]]-[[1995]]) was a [[Bulgarian]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who was the father of [[Viktor Krum]]. He was described as having dark hair and a hooked nose like his son.<ref name="GOF31">{{GOF|B|31}}</ref>

Mr Krum travelled to [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] with his [[Viktor Krum's mother|wife]] to watch Viktor face the final task of the [[Triwizard Tournament]] in [[1995]].<ref name="GOF31"/>

Viktor told [[Harry Potter]] that his [[Viktor Krum's grandfather|grandfather]] was killed by [[Gellert Grindelwald]].<ref name="DH8">{{DH|B|8}}</ref> This man could have been either Mr Krum's father or his father-in-law.

'''Lancelot''' (fl. [[1899]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and cousin of [[Muriel]].

==Biography==
He worked as a [[Healer]] at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]], and revealed that, despite stories claiming that [[Ariana Dumbledore]] was ill, he had never seen her at the hospital.<ref name="DH8">{{DH|B|8}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name "Lancelot" is unknown, possibly an Old French diminutive of ''Lanzo''. In Arthurian legend Lancelot was the bravest of the knights of the Round Table. He became the lover of Arthur's wife Guinevere.

The '''landlord of The Hanged Man '''(fl. [[1943]]) was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] man who ran [[the Hanged Man]] pub in [[Little Hangleton]].

==Biography==
===The Riddle murders===
The night the [[Riddle family|Riddles]] were murdered, in the summer of [[1943]], his pub was filled with villagers who wanted to gossip about the murders. After the [[Riddles' cook]] entered the pub, bringing the news of the arrest of [[Frank Bryce]], the landlord commented that the war turned Bryce funny, perhaps hinting that he believed the gardener was guilty of the murders of his employers.<ref name="GoF">{{GOF|B|1}}</ref>

'''Minister Nobby Leach''' was the [[Great Britain|British]] [[Minister for Magic]] between [[1962]] and [[1968]]. He was the first [[Muggle-born]] [[Minister for Magic]] to ever hold office.

==Biography==
===Early life===
Leach was born into a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] family in [[Great Britain]], sometime in or prior to [[1945]]. He was somehow trained in the [[magic]]al arts and eventually managed to become the [[Minister for Magic]] for Britain and [[Ireland]], being elected at least once.

===As Minister for Magic===
In [[1962]], Leach was the first [[Muggle-born]] to be appointed to the post of [[Minister for Magic]]. Several of the oldest members of the [[Wizengamot]] resigned government posts in protest of his appointment.<ref name="PM">{{WW|ministers-for-magic}}</ref> Though Leach was believed to have played a part in England's 1966 World Cup Win, he denied these claims, stating that he had no part whatsoever.<ref name="PM" /> He left his post in [[1968]] due to a shady plot, of which [[Abraxas Malfoy]] was believed part<ref name="pottermore">{{WW|the-malfoy-family}}</ref>, that resulted in his contracting a mysterious illness.<ref name="PM" />

==Etymology==
*''Nobby ''is a diminutive form of the name ''Norbert'', meaning both "north" and "bright".
*''Leach ''could refer to a sub-class of worm and an ingredient in [[Polyjuice Potion]], [[leech|the leech]]. Surname from a mediæval doctor (reference to use of leeches in bloodletting).

}}This '''[[Wizardkind|wizard]]''' was one of the habitual clients of the [[Leaky Cauldron]]. In [[1991]] he commented with [[Dedalus Diggle]] on the return of [[Harry Potter]] as he was accompanied by [[Rubeus Hagrid|Hagrid]] to access [[Diagon Alley]].<ref name="PSF">{{PS|F}}</ref>

==Relationships==
[[File:Digel.jpg|100px|thumb|left|The wizard talking to Dedalus at the [[Leaky Cauldron]] in [[1991]]]]
He appeared to have a friendly relationship with [[Dedalus Diggle]] and [[Rubeus Hagrid]], and was likely also on cordial terms with [[Tom]], the Leaky Cauldron barman.<ref name="PSF"/>

==Appearances==

'''Corvus Lestrange''' was a [[French]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] and a member of the [[pure-blood]] [[Lestrange family]]. He was the son of [[Corvus Lestrange (I)|Corvus Lestrange]] and [[Heloise Lestrange|Heloise Beaufort]]. He had a brother [[Falco Lestrange|Falco]]. He married [[Minette Lestrange|Minette Rosier]] and had three children with her: two daughters, [[Manon Perrot|Manon]] and [[Josette Gage|Josette]], and a son [[Corvus Lestrange (III)|Corvus]].<ref>{{COG}} {{see image|File:LestrangeFamilyTree HighRes.png}}</ref>

'''Eduardo Lima''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] kept tabs on while it was under [[Fall of the Ministry of Magic|Death Eater control]] in [[1997]]. His file was signed by Chief Registration Authority [[F. L. Wakefield]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} {{See image|File:EduardoLimaMinistryPaperwork.JPG}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==

'''Eduardus Lima''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as a reporter for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''. He wrote [[BLACK STILL AT LARGE|the front-page article]] for the [[6 August]], [[1993]] issue, about the escape of [[Sirius Black]] from [[Azkaban]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:DailyProphetAzkaban.png|this image]])</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was named after [[Eduardo Lima]], a graphic artist who worked on every [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' film]] since ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]''.

'''Professor Limebert''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] sometime before [[Armando Dippet]].<ref name="HeadPortrait">See [[:File:Headmaster Limebert.jpg|this image]]</ref>

==Biography==
===Lifetime===
[[File:Headmaster Limebert.jpg|thumb|left|Limebert in his portrait in [[1992]]]]
At some point in his life, Limebert became the [[Headmaster]] of Hogwarts.<ref name="HeadPortrait"/>

===Post-mortem===
Professor Limebert died sometime in or before [[1992]].<ref name="DOD" /> A portrait of him was hung in the [[Headmaster's office]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in order to give advice to the current Head.<ref name="HeadPortrait"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*Limebert's portrait seems to have been based on an [https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:1851._BrullovPort_Lanchi.jpg 1851 portrait of archaeologist Michelangelo Lanci] by [[Wikipedia:Karl Bryullov|Karl Bryullov]].

'''Eduardus Limus''' was a [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] employee, who worked as [[Exotic Symbol Analyst]]<ref name="Twitter">[https://twitter.com/minalima/status/599605713455943683 "Our real jobs! :-)"] posted by MinaLima on Twitter on 16 May 2015</ref> for the [[Minister for Magic and Support Staff|Minister for Magic's Support Staff]].<ref name="SupportStaff">The plaque listing Eduardus Limus is identical in style to the other plaques on the doors to the offices of [[Minister for Magic and Support Staff|Level One]], as seen in {{DH|F1}} {{See image 2|File:MinistryLevelOne.png|File:Dolores Umbridge sign.png}}.</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Eduardus Limus is named after [[Eduardo Lima]], one of the graphic artists that produced many of the paper props seen in the [[Harry Potter (film series)|''Harry Potter'' films]].
*If [[Rufus Scrimgeour]] took any notice of the [[Sign of the Deathly Hallows|sign]] of the [[Deathly Hallows]] in [[Albus Dumbledore]]'s old copy of {{TBB}} upon confiscating the objects the late Headmaster left to the [[Trio]] in his will, he presumably tasked Mr Limus with figuring out its meaning. If this is the case, it was presumably to no avail, seeing as Scrimgeour would primarily focus on opening the [[Golden Snitch]]. Alternatively, Mr Limus did indeed recognise the symbol for what it was, with Scrimgeour dismissing "[[The Tale of the Three Brothers]]" and its associated artefacts as superstition and myth.

==Appearances==
*{{DH|F1}} {{Mention}}

'''Luciano Limus''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and a reporter for ''[[The New York Ghost]]'' in the [[1920s]].<ref name="dec6sunrise">{{FB|F}} {{See image|File:The New York Ghost - 6 Dec 1926 - Sunrise Early Edition.png}}</ref>

==Biography==
He wrote an article about the conviction of a [[wizardkind|wizarding]] entertainer for performing a [[Magic|magical]] juggling act in public that was published in the paper's [[6 December]] [[1926]] morning edition.<ref name="dec6sunrise" />

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was named after [[Eduardo Lima]], a graphic artist who worked on every [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' film]] from ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]'' onward, as well as the [[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film series)|''Fantastic Beasts'' films]].

This '''individual''' served [[Little Hangleton]] in the capacity of milkman in the late [[20th century]].<ref name="LEGOY1">{{LEGO|Y1}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual replaces the role of [[Frank Bryce]] in {{LEGO|Y1}}.<ref name="LEGOY1"/> Despite this, it is highly likely that he still existed [[canon]]ically as the milkman of Little Hangleton.
*Instead of noticing the lights on on the second floor, the milkman notices empty [[milk]] bottles on the front steps of the [[Riddle House]].<ref name="LEGOY1"/>
*His death at the hands of [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] cannot be considered canonical, as no echo of him emerges from Voldemort's wand during the [[Duel in Little Hangleton]], and further in canon, it was Frank Bryce who was murdered during that incident.<ref name="LEGOY1"/>

This '''individual''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] postman, whose route in [[Little Whinging]] included [[Privet Drive]]. In the summer of [[1994]], the postman delivered a [[Molly Weasley's letter to Vernon and Petunia Dursley (1994)|letter]] to the [[Dursley family]], although he chose to ring the doorbell and deliver the letter personally instead of leaving it in the mailbox. The letter in question had been sent by [[Molly Weasley]], who chose to use [[Muggle Mail|Muggle post]] instead of an [[owl]], and was absolutely covered in postage stamps save for a small space where she had written their address. The postman had found this as rather amusing, although [[Vernon Dursley]] did not.<ref>{{GOF|B|3}}</ref>

'''Mr Lockhart''' was the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] father of [[Gilderoy Lockhart]] and [[Gilderoy Lockhart's sisters|two older Squib daughters]].<ref name="PM">{{WW|gilderoy-lockhart}}</ref>

The [[Healer]] who looked after [[Gilderoy Lockhart|Gilderoy]] at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries|St Mungo's]], [[Miriam Strout]], stated he never got visitors in [[December]] [[1995]].<ref name="OOTP23">{{OOTP|B|23}}</ref> This meant that either his father was deceased by then, or that he did not wish to visit his son.

'''Algie Longbottom''' (fl. [[1991]]-[[1995]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He was the uncle of [[Frank Longbottom]] and the great-uncle of [[Neville Longbottom]].<ref name="longbottomfamilytree" />

==Biography==
Algie was born into the [[Longbottom family]],<ref name="longbottomfamilytree" /> an old [[Great Britain|British]] [[pure-blood]] family considered to be one of the [[Sacred Twenty-Eight]].<ref name="pm-pureblood">{{WW|pure-blood}}</ref> He had one known sibling, a [[Frank Longbottom's father|brother]],<ref name="longbottomfamilytree" /> and may have had others.<ref>{{WW|the-quill-of-acceptance-and-the-book-of-admittance}} on {{PM}} states that Neville had "disappointed great aunts and uncles." [[Algie Longbottom|Algie]] and [[Enid Longbottom|Enid]] are Neville's only known great-aunt and great-uncle. Thus, Neville must have had at least one other great-aunt and one other great-uncle in addition to them, who could potentially be unknown siblings of Mr Longbottom and Algie.</ref>

The Longbottom family initially believed that Algie’s great-nephew Neville might have been a [[Squib]], but Algie was determined to catch Neville off his guard and "force some [[magic]]" from him. He once pushed Neville off the end of [[Blackpool pier]]; however, he nearly drowned. While over for tea one time when Neville was eight, Algie hung him out of an upstairs window by his ankles, and accidentally dropped him when he was offered a [[meringue]] by his wife [[Enid Longbottom|Enid]]. Instead of getting hurt, Neville bounced safely down the garden and out into the road, thereby proving that he was in fact a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. They were all very happy and Neville’s grandmother [[Augusta Longbottom]] was crying.<ref name="PS7">{{PS|B|7}}</ref>

[[File:Trevor.jpg|150px|thumb|left|Trevor]]
In 1991, Algie gave Neville his pet toad [[Trevor]] as a present for gaining entrance into [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="PS7" /> In [[1995]], he travelled to [[Assyria]] and brought back a ''[[Mimbulus mimbletonia]]'' plant, which he gave to Neville for his birthday.<ref name="OOTP10">{{OOTP|B|10}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Algie is a short form of the name ''Algernon'' (the original name of [[Augustus Rookwood]]), originally a Norman French name derived from ''aux gernons'', meaning "having a moustache"<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/Algernon Behind the Name: Algernon]</ref> This is the name of a main character in Oscar Wilde's ''The Importance of Being Earnest''. Algie is also a homophone of the plant-like organisms ''algae'', possibly referring to the interest in [[Herbology]] that Algie and his great-nephew seem to share.

'''Harfang Longbottom''' (fl. 20th centuy) was a [[pure-blood]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who married [[Callidora Black]]. The couple had two children, a son and a daughter.<ref>''[[House of Black|Black Family tree]]''</ref> Harfang may be related to [[Frank Longbottom|Frank]] and [[Neville Longbottom]].
==Behind the scenes==
*Harfang was not Featured on the Longbottom family tree shown on Pottermore, but he is Featured on the Black Family tree.<ref>[https://www.pottermore.com/features/black-family-tree Pottermore - The Black family tree]</ref>

==Etymology==
The name Harfang may be derived from ''Harfang des neiges'', a French term for "snowy owl."<ref>"[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/harfang Harfang]" at Wiktionary</ref> In ''The Silver Chair'', the sixth book in the ''The Chronicles of Narnia'' series by [[Wikipedia:C.S. Lewis|C.S. Lewis]], Harfang is a city of giants in the far north.

J.R.R Tolkien, the author of The Hobbit and The Lord of the Rings, gave the name Longbottom to one of the Hobbits' villages in the Shire, which is known for its pipe-weed.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP|F}} {{Comment|[[House of Black|Black family]] tapestry}}

}}'''Lars Lundekvam''' was [[Norway|Norwegian]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as a [[Chaser]] for the [[2014]] [[Norwegian National Quidditch team]].

==Biography==
During the first match of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup]] against the [[Ivorian National Quidditch team|Ivory Coast]], Lundekvam twice suffered [[jinx]]es cast at him from members of the crowd, leading the match to be halted while security wizards located the culprits.<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[NORWAY VERSUS IVORY COAST]] (Archived)</ref> These unprovoked attacks were presumably due to the crowd's distaste at the Norwegian team, as their mascot, a [[Selma]], had instigated a fight against the [[Fiji]]an [[Dukuwaqa]] that escalated into a chaotic riot amongst the mascots that left three hundred wizards injured.<ref name="PM2">{{PM}} - [[DISASTROUS OPENING CEREMONY LEADS TO QUESTIONS ABOUT QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP SECURITY]] (Archived)</ref>

'''Aidan Lynch''' was an [[Ireland|Irish]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[Seeker]] for the [[Irish National Quidditch team]] during the [[1994]] [[Quidditch World Cup]]. Although his team won the World Cup with the most points, Seeker [[Viktor Krum]] caught the [[Golden Snitch]]. Lynch had a tendency to crash during dives, often resulting in him being dazed for a while afterwards. During the first dive, Lynch was just knocked out for a few minutes but after the second dive, he was left dazed for a long period of time.<ref>{{GOF|B|8}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Aidan shares his last name with Irish-born actress [[Evanna Lynch]], who plays [[Luna Lovegood]] in the [[Harry Potter (film series)|films]].
