'''Magnus "Dent-Head" MacDonald''' (fl. [[1960s]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who unsuccessfully campaigned to lift the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]]'s ban on the game of [[Creaothceann]] in the [[1960s]].<ref name="QTAR2">{{QTA|R|2}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Magnus" is a Latin name meaning "great". It was borne by 7th-century saint who was a missionary in Germany. It became popular in Scandinavia after the time of the 11th-century Norwegian king Magnus I, who was said to have been named after Charlemagne, or Carolus Magnus in Latin. The name was borne by six subsequent kings of Norway as well as three kings of Sweden. It was imported to Scotland and Ireland during the Middle Ages.

==Appearances==

This individual was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as a '''salesman''' at the [[Magical Menagerie]] in [[Diagon Alley]].<ref name="COSG"/>

==Biography==
[[File:Christmasspell.gif|thumb|left|This wizard conjuring Christmas decorations]]
Sometime in [[1992]], he was hired as a temporary salesman for the [[Magical Menagerie]], as the usual [[Magical Menagerie saleswoman|saleswoman]] was on holiday. He was very stingy during morning hours and did not allow people to enter the shop, however in the afternoon he was willing to give [[Harry Potter]] some [[Lacewing fly|lacewing flies]] if he could catch them. Harry was warned of this man's morning grumpiness by [[Menagerie Message|a note]] from his friend [[Ronald Weasley]].<ref name="COSG">{{COS|G}}</ref>

In [[December]] [[1992]], he used a [[Christmas decorations conjuring spell|spell]] to [[Conjuration|conjure]] decorations for [[Christmas]] in the shop.<ref name="COSG"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*In the PS1 version of the [[Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (video game)|video game adaption]] of {{COS}} the individual is old and will not allow Harry to destroy the crates in the shop, however in the console version he is also very stingy and will not let people inside the Menagerie. In the GBA version [[Ronald Weasley]] describes him as miserable and old in a note to Harry that says he should be careful as the salesman would throw those out who sneak around.

==Appearances==
*{{COS|G}} {{1st}}

*[[William I|King William I]]}}'''Armand Malfoy''' (fl. [[1066]]) was a [[France|French]] born [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who arrived in [[Great Britain]] with the Norman invasion. He was the first [[Malfoy family|Malfoy]] in Britain, and the founder of [[Malfoy Manor]] in [[Wiltshire]].<ref name="pottermore">{{WW|the-malfoy-family}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Early life===
Armand was presumably born sometime in the late [[First millennium A.D.|10th]] or early [[11th century]] in France. He came to Britain along with the Norman invasion, and presumably gained the friendship of [[William I|William the Conqueror]] sometime around this time.

===Life in Britain===
Sometime after William I was made King of [[England]] in [[1066]], Armand provided various services to the king. Though the exact details of these services are unknown, they were believed to be shady and magical in nature. In exchange for these services, King William granted Armand a prime piece of land in Wiltshire, seizing the property from the former landholders.

===Legacy===
This piece of property would go on to become Malfoy Manor, and would be the home of the Malfoy family for the next ten centuries. Later members of the family would expand the estate even further by annexing more property from the surrounding [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]s.

==Behind the scenes==
*Armand may have attended [[Beauxbatons Academy of Magic]], if the school already existed in his youth.

==Etymology==
*''Armand ''is a French name, derived from the Germanic name ''Herman'', meaning "army man".
*''Malfoy ''comes from the French ''mal foi'', meaning "bad faith".
*Therefore, the name ''Armand Malfoy ''could be taken to mean "man of bad faith," which could describe any (or rather, ''almost ''any) of Malfoy's descendants.

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}
*{{WW}} {{Mention}}

==Notes and references==

That's how they track people now.|Harry Potter|How do you know that?|Ronald Weasley|I overheard some bloke at the Ministry talking about it.|Ron and Harry about this wizard|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1}}
This '''individual''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] with knowledge of the [[taboo]] on [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s name.

==Biography==
===Early life/education===
Little is known of this man's life; he was born into either a [[pure-blood]] or [[half-blood]] family<ref name="BLOOD"/> sometime in or before [[1980]].<ref name="AGE"/> Nothing else is known of that portion of his life.

===Career===
Sometime in or before [[1997]], he was employed by the [[British Ministry of Magic]]. Sometime that year, [[Ronald Weasley|Reginald Cattermole]] overheard the wizard talking about the [[Taboo]] [[curse]] that had been placed on [[Tom Riddle|Voldemort]]'s name.<ref>{{DH|F1}} {{Deleted scenes|Tent}}</ref> Hence, it is possible that he was close to the Voldemort or the [[Death Eaters]], given that otherwise he'd likely be too scared to speak of the curse on the former's name.

==Appearances==
*{{DH|F1}} {{1st Mention}}

{{Quote|Harry Potter, yes? I understand you seek an [[Eagle Owl feather]]. For three [[Sickle]]s, I will allows you to go out to the back and fetch one for yourself.|The manager|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (video game)}}

This '''individual''' was the manager of [[Eeylops Owl Emporium]] in [[Diagon Alley]]. In [[1991]]-[[1992]] he sold [[Harry Potter]] the [[Eagle owl feather|feather]] of his own [[Eagle owl]] which were sleeping in the owlery-department of the shop.<ref>{{PS|G}} {{C|PlayStation version only}}</ref> The feather was worth three [[Sickle]]s. During the [[Christmas holidays]] in [[1992]], he went [[bird-watching]] in [[Wales]], leaving his [[Eeylops Owl Emporium|shop]] closed.<ref>{{COS|G}} {{C|PlayStation version only}}</ref> He eventually returned some time later however.

==Behind the scenes==
{{Quote|You've got your feather, I see. Well done, and thank you very much. Do call again soon, Harry, and give my regards to [[Hedwig]]. Cheerio.|The manager|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (video game)}}
*It is unknown if this individual owned the shop or simply worked as manager there. If the former is correct, his name may be Eeylops.
*The fact that he asks Harry to give his regards to Hedwig may imply that either they were good friends, or he was the one who sold Hedwig. It is unknown how he learned of Hedwig's name, given that Harry gave her that name after Hagrid bought her him.
*In the Game Boy Color version of the [[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (video game)|video game adaptation]] of {{PS}}, this man claims that children not yet in [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] cannot purchase [[owl]]s at the shop. This cannot be considered [[canon]], however, as it is contradicted by the ability to do so in {{PM}}.

==Appearances==

*{{COS|G}} {{Comment|Indirect mention}}

{{Quote|I'm never stocking them again, never!|The manager regarding the aggressiveness of [[The Monster Book of Monsters]]|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban}}

The '''manager''' of [[Flourish and Blotts]] was a much-tired [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who took the brunt of teachers' selection of required textbooks for their classes that turned out to be somewhat exotic.

==Biography==
===1992===
[[File:ManagerOfFlourishAndBlotts.png|200px|thumb|left|The manager in 1992]]

{{Quote|Gentleman, please-please!|The manager trying to stop [[Lucius Malfoy]] and [[Arthur Weasley]] fighting|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}

In [[1992]], he was first seen by [[Harry Potter]] on camera at [[Flourish and Blotts]] as he was trying to keep [[Gilderoy Lockhart]]'s book signing under control.<ref name="CS4">{{COS|B|4}}</ref>

===1993===
{{Quote|Stop it! Stop it!|The manager trying to stop copies of the [[The Monster Book of Monsters]] from attacking each other|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban}}In [[1993]], he told [[Harry Potter|Harry]] that he had once lost a lot of money on ''[[The Invisible Book of Invisibility]],'' because they never found the books. When the ''[[The Monster Book of Monsters]]'' became one books required by students at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]], he had to cope with the new additions to his book list attacking both each other and him; the manager spent much of that summer vowing never to stock that book again. Whenever he had to grab a copy for a customer, he would become rather unhappy due to the books' viciousness; while he was relieved that Harry already got a copy beforehand, he was on the verge of tears when [[Ronald Weasley]] and [[Hermione Granger]] requested two copies total. He also recommend Harry to not buy ''[[Death Omens: What to Do When You Know the Worst is Coming]]'', as it was enough to frighten anyone to [[death]], and in general doesn't recommend reading books about death omens because one would start seeing them everywhere.<ref name="PA4">{{POA|B|4}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*As the owner of [[Flourish and Blotts]], it is possible that his name is either Flourish or Blotts. However, knowing that his shop was established in [[15th century]], he might not be an indirect descendant of the founder.

==Appearances==
*{{PS|G}} {{Comment|GBC version}}
*{{COS}}
*{{COS|G}} {{Comment|PS2 version}}
*{{POA}}

{{Quote|Vernon tells me you're a ''wonderful'' golfer, Mr Mason...|[[Petunia Dursley]] practising compliments for Mr Mason.|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}
'''Mr Mason''' was a rich builder from whom [[Vernon Dursley]] was hoping to get a big drill order in [[1992]].<ref name="COS1">{{COS|B|1}}</ref>

==Biography==
On [[31 July]], Mr Mason and his [[Mason's wife|wife]] were dinner guests at the [[4 Privet Drive|Dursley home]]. The evening was nearly ruined when the dessert [[Petunia Dursley]] had made crashed to the floor (an incident blamed on [[Harry Potter]], though it was actually [[Dobby]]'s fault). The evening could have been rescued were it not for the barn [[owl]] that flew through the open window and dropped a letter on Mrs Mason’s head. Mr Mason then informed the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]] that his wife was mortally afraid of [[bird]]s. He then left their home quickly following after his screaming wife.<ref name="COS2">{{COS|B|2}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The English word "''mason",'' meaning a craftsmen, normally a stoneworker, and originally leaders of teams of builders. This is likely a reference to Mr Mason's position as head of a building company.

==Behind the scenes==
[[File:Mr._Mason_LEGO.jpg|215px|thumb|Mr Mason as seen in {{LEGO|Y1}}]]
*Mr Mason was portrayed by [[Jim Norton]] in {{COS|FA}}.
*In {{COS|FA}}, the pudding, levitated by [[Dobby]], crashed down on Mrs Mason's head, ruining the dinner party and causing [[Vernon Dursley]] to lock Harry in his bedroom. Also, instead of the Ministry owl dropping a letter on Mrs Mason, Petunia said: "Would you like some ice cream, Mr and Mrs Mason?"
*In a deleted scene, Mr Mason was said that he was a wonderful golfer and he says that he plays occasionally. This was his only line in the film but was cut out from the theatre version.

==Appearances==
*{{COS}} {{1st}}
*{{COS|F}}
*{{LEGO|Y1}}
*{{PM}}

'''Dougal McBride''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and the [[Seeker]] for the [[Pride of Portree]].<ref name="wizardsm">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/m.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: M]" on The Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Biography==
During a match with the [[Appleby Arrows]], he crashed into the opposing team's Seeker, [[Gregory Cotton]], while both were racing to catch the [[Golden Snitch]].<ref name="wizardsm" /><ref name="wizardsc">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/c.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: C]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref><ref name="dp">"[http://www.hplex.info/about/sources/source_dp.html Daily Prophet newsletters]" on The Harry Potter Lexicon</ref> Cotton came out holding the Snitch, but an altercation with McBride ensued, during which [[jinx]]es were illegally exchanged, and McBride [[transfiguration|transfigured]] Cotton's head into a cabbage.<ref name="wizardsc" /><ref name="dp" /> McBride defended his actions to the referee, [[Josiah Plunkett]], by claiming that Cotton had hit him with a [[Jelly-Fingers Curse]] during the race for the Snitch, and thus deserved to be "cabbaged."<ref name="wizardsm" /><ref name="wizardsp">"[http://www.hplex.info/wizards/a-z/p.html Wizards, Witches and Beings: P]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Dougal" is the anglicised form of the Gaelic name Dubhghall, which meant "dark stranger" from dubh "dark" and gall "stranger".

==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]''

}}'''Malcolm McGonagall''' was a [[Scotland|Scottish]] [[half-blood]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who was the second child and first son of the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[Robert McGonagall Senior|Robert McGonagall]] and witch [[Isobel Ross]].<ref name="pottermore">{{WW|professor-mcgonagall}}</ref>

==Biography==
Malcolm revealed his [[magic]]al ability at an early age. His mother, and his older sister [[Minerva McGonagall|Minerva]], worked together to teach him and his younger brother, [[Robert McGonagall Jr|Robert Jr]], that they could not go about showing off their magic. They also worked to conceal the "accidents and embarrassments" that the two boys' magic sometimes caused from their father.<ref name="pottermore" />

Malcolm eventually fathered at least one child. His offspring would often visit his sister's home in [[Hogsmeade]] during her brief marriage between [[1981]] and [[1984]].<ref name="pottermore" />

*[[M. G. McGonagall]] (possibly)
|hidea=
|job=Presbyterian minister
|loyalty=[[McGonagall family]]
}}'''Reverend Robert McGonagall Senior''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] and Presbyterian minister who lived in [[Caithness]], in [[Scotland]], during the early [[20th century|twentieth century]]. He [[Marriage|married]] [[Isobel Ross]], and together they had several children: [[Minerva McGonagall|Minerva]], [[Malcolm McGonagall|Malcolm]], and [[Robert McGonagall Jr|Robert Jr]]; all of them [[wizardkind|wizards]].<ref name="pottermore">{{WW|professor-mcgonagall}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Early life===
Robert was born to [[Robert McGonagall Senior's father|Mr]] and [[Robert McGonagall Senior's mother|Mrs McGonagall]], and grew up in [[Scottish village|a village]] in [[Scotland]].<ref name="pottermore"/>

At some point during his teens, Robert became captivated by the high-spirited [[Isobel Ross]], who lived in the same village. Like his neighbours, Robert believed that Isobel attended a select ladies' boarding school in [[England]]. In fact, when Isobel vanished from her home in the school months, she was attending [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] as she was, unbeknownst to Robert, a [[wizardkind|witch]].<ref name="pottermore"/>

===Marriage and family===
Deeply in love, Robert and Isobel (then aged eighteen) decided to elope, angering both sets of parents. They married and had a blissful honeymoon, on which Isobel could not bear to tell her Robert she was a witch, and so the fact remained a secret.<ref name="pottermore"/>

Robert and Isobel moved to [[McGonagall manse|a manse]] on the outskirts of [[Caithness]]. She proved skilled at making the most of the small income he earned as a Presbyterian minster.<ref name="pottermore"/>

The couple's first child, a [[Minerva McGonagall|daughter]], arrived on [[4 October]], [[1935]]. Isobel, missing her family and the [[wizarding world|magical world]] she left behind in the name of love, named the baby Minerva in honour of [[Minerva|her own grandmother]], a powerful witch. The residents of Caithness found this name extremely unusual and Reverend McGonagall found it very difficult to explain to the members of his congregation why Isobel had chosen it. After Minerva's birth, Isobel became moody, alarming her husband. When Robert consulted his [[Robert McGonagall Senior's friends|friends]], they told him that post-partum depression was not uncommon for new mothers to go through, and that it would soon pass. However, Isobel only grew more withdrawn, sometimes hiding away with Minerva for days on end.<ref name="pottermore"/>

What Isobel was actually trying to do was keep Robert from catching sight of any of the [[underage magic|subtle signs]] of being magic that Minerva had displayed from her very first hours of life. One night, she finally broke down under her husband's gentle questioning, and, in tears, retrieved her [[Isobel McGonagall's wand|wand]] from where it was hidden and showed him she was a witch. Robert, while shocked by this revelation, did not love Isobel any less after it. Isobel also explained how she was bound to keep the existence of the wizarding world secret from Muggles by [[International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy]].<ref name="pottermore"/>

While the couple still loved each other afterward, they never regained the sense of trust they once shared, something which Minerva, an extremely bright, observant child, soon recognised.<ref name="pottermore"/>

Isobel and her husband eventually had two more children: [[Malcolm McGonagall|Malcolm]] and [[Robert McGonagall Jr|Robert Jr]]. In time, both proved to be magical, and Minerva readily helped her mother teach them that they could not go around showing off their magical powers, and helped her cover up the accidents their magic sometimes caused.<ref name="pottermore"/>

==Personality and traits==
Robert McGonagall was a serious, upright, and honest man. He seemed to be amiable and close to his parishoners.<ref name="pottermore"/> His daughter [[Minerva McGonagall|Minerva]] was noted to be similar to the Reverend in temperament and personality. As such, one can presume he was strict, stern, and clever.<ref name="PS8">{{PS|B|8}}</ref>Robert was also a lover of music and was known to play, as his daughter was noted for enchanting his bagpipes at times from a very young age much to her enjoyment.

Going to be any more showers of owls, tonight, Jim?''"
"''Well, Ted, I don’t know about that, but it’s not only the owls that have been acting oddly today. Viewers as far apart as [[Kent]], [[Yorkshire]], and [[Dundee]] have been phoning in to tell me that instead of the rain I promised yesterday, they’ve had a downpour of shooting stars! Perhaps people have been celebrating [[Bonfire Night]] early — it’s not until next week, folks! But I can promise a wet night tonight.|Ted and Jim McGuffin|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}} '''Jim McGuffin''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[television]] weatherman in [[1981]], working alongside [[Ted]]. McGuffin had predicted [[Water|rain]] for [[1 November|November 1st]], but due to the downfall of [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and celebrations by the [[Wizarding world|Wizarding community]], his forecasted rain became shooting stars across some areas of [[Great Britain]]. Obviously unaware of the true reason, McGuffin wondered on air if people had been [[Fall of Lord Voldemort celebrations|celebrating]] [[Bonfire Night]] early. [[Vernon Dursley]] watched the broadcast, prompting him to ask his wife, [[Petunia Dursley|Petunia]], if the peculiar weather had anything to do with her [[Lily J. Potter|sister's]] "[[Wizardkind|people]]." ==Behind the scenes== *In fiction, a '''MacGuffin''' (sometimes '''McGuffin''' or '''maguffin''') is a plot device in the form of some goal, desired object, or other motivator that the protagonist pursues, often with little or no narrative explanation. The specific nature of a MacGuffin is typically unimportant to the overall plot. The most common type of MacGuffin is a person, place, or thing (such as money or an object of value). Other more abstract types include victory, glory, survival, power, love, or some unexplained driving force.[[Wikipedia:MacGuffin|MacGuffin on Wikipedia]] ==Appearances== *{{PS}} {{1st}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} [[de:Jim McGuffin]] [[es:Jim McGuffin]] [[fr:Jim McGuffin]] [[it:Jim McGuffin]] [[pl:Jim McGuffin]] [[pt-br:Jorge Mendes]] {{DEFAULTSORT:McGuffin, Jim}} [[Category:British individuals]] [[Category:Journalists]] [[Category:Males]] [[Category:Meteorologists]] [[Category:Muggles]]"}]}}}}

'''Mentor Metaxas''' was a Greek [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and the chairman of the [[International Confederation of Wizards Quidditch Committee]] in 2014.<ref name="the-qwc2014-final">{{PM}} - [[2014 Quidditch World Cup final]] (Archived)</ref>

==Biography==
He attended the final of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup|427th Quidditch World Cup]], on [[11 July]], [[2014]]. Shortly before the match started, he was spotted by ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' reporter [[Rita Skeeter]] chatting to the President of the [[Argentinian Council of Magic]], [[Valentina Vázquez]].<ref name="the-qwc2014-final" />

==Behind the scenes==
*If this individual's name is indication of anything, he is probably [[Greece|Greek]] or of Greek descent — the name "Mentor" is an Ancient Greek name that features in Greek Mythology,<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/mentor "Mentor"] at [http://www.behindthename.com/ Behind the Name]</ref> and the surname Metaxas is also Greek: Greek archicted and marksman [[Wikipedia:Anastasios Metaxas|Anastasios Metaxas]] (1862-1937), Greek politician [[Wikipedia:Andreas Metaxas|Andreas Metaxas]] (1790-1860), and Greek general and dictator [[Wikipedia:Ioannis Metaxas|Ioannis Metaxas]] (1871–1941) are some notable people who bore this surname.

'''Minister Harold Minchum''' was [[Minister for Magic]] between [[1975]] and [[1980]].

He was seen as a hard-liner, and placed even more [[Dementor]]s around [[Azkaban]]. But he was unable to contain what seemed like [[Tom Riddle|Voldemort]]'s unstoppable rise to power.<ref>{{WW|ministers-for-magic}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*The name "Harold Minchum" is a near-homophone of [[Wikipedia:Harold Wilson|Harold Wilson]], Prime Minister of the United Kingdom whose second term in office ([[1974]] to [[1976]]) would have coincided with that of Harold Minchum's.

This '''Hornbill''' was a pet male<ref name="WU"/> [[bird]] owned by [[Minerva McGonagall]] from [[1992]] or earlier.<ref name="COSF"/>

==History==
[[File:COS_Vera_Verto_demo.gif|thumb|left|McGonagall using her bird to demonstrate ''Vera Verto'']]
In [[1992]], [[Minerva McGonagall|Professor McGonagall]] used the bird to demonstrate the [[Transforming Spells|transforming spell]], ''[[Vera Verto]],'' in front of her [[Second year|second-years']] [[Transfiguration (class)|Transfiguration]] class.<ref name="COSF">{{COS|F}} - Chapter 14 (''About the Chamber'')</ref>

During the [[2020s]], this hornbill appeared as a [[Foundable]] during the [[Calamity]].<ref name="WU"/>

==Appearances==
*{{PS|F}} {{1st}}
*{{COS|F}}
*{{WU}}

Calm down.|This individual calms the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] pamphlet makers after [[Harry Potter]] releases a bunch of [[Decoy Detonator]]s|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1}}

This '''individual''' was a [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] Official after the [[Fall of the Ministry of Magic]]. On [[2 September]], [[1997]], he calmed the Ministry pamphlet makers down after [[Harry Potter]] released a bunch of [[Decoy Detonator]]s in order to distract them and gain entrance to [[Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic's office|Dolores Umbridge's office]].<ref>{{DH|F1}} - Chapter 12 (''Secret Files'')</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
[[File:Minister for Magic Support Staff official.jpg|150px|thumb|left]]
*This individual was portrayed by [[George Potts]] in the film adaptation of {{DH|F1}}, credited as "Bald Wizard".

==Appearances==
*{{DH|F1}} {{1st}}

This '''individual''' (fl. [[1995]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked for [[Magical Maintenance Department|Magical Maintenance]] at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] in the capacity of [[Ministry of Magic lifts|lift]] attendant in the mid-[[1990s]]. He was noticeably bored during the course of his job on the morning of [[12 August]], on which day he was operating the lift that carried [[Harry Potter]] and [[Arthur Weasley]] down into Level 9 and [[Courtroom Ten]].<ref name="OPf5">{{OOTP|F}} - Chapter 5 (''The Ministry of Magic'')</ref>

By [[1997]], during [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s [[Fall of the Ministry of Magic|puppet regime]], there were no attendants operating the lifts, so it is possible this individual either quit his job or was sacked for his blood status.

He was seen attempting to persuade a wizard named [[Archie Aymslowe]] to change out of his flowery nightgown and into a pair of trousers.<ref>{{GOF|B|7}}</ref>

'''Tobias Misslethorpe'''<ref name="LE">{{HPLE}}</ref> was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and the founding editor of ''[[Witch Weekly Magazine|Witch Weekly]]''.<ref name="portrait">{{POA|F}} {{see image|File:Tobias Misslethorpe.jpg}}</ref> His portrait was painted by [[Oliver Cartwright]].<ref name="LE"/>

==Biography==
===Life===
During his lifetime, Misslethorpe founded ''[[Witch Weekly Magazine|Witch Weekly]]'', a popular magazine for [[wizardkind|witches]], serving as its first editor.<ref name="portrait" />

===Legacy===
Misslethorpe died sometime in or prior to [[1993]].<ref name="death" /> A [[portrait]] of him, painted by the artist [[Oliver Cartwright]], was hung at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="portrait" />

==Etymology==
The name "Tobias" is the Greek form of Tobiah. This is the name of the hero of the apocryphal Book of Tobit in many English versions of the Old Testament. It relates how Tobias, with the help of the archangel Raphael, is able to drive away a demon who has been plaguing Sarah, who subsequently becomes his wife. It is also known that he shares the same first name as that of [[Tobias Snape]], who is the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] father of [[Severus Snape]].

==Behind the scenes==
*Misslethorpe's portrait was based on an [http://static.guim.co.uk/sys-images/Guardian/Pix/pictures/2012/10/3/1349274716566/disraeliportrait.jpg 1881 elegiac of Prime-Minister Benjamin Disraeli], by [[Wikipedia:John Everett Millais|John Everett Millais]] (1829–1896). The face, however, was modelled after [[Barry Wilkinson]], the props master on all eight [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]].<ref>[http://www.flickr.com/photos/tonyridder/7537611422/ The Making of Harry Potter photo] on Flickr</ref>
*This character's portrait can be seen in the "The Quest of [[Cadogan|Sir Cadogan]]" feature on Disc 2 of the ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]'' DVD.

==Appearances==
*{{POA|F}} {{Portrait}}
*{{POA|G}} {{Portrait}}
*{{OOTP|G}} {{Portrait}}
*{{HBP|G}} {{Portrait}}
*{{DH|G2}}<ref>Tobias himself has escaped during the [[Battle of Hogwarts]], but his portrait is there.</ref>

==Notes and references==

'''Cuthbert Mockridge''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who was a member of the [[Goblin Liaison Office]], heading the office during the mid-[[1990s]]. He attended the finals of the [[1994]] [[Quidditch World Cup]], and was among the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry]] employees to pass by the [[Weasley family]]'s tent.<ref name="GOF7">{{GOF|B|7}}</ref> He had retired or otherwise left the position by the summer of [[1996]], as [[Dirk Cresswell]] was Head by then.

==Etymology==
The name "Cuthbert" is derived from the Old English (Anglo-Saxon) elements cuæ "famous" and beorht "bright".
==Behind the scenes==
===Translations===
*Czech: ''Cuthbert Jakopec'' (Cuthbert "Like-An-Oven")
*Danish: ''Cuthbert Goblinus'' (possibly a play on the word [[Goblin]])
*Dutch: ''Horus Windgoud'' (''Horus'' is an ancient Egyptian deity of the sky, ''Wind'' has the same meaning in English and might reflect Horus as sky god, ''goud'' "gold")
*French: ''Cubert Faussecreth''
*German: ''Knutbert Mockridge''
*Hebrew: ''קאת'ברט מוקרידג' ''
*Norwegian: ''Herbert Hildering''
*Ukrainian: ''Катберт Мокридж {{c|Katbert Mokrydzh}}''
The following languages are the same as the original:
{|
|
*Croatian
|
*Faroese
|
*Italian
|}

'''Arnulf Moe''' was a Norwegian wizard and the manager of the [[Norwegian National Quidditch team]] in [[2014]]. It was his decision to change the team mascot from performing [[troll]]s to the [[Selma]]. When questioned about the change after conflict the Selma had with the [[Fiji]]an [[Dukuwaqa]], Moe defended his choice, claiming that the Selma represented the "steely determination and ferocity of the Norwegian players".<ref name=PM>{{PM}} - [[DISASTROUS OPENING CEREMONY LEADS TO QUESTIONS ABOUT QUIDDITCH WORLD CUP SECURITY]] (Archived)</ref>

}}'''Dave Monk''' was a reporter for ''[[Metro]]'', a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] newspaper. He wrote the front-page article of the [[12 August]], [[1995]] issue, about the birth and recovery of his two sons, [[Tom Monk|Tom]] and [[Jack Monk|Jack]], who were delivered prematurely.<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:Metro.png|this image]])</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*David Monk is the deputy editor of the British newspaper ''[[Metro]]'' in real life.<ref>"[https://shipmonk.co.uk/about/ About]" from Shipmonk</ref> He wrote a blog post explaining that newspapers are sometimes asked to create mock front pages to be used in film and television productions. A preliminary front-page mock-up featuring a fake article was given to ''Metro'' by the ''Harry Potter'' production team. Monk tweaked the design so that it looked more like a genuine issue of ''Metro'', and added his own name to the mock article's byline, as the original author had not included one. He does not have a wife named Tilly or twin sons named Jack and Tom.<ref>"[https://shipmonk.co.uk/2014/03/15/how-i-discovered-my-secret-double-life-in-the-harry-potter-universe/ How I discovered my secret double life in the Harry Potter universe]" from Shipmonk</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP|F}} {{1st Mention}}
*{{HPLE}} {{Mention}}

==Biography==
He and his wife, [[Graham Montague's mother|Mrs Montague]], visited [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in [[1996]] after their son was finally freed from a prolonged entrapment inside a [[Vanishing Cabinet]] in [[1996]] by [[Fred and George Weasley]]. '''Tiago Montoya''' was a [[Spain|Spanish]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as a [[Beater]] on the [[Spanish National Quidditch team]] in [[1994]].<ref name="QWC">{{QWC}}</ref>

During the [[1996–1997 school year]], Montoya's [[Chocolate Frog Card]] could be won by beating [[Gladys Prescott]] at a [[Quidditch]] challenge.<ref name="HBPG">{{HBP|G}} {{C|NDS edition}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Tiago'' is Portuguese for "James". ''Montoya'' is a common Spanish surname derived from "monte", the Spanish word for hill.<ref>[http://heraldicahispana.com/ApA/monedero-montoya.htm Heraldic Hispana]</ref>

Together with teammate [[Inigo Fuente Marrero|Iñigo Fuente]], this character's name may be a reference to Íñigo Montoya from the fantasy comedy romance novel (and [[wikipedia:The Princess Bride (film)|film]]) ''[[wikipedia:The Princess Bride|The Princess Bride]]''.

==Appearances==
*{{QWC}} {{1st}} 
*{{HBP|G}} {{C|NDS edition}} {{FWC}}

'''Dennis Moon''' was a wizard from New Zealand who played as a [[Chaser]] for the [[2014]] [[New Zealand National Quidditch team]]. During the first round match of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup|427th Quidditch World Cup]], against [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team|Bulgaria]], Moon was sent off by referee [[Georgios Xenakis]]. New Zealand lost the match 410 - 170. His manager [[Charlie Baverstock]] proclaimed himself 'madder than a bloke who's been locked in a box of [[Fwooper]]s' after the sending off.<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[BULGARIA VERSUS NEW ZEALAND]] (Archived)</ref>

{{Quote|There was some pretty nasty stuff that wasn't my department, though. Mortlake was taken away for questioning about some extremely odd ferrets, but that's the Committee on Experimental Charms, thank goodness…|[[Arthur Weasley]] on Mortlake's case|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets}}
'''Mortlake''' (fl. [[1992]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who kept [[ferret]]s. 

==Biography==
In [[1992]], a [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] raid on his home confiscated his [[ferret]]s, because they appeared to have experimental [[charm]]s placed on them. The case was referred to the [[Committee on Experimental Charms]].<ref name="COS3">{{COS|B|3}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*Anglo-Saxon origin, habitational name for residents of {{Wplink|Mortlake}} in [[Surrey]]. “Mort” in Anglo-Saxon means “young salmon”, not to be confused with other historical and current translations of “Mort”. “Lake” may have been derived from “lacu” which translates to “stream”; hence “stream frequented by young salmon”.
*Mortlake was home to {{Wplink|John Dee}}, a mathematician, astronomer, astrologer, alchemist and adviser to Queen [[Elizabeth I]]. Dee is frequently portrayed as a magician in modern works of fiction.

==Appearances==
*{{COS}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Mr Paws''' was one of [[Arabella Figg|Mrs Figg's]] part-[[Kneazle]]s.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20060316221040/https://www.jkrowling.com/textonly/en/extrastuff_view.cfm?id=19 Extra Stuff: Squibs] from {{JKRS}} (via the Internet Archive)</ref> The other three were [[Mr Tibbles]], [[Snowy]] and [[Tufty]]. [[Harry Potter]] saw it (or possibly its picture) when he went to stay with Mrs Figg when [[Dudley Dursley|Dudley]] got to go to places on his birthday. Harry found a hard time being remorseful when Mrs Figg broke her leg after reminding himself that it would be a while before he had to see Mr Tibbles, Snowy, Tufty and Mr Paws again.<ref>{{PS|B|2}}</ref>

'''Mr Tibbles''' was a part-[[kneazle]] cat owned by [[Arabella Figg]].<ref>{{PS|B|2}}</ref> He appeared to have the ability to communicate with [[human]]s, as he was able to inform his owner when Harry and his cousin, [[Dudley Dursley]], were attacked by two [[Dementor]]s in [[1995]].<ref>{{OOTP|B|2}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Tibbles" is spelling variant of "Tibbals" and means "son of Tibbal" which is an English form of the name Theobald. The name is deriving from the Old High German first name Dietbald which means "people" + "bold".

"Tibbles" and the variant "Tibby" became popular cat names in the Middle Ages due to popularity of the cat Tibert in the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reynard_the_Fox Reynard the Fox] stories. The character Tybalt in ''[[Romeo and Juliet]]'' was named after Tibert and is mocked in the play as "the Prince of Cats."

==Appearances==

*{{OOTP}} {{1st}}

This '''individual''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] taxi driver who worked in [[London]] during the early [[1990s]].<ref name="COSF"/>

==Biography==
In [[1992]], he witnessed [[Harry Potter]] and [[Ronald Weasley]] leave [[King's Cross Station]] in the flying [[Flying Ford Anglia|Ford Anglia]] on [[1 September]], [[1992]]. He was sitting in his cab, and was stunned by what he saw, leaning out his window to get a better look.<ref name="COSF">{{COS|F}}</ref>

The [[Evening Prophet]] later reported on the [[FLYING FORD ANGLIA MYSTIFIES MUGGLES|incident]], stating that the flying car had been seen by ''"no less than seven Muggles."''<ref name="COSF"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual, along with [[Angus Fleet]], was presumably one of the [[Non-magic people|Muggles]] that [[Molly Weasley]] mentioned to her son [[Ronald Weasley|Ron]], saying that he caused [[Arthur Weasley]] to face an inquiry at [[British Ministry of Magic|work]].<ref name="CS6">{{COS|B|6}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{COS|F}} {{1st}}

This '''[[Wizardkind|wizard]]''' taught Muggle Studies at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry at least in the [[1992–1993 school year]].<ref name="year">"Harry refers to the teacher as a "he", so Burbage could not have been teaching during 1992, so she presumably began teaching in the [[1993–1994 school year]].</ref> In [[1992]], he had gained [[Male Muggle Studies teacher's student assistant|a student assistant]] to assist him and manage [[Muggle Studies Classroom|the classroom]] while he was absent.<ref name="COSG"/>

==Biography==
When [[Harry Potter]] was given a torch by a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] student, he brought it to the professor's classroom, thinking it might be the right place for it. Instead of the teacher, he met his assistant and the torch was included in the artefact collection.<ref name="COSG">{{COS|G}} - {{C|GBC version}}</ref> He left at some point before the [[1996–1997 school year]], and was replaced by [[Professor]] [[Charity Burbage]].

==Behind the Scenes==
*It is possible that this individual was the immediate successor of Professor Quirinus Quirrell, but it is unknown if this individual also taught in the [[1991–1992 school year]].

'''Eric Munch''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]], who was employed as a [[watchwizard]] at the [[British Ministry of Magic]].<ref name="op14">{{OOTP|B|14}}</ref> He was poorly-shaven and wore peacock blue robes when on duty.<ref name="op7">{{OOTP|B|7}}</ref>

==Biography==
Much was working for the [[British Ministry of Magic]] by [[August]] [[1995]]. During the day, Munch sat at the [[Ministry of Magic Security Desk|security desk]] on the left side of the Atrium, checking visitors with a [[Probity Probe]] and registering their [[wand]]s before giving them clearance to enter. Munch seemed to find this portion of his job very tedious. When [[Harry Potter]] stopped by the security desk on the way to a hearing on [[12 August]] 1995, Munch went through the check-in protocols mechanically, only noticing the famous [[Harry Potter's scars#The lightning-bolt scar|lightning-bolt scar]] when he had finished. Realising who Harry was, Munch asked him to wait, but [[Arthur Weasley]] dragged Harry away from the security desk.<ref name="op7" />

Munch apparently also worked the night shift on occasion. He caught [[Sturgis Podmore]] trying to break into [[Department of Mysteries]] at one o'clock in the morning on [[31 August]], [[1995]] and arrested him on charges of trespass and attempted robbery.<ref name="op14" />

Sometime in the [[2010]]s, Munch had to be rescued from the [[Department of Mysteries]]' [[Brain Room]] by the more recently hired [[Grim Fawley]].<ref>{{WU}} - [https://wizardsunite.gamepress.gg/foundable/redacted-report Redacted Report]: "A thorough reading of the report shows that Grim Fawley appears to have come to the rescue of Ministry Watchwizard Eric Munch in the Department of Mysteries' Brain Room."</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Munch was featured on a conceptual art for {{OOTP|FA}}. He was not, however, featured in the actual film.
*Eric Munch's conspicuous absence during the [[Battle of the Department of Mysteries]] is noted by Harry when he arrives, apparently not being on duty that night. Alternatively, unless he was incapacitated by the Death Eaters and put somewhere out of sight as not to arouse the suspicion of those who might pass through the Atrium after their arrival,  it is possible that Lucius Malfoy or one of the other Death Eaters present with ties to the Ministry was able to arrange a distraction that would keep him occupied elsewhere so that the Death Eaters could enter the Department of Mysteries unseen.

==Etymology==
The name "Eric" comes from the Old Norse name Eiríkr, derived from the elements ei "ever" and ríkr "ruler". A notable bearer was Eiríkr inn Rauda (Eric the Red in English), a 10th-century navigator and explorer who discovered Greenland. This was also the name of several early kings of Sweden, Denmark and Norway.

{{Quote|I must have been paralysed with horror.|[[Beatrix Bloxam]] on hearing '[[The Warlock's Hairy Heart]]' for the first time and learning of her uncle Nobby's indiscretions|The Tales of Beedle the Bard (real)}}

'''Nobby''' was the uncle of [[Beatrix Bloxam]]. When Beatrix was a child, she overheard her [[Beatrix Bloxam's aunt|aunt]] tell her [[Beatrix Bloxam's cousins|cousins]] about a "dreadfully unsavoury affair" that involved Nobby, the local [[hag]], and a sack of [[Bouncing Bulb]]s. This may have contributed to her problems with sleepwalking.<ref>{{TBB|H}}</ref>

==Etymology==
'''Nobby''' is a nickname for [[Norberta|Norbert]] or Nob [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nobby] [http://www.memidex.com/nobby]. The word '''nobby''' means ''stylish'', however the name could have also been derived from the word ''nob'', which is a slang word for the head, or a reference to a person of wealth and high social status.

==Behind the scenes==
*It is unlikely that Nobby was married to the aunt eavesdropped on by Beatrix. This aunt chose to discuss Nobby's scandalous behaviour with her children and probably would not have done so if Nobby had been their father.

}}'''Cantankerus Nott''' (fl. [[1930s]]) was a [[wizardkind|wizard]] and a member of the [[pure-blood]] [[Nott family]]. He was widely believed to have been the one who penned the ''[[Pure-Blood Directory]]''. This book listed the "[[Sacred Twenty-Eight|twenty-eight truly pure-blood families]]", with "''the aim of helping such families maintain the purity of their bloodlines''". The book was also published anonymously in Britain in the early [[1930s]].<ref name="PM">{{PM|pure-blood}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*"Cantankerous" is a word meaning ill-tempered, surly, argumentative, and uncooperative.

==Behind the scenes==
*He was most likely related to [[Theodore Nott]] as well as his [[Nott|father]]. It is also possible that he was Theodore's father.
*Some of the families presented in his apparent directory weren't as pure-blooded as he claimed, such as the [[Ollivander family]]. Also many pure-blooded families such as the [[Potter family|Potters]] were not listed, in fact many pure-blood supremacists were angered by their lack of inclusion. Due to this, Cantankerus Nott seems to have been a highly biased individual.

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{1st Mention}}

{{Quote|We are very pleased that the Americans have returned our beloved mascot. Magizoologists are currently keeping Hans under close observation for ill effects. If any are discovered we will of course lobby the ICWQC for the USA's immediate disqualification from the World Cup.|Minister Obermeier's statement, after the Americans gave [[Hans|Hans the Augurey]] back to Liechtenstein during the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup]]|Pottermore}}
'''Minister Otto Obermeier''' was, as [[Minister for Magic]], the head of the [[Liechtenstein Ministry of Magic|Liechtenstein wizarding government]].<ref name="PM9June">{{PM}} - [[RETURN OF HANS THE AUGUREY]] (Archived)</ref>

==Biography==
Following the [[American National Quidditch team|American]] victory over Liechtenstein on the quarter-finals of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup]], the Liechtenstein mascot, a large and gloomy [[Augurey]] called [[Hans]], was kidnapped by high-spirited American fans celebrating their team's historic triumph.<ref name="PM8June">[http://www.pottermore.com/en/daily-prophet/qwc2014/2014-06-08/late-breaking-news New from J.K. Rowling - Daily Prophet: 8 June 2014 (II)]</ref> Hans was put back in his customised pen the following day, [[9 June]] [[2014]], but not before negotiations for his return reached the highest levels: Minister Otto Obermeier and President of the [[Magical Congress of the United States of America]] [[Samuel G. Quahog]] had to exchange terse owls so that the bird was returned home. Even though President Quahog termed it was done in a "''friendly and cooperative fashion''", Minister Obermeier insisted that if any ill effects were discovered on [[Hans]], Liechtenstein would "''of course lobby the [[International Confederation of Wizards' Quidditch Committee|ICWQC]] for the USA's immediate disqualification from the World Cup''".<ref name="PM9June"/>

And you've been letting me mime everything all day!|Oblansk|Vell, it vos very funny.|Oblansk's sense of homour|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}'''Oblansk''' was the [[Bulgaria]]n [[Minister for Magic]] in around [[1994]]. He attended the final match of the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup]]. He wore gold-trimmed, black velvet robes and acted as if he did not understand English.<ref name="GOF8">{{GOF|B|8}}</ref>

==Biography==
British Minister for Magic [[Cornelius Fudge]] introduced him to [[Harry Potter]] and asked if he knew about the boy's famous history. Oblansk became excited when he recognised Harry's [[Harry Potter's scars|scar]].<ref name="GOF8"/>

Fudge introduced the man to the [[Malfoy family]] next, attempting to pronounce his surname twice (first as "Oblansk" and then as "Obalonsk"), before giving up and simply calling him the Bulgarian Minister for Magic. Fudge excused his poor introduction by claiming that the Minister couldn't understand anything said in English. However, when the [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team]] lost to [[Irish National Quidditch team|Ireland]], Oblansk sullenly declared, "Vell, ve fought bravely." Fudge was angered to learn that Oblansk really did know English and had only feigned ignorance because he found it extremely amusing to watch his British counterpart try to communicate through gestures.<ref name="GOF8">{{GOF|B|8}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The Minister's name might be derived from common Slavic proposition "об" ("around" or "about") and its cognate adjective "объл" ['obəl] ("round"), from which nouns such as "облак" ['oblak] ("cloud") and "област" ['oblast] ("region", "area") also originate. Suffices similar to "-sk" are used for locational or occupational surnames in Slavic languages. However, in Bulgarian it would be "-ski", while "-sk" is only used as a suffix in city names in Russia and ex-Soviet countries such as Belarus and Ukraine.

==Behind the scenes==
*In {{PM}}, the "From the story" entry referring to this individual has the URL referring to the "bulgarian-prime-minister". This seems to have been a mistake, since the entry itself is titled "Bulgarian Minister for Magic", and [[canon]] establishes the difference between the office of [[Minister for Magic]] and that of [[Prime Minister]]. The Prime Minister of Bulgaria at the time the story is set was [[Wikipedia:Lyuben Berov|Lyuben Berov]].

==Appearances==
*{{GOF}} {{1st}}
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}

{{Quote|Been having a lot of trouble with him. Needs a Memory Charm ten times a day to keep him happy. And Ludo Bagman's not helping. Trotting around talking about Bludgers and Quaffles at the top of his voice, not a worry about anti-Muggle security! Blimey, I'll be glad when this is over. See you later, Arthur.|The [[Obliviator]]|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}
This '''[[Wizardkind|wizard]]''' worked in the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] as an [[Obliviator]] in the [[1990s]].<ref name="GOF7"/>

==History==
In [[1994]] he was stationed at [[Roberts|Mr Roberts]]' [[Quidditch World Cup Campsite|campsite]]. He is described as wearing plus fours, and he looked extremely exhausted, as there were purple shadows under his eyes and his chin was blue with stubble. He used a [[Memory Charm]] on Roberts when he questioned incessantly about the [[wizarding world]] such as [[Unidentified man who tried to pay Mr Roberts with Galleons|a man]] that tried to pay him with [[Galleon|big gold coins]] or [[Archie Aymslowe|a "weirdo" wearing a dress]]. He told [[Arthur Weasley]] that the [[Charm]] had to be used ten times a day to keep Roberts from realising the [[Wizardkind|true nature]] of the "foreigners" in his campsite.<ref name="GOF7">{{GOF|B|7}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Apparition]]''': Like most accomplished adult wizards, he was capable of apparating at will.<ref name="GOF7"/>
*'''[[Charm]]s''': Being an [[Obliviator]], he was highly proficient with the casting of the [[Memory Charm]].<ref name="GOF7"/>

==Appearances==
*{{GOF}} {{1st}}

==Notes and references==

'''Odbert''' was a [[Goblin]] who worked at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]] at some point during [[1990]]. Like most goblins, he was rather suspicious of most [[Wizardkind|wizards]], including the [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] students that visited the bank looking for [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]]. He did, however, appear quite friendly with his colleague and fellow goblin, [[Burgock]].<ref name="HM6">{{HM|6|The Dragon's Treasure|1}}</ref>

'''Tiberius Ogden''' was a former member of the [[Wizengamot]] (described as an elder member), but resigned in protest due to [[Cornelius Fudge]]'s appointment of [[Dolores Umbridge]] as [[Hogwarts High Inquisitor|High Inquisitor]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] and the continuing [[Campaign to discredit Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter|campaign]] by the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] and the [[Daily Prophet]] to discredit [[Albus Dumbledore]] and [[Harry Potter]].<ref>{{OOTP|B|15}}</ref>

Tiberius Ogden was the friend who told Professor [[Tofty]], [[Harry Potter]]'s [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] [[Ordinary Wizarding Level|O.W.L.]] Examiner, that he could perform a corporeal [[Patronus Charm|Patronus]].<ref>{{OOTP|B|31}}</ref>

He may be related to the makers of [[Ogden's Old Firewhiskey]] or [[Bob Ogden]], who also worked for the Ministry of Magic as the Head of the [[Magical Law Enforcement Patrol]].

==Behind the scenes==

Tiberius Ogden may have been the same person as [[Cormac McLaggen]]'s Uncle [[Tiberius]], as mentioned by [[Horace Slughorn]] in {{HBP}}.

==Etymology==
The name "Tiberius" is a Roman praenomen, or given name, meaning "of the Tiber" in Latin. The Tiber is the river that runs through Rome. Tiberius was the second Roman emperor, the stepson of emperor Augustus.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st}}

'''Ogg''' was the [[Keeper of Keys and Grounds|gamekeeper]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] during [[Arthur Weasley]] and [[Molly Weasley|Molly Prewett]]'s time at the school.<ref name="GOF31"/>

==History==
After [[Rubeus Hagrid]] was expelled in [[1943]], [[Albus Dumbledore]] convinced [[Armando Dippet]] to keep Hagrid and train him as gamekeeper.<ref name="COS17">{{COS|B|17}}</ref> Hagrid presumably served as Ogg's assistant before Ogg left the position and Hagrid was promoted.

In [[1995]], Molly became intrigued by the [[Whomping Willow]] when she visited Harry Potter during the [[Triwizard Tournament#The Third Task|third task]], and she reminisced at length about Ogg.<ref name="GOF31">{{GOF|B|31}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{GOF}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Olaf''' (fl. [[12th century]]) was a [[Norway|Norwegian]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who was the cousin of [[Goodwin Kneen]]. During the [[12th century]], he received a letter from Goodwin that described a game of ''Kwidditch'' (''[[Quidditch]]''). Due to the historical importance of the letter, it is now on display at the [[Norwegian Ministry of Magic]].<ref name="QTA3">{{QTA|R|3}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Olaf" comes from the Old Norse name Áleifr meaning "ancestor's descendent", derived from the elements anu "ancestor" and leifr "descendent". This was the name of five kings of Norway, including Saint Olaf (Olaf II).

==Appearances==
*{{QTA|R}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Ollie''' was an uncle of [[Rowan Khanna]]. In the [[1986–1987 school year]], Rowan promised him that they would hold a branch from their tree farm if they won the contest held by [[Rita Skeeter]].<ref>{{HM|3|Wizarding World Famous}} - mentioned if option ''"It's amazing"'' is chosen when asked about the contest.</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual's surname is unknown; as an uncle of [[Rowan Khanna]], his surname could be Khanna or a different one altogether if he is Rowan's mother's brother, or married to a sibling of either of Rowan's parents.

*{{HM}} {{1st Mention}}

'''George Osborne''' was a British politician and [[Wikipedia:Shadow Chancellor of the Exchequer|Shadow Chancellor of the Exchequer]] in the mid-to-late [[1990s]] (during [[Alistair Darling]]'s time as [[Chancellor of the Exchequer]]). In July of [[1996]], Darling announced "controversial changes" to the [[capital gains tax]]. As the protests grew louder, Osborne said his party would be campaigning to overturn this measure. These events were covered by ''[[The Guardian]]''.<ref>{{HPLE|G}} (see [[:File:TheGuardian.png|this image]])</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*The listing of [[Wikipedia:George Osborne|George Osborne]] as the Shadow Chancellor of the Exchequer in 1996 is anachronistic, as Osborne was only appointed to the office in [[2005]]. Indeed, at the time, [[Gordon Brown]] was the one who held the post.

==Appearances==
*{{HBP|F}} {{Mention}}

'''P. Oxley''' was an American [[Muggle|No-Maj]] who worked as a clerk for the [[Division of Vital Statistics]] in the [[New York State Department of Health]]. On the [[25 October]], [[1905]], Oxley attested to and signed off on the certificate for the adoption of [[Credence Barebone]] by [[Mary Lou Barebone]] of the [[New Salem Philanthropic Society]], which had taken place [[21 October|four days earlier]].<ref name="Archive" />

'''Mr Payne''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] who ran one of the campsites close to the place the [[Quidditch World Cup]] was held in [[1994]]. The [[Diggory family]] stayed on Mr Payne's site, while [[Harry Potter]], [[Hermione Granger]], and the [[Weasley family|Weasleys]] stayed on the adjacent campground owned by [[Roberts|Mr Roberts]].<ref>{{GOF|B|7}}</ref>

'''Arnold "Arnie" Peasegood''' was a wizard who worked at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]]. By [[1994]], he worked in the capacity of [[Obliviator]] for the [[Accidental Magic Reversal Squad]]<ref name="GF7">{{GOF|B|7}}</ref> and by [[1999]] worked as a [[Hit Wizard]].<ref name="DP">{{DP}}</ref>

==Biography==
===1994 Quidditch World Cup===
Peasegood was one of the Ministry officials stationed at [[Roberts|Mr Roberts]]' [[Mr Roberts's campsite|campsite]] during the final of the four-hundred and twenty-second [[Quidditch World Cup]], in [[1994]].<ref name="GF7" />

===Chipping Clodbury riot===
Peasegood was present during the infamous [[Chipping Clodbury riot]], in [[1999]]. During the riot, he managed to arrest three [[Goblin]]s and suffered a [[Pimple Jinx|minor attack of boils]].<ref name="DP" />

==Etymology==
The name "Arnold" comes from a Germanic name meaning "eagle power", derived from the elements arn "eagle" and wald "power". It was brought by the Normans to England, where it replaced the Old English cognate Earnweald. It died out as an English name after the Middle Ages, but it was revived in the 19th century.
==Behind the scenes==
===Translations===
*Bulgarian: ''Арнолд Пийзгуд {{c|Arnold Piizgud}}''
*Czech: ''Arnold Hrachorád ''
*Danish: ''Arnold Mnemopax''
*Dutch: ''Abraham Preiloof'' (''preiloof'' "leek leaves")
*French:'' Arnold Bondupois''
*German: ''Arnold Friedlich'' (''friedlich'' "peaceful")
*Hebrew: ''ארנולד פיזגוד''
*Japanese: ''アーノルド・ピースグッド''
*Norwegian: ''Arnold Pesegod''
*Polish: ''Arnold Peasgood''
*Ukrainian: ''Арнольд Горошок {{c|Arnol'd Goroshok}}'' (''Goroshok'' "pease")

'''Edward Almeida Peidus''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] whose name was carved into a wood panel on the wall of [[Sybill Trelawney|Professor Trelawney]]'s [[Divination Classroom]].<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}} - Chapter 21 (''Professor Trelawney's Prediction'')</ref><ref>[http://www.the-leaky-cauldron.org/2004/5/15/los-angeles-motion-picture-arts-sciences-contemporary-set-exhibit-report ''Prisoner of Azkaban'' set report] from the Leaky Cauldron</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Edward" means "rich guard", derived from the Old English elements ead "rich, blessed" and weard "guard". Saint Edward the Confessor was the king of England shortly before the Norman conquest. He was known as a just ruler, and because of his popularity this name remained in use after the conquest when most other Old English names were replaced by Norman ones.

{{Dialogue a-b-a|Perkins|Oh, Arthur! Thank goodness, I didn’t know what to do for the best, whether to wait here for you or not. I've just sent an owl to your home but you've obviously missed it - an urgent message came ten minutes ago!|Arthur|I know about the regurgitating toilet.|No, no, it's not the toilet, it's the Potter boy's hearing - they've changed the time and venue - it starts at eight o'clock now and it's down in the old Courtroom Ten!|Perkins and [[Arthur Weasley]]|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}

'''Perkins''' (fl. [[1975]] - [[1998]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[warlock]] who worked in the [[Misuse of Muggle Artefacts Office]] at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]], as a subordinate of [[Arthur Weasley]], who was head of the office.<ref name="OTP7"/>

==Biography==
During the [[Quidditch World Cup]] in [[1994]], Perkins lent his supervisor, [[Arthur Weasley]], a [[Perkins's tent|tent]] so he and his [[Weasley family|family]] could camp out after the match. Perkins allowed the Weasleys to keep the tent after his [[lumbago]] got worse and he no longer had any interest in camping.<ref name="GOF7">{{GOF|B|7}}</ref> His tent would later be used by [[Harry Potter]], [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]] and [[Hermione Granger]] during their [[Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter's Horcrux Hunt|search]] for [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort's]] [[Horcrux]]es.<ref name="DH14">{{DH|B|14}}</ref>

Perkins met [[Harry Potter]] in [[1995]] when the boy was summoned before the [[Wizengamot]] to answer a charge of using magic in front of a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]].<ref name="OTP7">{{OOTP|B|7}}</ref> In [[1997]], he attended the [[Wedding of William Weasley and Fleur Delacour|wedding]] of [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]] and [[Fleur Delacour]].<ref name="DH8">{{DH|B|8}}</ref>

==Physical appearance==
He was described as being an elderly [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who had fluffy white hair.<ref name="OTP7"/>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Charm]]s''': As part of his career duties as an employee for the [[Misuse of Muggle Artefacts Office]], Perkins often had to use the [[Memory Charm]] to erase the [[Memory|memories]] of unsuspecting [[Non-magic people|Muggles]] who had witnessed [[magic]].<ref name="COS3">{{COS|B|3}}</ref>

==Possessions==
*'''[[Perkins's tent|Tent]]''': Perkins owned a tent which was [[charm]]ed to be [[Extension Charm|magically enlarged]]. Perkins lent his tent to [[Arthur Weasley]] to use for the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup]].<ref name="GOF7"/>

==Etymology==
''Perkins'' is an [[England|English]] surname meaning "son of little Peter".<ref>From [http://surnames.behindthename.com/names/usage/english/3 Behind the Name (website)].</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*[[Cuthbert Binns|Professor Binns]] once erroneously called [[Harry Potter]] "Perkins".
*In {{OOTP|FA}} it is [[Kingsley Shacklebolt]] instead of Perkins who tells Arthur Weasley that the time and venue of Harry Potter's hearing had been changed. 
*In the German version of the fourth book, Perkins was incorrectly refered to as Mrs Perkins.

This '''individual''' was the brother of [[Constance Pickering]]. Before the start of Constance [[first year]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]], their [[Constance Pickering's mother|mother]] wouldn't buy her a new [[cauldron]]. She gave Constance her brother's old, used one and bought him a new one. He was absolutely rubbish at potions.<ref name="FirstYearAtHogwarts"/>

'''Pigwidgeon '''(fl. [[1994]] - [[1997]]),''' '''also known as '''Pig''', was [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]]'s first pet [[owl]]. He was a miniature [[scops owl]]. Pig was responsible for the handling of Ron's mail starting in 1994, he was a gift from [[Sirius Black]] after the loss of Ron's pet rat.<ref name="POA22">{{POA|B|22}}</ref>

==Biography==
{{Quote|Harry stared at the word "Pig," and looked up at the tiny owl now fluttering around the light fixture on the ceiling. He had never seen anything that looked less like a pig.|Description of 'Pig'|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}} After [[Peter Pettigrew|Scabbers]], Ron's old pet rat, disappeared (having been found out to be [[Peter Pettigrew]]), [[Sirius Black]], who felt partly responsible for Ron's loss of a pet, sent him Pigwidgeon (nicknamed "Pig"). Upon receiving the owl, Ron (to the surprise of [[Harry Potter|Harry]] and [[Hermione Granger|Hermione]]) actually let [[Crookshanks]] sniff him to check if he really was an owl.<ref name="POA22" />

Pigwidgeon was named by [[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Weasley]], because she thought the name was cute. Though Ron tried to change it, the owl would not answer to another name. Pigwidgeon was exceedingly hyper, loud, bothersome, very small, and had been known to be a show off for other people (this, however, annoyed other owls, forcing Ron to keep him in his room).<ref>{{GOF|B|5}}</ref>

[[File:Ron-and-his-owl.jpg|225x225px|thumb|left|[[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]]'s new pet Pigwidgeon]]
Pigwidgeon was described by Harry as resembling a "fluffy [[Golden Snitch|snitch]]". He was usually excited for a job to deliver letters, even though most of the time they were usually heavy for him. Harry borrowed Pigwidgeon during the [[Triwizard Tournament]] to communicate with Sirius who was in hiding at the time.<ref>{{GOF|B|15}}</ref> [[Fred Weasley|Fred]] and [[George Weasley]] also asked to borrow him in order to support their secretive business venture.<ref>{{GOF|B|22}}</ref>

Pigwidgeon was occasionally known to hang around the stairways performing for students. This prompted Ron to call him a "stupid little feathery git" for his attempts to show off rather than promptly bringing Ron the letters.<ref>{{GOF|B|23}}</ref> He also delivered food to Sirius when he was hiding in a cave in [[Hogsmeade]], though not without the help of Hogwarts owls, as the food was quite heavy.<ref>{{GOF|B|28}}</ref>

Pigwidgeon travelled with Ron to and from Hogwarts during his years in school, although he stayed at The Burrow when Ron skipped his final year at Hogwarts to accompany Harry and Hermione on the hunt for [[horcrux]]es.<ref>{{DH|B|7}}</ref>

During the [[2020]]s, Pigwidgeon appeared as a [[Foundable]] during the [[Calamity]]. Volunteer members of the [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]] were able to return him to his original time.<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Pigwidgeon means "small" or "petty" and also can be spelled ''pigwidgin'' or ''pigwiggin''. It combines "pig" with "widgeon," two species of duck found in North America and Europe, or "pidgeon", another name for the rock dove. English author and poet Michael Drayton (1563-1631) had a male fairy named Pigwiggen in his comical poem "Nimphidia."

==Behind the scenes==
*J.K. Rowling has said on her website that Pigwidgeon is a [[scops owl]]. These owls are tiny grey owls with little tufts of feathers on their heads. This makes sense as Pigwidgeon is said to fit in a person's fist. Scops owls live in open country with isolated trees and lightly wooded areas containing clusters of trees. They may also be found in run-down buildings, caves, bush-lands, and park-like habitat.
*Pigwidgeon isn't actually featured in the films, but appears with Ron in a promotional still photo for ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]'' and appears briefly in the background while Harry, Ron, and Hermione are talking at the Burrow in ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince]]''.
*A small African white-faced owl called Mars plays Pigwidgeon in the promotional still for ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire]]'' and in the film ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half Blood Prince]]''.
*{{HPV|CR}} says that Pigwidgeon was a present from Ron's family, while he was actually a present from Sirius Black.

'''Pitts''' was a [[house-elf]] employed at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]]. He was previously owned by another person, who treated him cruelly and gave him to the Hogwarts kitchens for next to nothing.<ref>{{HM|5|18}}</ref> According to [[Rita Skeeter]], [[Jacob (Hogwarts student)|Jacob]] spoke to him shortly before his expulsion.<ref>{{HM|4|Rita Returns}}, if the player chooses to learn a secret and let Rita write a story about [[Torvus]]</ref> He was strict when it came to making sure other house-elves and students in detention did their work in the kitchens.

'''Mr Plunkett''' was a man who lived during the [[19th century]].<ref name="HPPAVG">{{POA|G}} - [[Chocolate Frog Card|Famous Wizard Card]] ([[Mirabella Plunkett]])</ref>

He had at least one child, a [[wizardkind|witch]] daughter, [[Mirabella Plunkett|Mirabella]].<ref name="HPPAVG" /> During a holiday to [[Loch Lomond]], his daughter fell in love with a [[Unidentified Merman|merman]], and wished to [[marriage|marry]] him.<ref name="HPPAVG" /> However, Mr Plunkett and [[Mirabella Plunkett's mother|his wife]] were deeply opposed, and forbade Mirabella to marry her merman lover.<ref name="HPPAVG" /> Mirabella [[transfiguration|transformed]] herself into a [[haddock]] and was never seen again.<ref name="HPPAVG" />

{{Quote|There was also the famous case of wizard Samuel Plunkett, who poured Shrinking Solution into the well of a village that had persecuted him, then spent his birthday chasing the shrunken villagers in hobnail boots.|[[Zygmunt Budge]], ''[[Book of Potions]]''|Wonderbook: Book of Potions}}
'''Samuel Plunkett''' was a [[wizardkind|wizard]] who was famously persecuted by a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] village at some point in history.<ref name="well">{{WBP}} - see [https://archive.is/20131112204506/www.sony.com/pottermore/gb/book-of-potions/view-image/assets/img/carousel-bop/BoP-ShrinkStory.jpg this]</ref> To avoid persecution he poured [[Shrinking Solution]] into the village well<ref name="well"/> and spent his entire birthday chasing the shrunken villagers around in hobnail boots.<ref name="WP"/> Author [[Zygmunt Budge]] wrote about this incident in his ''[[Book of Potions]]''.<ref name="WP"/>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Potion]]s''': Plunkett was evidently skilled in the field of potion-making, as he was able to successfully brew the [[Shrinking Solution]] and use it to take revenge on his Muggle persectuors.<ref name="WP"/>

'''Hector Podmore''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as a Minister in the [[British Ministry of Magic]].<ref name="FBS"/>

==Biography==
On [[6 December]] [[1926]], he attended an emergency meeting of the [[International Confederation of Wizards]] to discuss the [[magic]]al disturbances happening in [[New York]]. He questioned [[Newton Scamander|Newt Scamander]] about his reasons for being in New York and was sceptical of the reply that he was there to buy an [[Appaloosa Puffskein]].<ref name="FBS">{{FB|S}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Hector Podmore was portrayed by [[Richard Clothier]] in ''[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]'', but was credited as British Envoy.<ref>[http://www.unitedagents.co.uk/richard-clothier United Agents - Richard Clothier]</ref><ref>{{IMDb name|nm0167134|Richard Clothier}}</ref>
*Given how the British Ministry of Magic has a [[Unidentified Minister of Magical Transportation|Minister of Magical Transportation]], it is not unthinkable that Podmore is a Minister of International Magical Cooperation and, as such, presumably head of that department and representing the Ministry and its interests at the ICW. He could also have possibly been a junior minister for the [[Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes]], given that there was a magical catastrophe going on in New York and he was summoned to New York for discussion.
*Alternatively, he could have been intended to be [[Hector Fawley]], then Minister for Magic but there being a mix up in the names.

==Appearances==
*{{FB|S}} {{1st}}
*{{FB|F}}

'''Rutherford Poke''' was a [[Healer]] at and a spokesperson for [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]].<ref name="POT"/>

==Biography==
In [[2010]], he lamented the incidence of injuries caused by people attempting to use [[Faux Floo|homemade substitutes]] for [[Floo Powder]], reminding people that the authentic article only cost two [[Sickle]]s per scoop, and swearing he would refuse to treat the next [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who came into St Mungo's with a burned bottom.<ref name="POT">{{WW|floo-powder}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Healing magic]]''': As a professional [[Healer]], Rutherhood would have been highly adept and accomplished with medical [[magic]], such as with [[healing spell]]s, [[potion]]s and other magical remedies.<ref name="POT"/>

I notice you have dribbled food all the way down the front of your robes again, disgusting boy --|An example of how Karkaroff treated his students|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}
'''Poliakoff''' was a student of the [[Durmstrang Institute]]. 

==Biography==
In [[1994]], he was a member of the Durmstrang delegation that travelled to [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] to compete in the [[Triwizard Tournament]]. He entered his name into the [[Goblet of Fire]] to compete, but [[Viktor Krum]] was selected as the Champion instead. He is shown to be a sloppy eater as [[Igor Karkaroff]] commented on the food stains on his robes after the welcoming feast in 1994. He hinted to Igor that he wanted [[wine]] once at the feast, but Karkaroff refused, as he had offered it to Viktor, not to Poliakoff.<ref>{{GOF}}</ref> Karkaroff was not kind to Poliakoff, snapping at his sloppy manners and interrupting for the wine. Upon seeing Harry Potter for the first time, Poliakoff was dumbfounded, pointing openly at Harry's forehead to a [[Durmstrang girl|girl]] next to him.

He left at the end of the year, in which he, along with his schoolmates, showed little care for Karkaroff's cowardly departure from the [[return of Lord Voldemort]], as Karkaroff did force his students to steer the [[Durmstrang Ship]] while he remained in the cabin on their journey to Hogwarts.

==Personality and traits==
Poliakoff possesses poor manners, being a sloppy eater who dribbled food down his robes despite being in the company of two foreign schools, while gluttonously intervened Karkaroff's offer of wine for Krum. When noticing the famous Harry Potter, Poliakoff rather tactlessly pointed at his forehead to a girl next to him.

==Relationships==
===Igor Karkaroff===
Poliakoff appeared not to have a very good relationship with his headmaster, as he was called a ''"disgusting boy"'' because of his messy uniform and was declined when he requested wine from Karkaroff.

As with the rest of the students who visited Hogwarts, Poliakoff did not miss his headmaster too much when he fled after the [[Dark Mark]] signalled the [[return of Lord Voldemort]], as Igor treated them like servants during their journey.

==Behind the scenes==
*It is possible that this individual is [[Igor Karkaroff's aide]], however this individual was trusted by Karkaroff while Poliakoff was not allowed much from him.

==Appearances==
*{{GOF}}
*{{GOF|F}} {{possible}}

'''Charlus Potter's son''' was a [[pure-blood]] [[wizardkind|wizard]] and the son and only child of [[Charlus Potter]] and [[Dorea Black|Dorea Potter]],<ref name="BFT">[[House of Black|Black family tree]] {{see image|File:JKRBlackFamilyTree.jpg}}</ref> and a first cousin of [[Walburga Black|Walburga]], [[Alphard Black|Alphard]] and [[Cygnus Black III|Cygnus Black]].<ref name="BFT"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*It was once speculated that [[James Potter I|James Potter]] was in fact Charlus Potter's son. However, the actual names of James's parents, [[Fleamont Potter|Fleamont]] and [[Euphemia Potter]], were revealed via {{PM}}.<ref name="PotterFamilyPottermore">{{WW|the-potter-family}}</ref> In spite of this, it is still more than likely that Charlus might be a cousin of James Potter and his descendants.
*Ironically, although it was not James, this man was related to many of those close to [[Harry Potter]], for instance, being a first cousin once removed of [[Sirius Black|Sirius and]] [[Regulus Black]] and [[Bellatrix Lestrange|Bellatrix]], [[Andromeda Tonks|Andromeda]] and [[Narcissa Malfoy|Narcissa Black]], and so a cousin of [[Nymphadora Tonks|Nymphadora and]] [[Edward Lupin|Ted Lupin]] and [[Draco Malfoy|Draco and]] [[Scorpius Malfoy]] respectively, a second cousin of [[Arthur Weasley]], possibly a second cousin of [[Bartemius Crouch Senior|Bartemius Crouch Snr]]<ref>He may be [[Caspar Crouch's son]], though this is unconfirmed</ref> and [[Bartemius Crouch Junior|his son]], and a possible distant relative of [[Neville Longbottom]].<ref>He may be a descendant of [[Callidora Black]] and [[Harfang Longbottom]], though this is unconfirmed</ref>
*If Harry really didn't have any living relatives other than the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]] by [[1981]], it can be assumed that Charlus, Dorea and their son were all dead by that date.
*This individual was not featured on the Potter family tree on Pottermore.

==Appearances==
*{{JKRS}}

'''Hardwin Potter''' was the eldest son of [[Linfred of Stinchcombe]]. Upon his father's [[death]], he inherited a sizable sum of [[galleon|gold]], as did each of his six siblings. Hardwin met and married [[Iolanthe Peverell]] of [[Godric's Hollow]]. Iolanthe, the granddaughter of [[Ignotus Peverell]], inherited the [[Cloak of Invisibility]], since there were no male heirs in her generation. She told Hardwin that, by tradition in her family, possession of the cloak was kept secret. He respected her wishes, and, from then on, the cloak was passed down to the eldest child of each new generation of the [[Potter family]]. [[Henry Potter]], a member of the [[Wizengamot]] from [[1913]] to [[1921]] and the great-grandfather of [[Harry Potter]], was a direct descendant of Hardwin and Iolanthe.<ref name="WW">{{WW|the-potter-family}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Prendergast '''was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in around the [[1910s]]. He once gave [[Newton Scamander]] a month's worth of detention for arguing that there are no strange [[creature]]s, just blinkered people. [[Leta Lestrange]] later set off a [[dungbomb]] under Prendergast's desk so she could join Newt in detention.<ref>{{COG|S|18}}</ref>

{{Quote|Keep your wand out. Nevermind the Statute of Secrecy now, there's going to be hell to pay anyway, we might as well be hanged for a dragon as an egg. ''[…]'' What's that at the end of the street? Oh, it's just Mr Prentice… don't put your wand away, boy, don't I keep telling you I'm no use?|[[Arabella Figg]] instructs [[Harry Potter]] to keep his wand at the ready after a [[Attack in Little Whinging|Dementor attack]].|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}
'''Mr Prentice''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] who lived in [[Little Whinging]] in the [[1990s]].

In the evening of [[2 August]], [[1995]], after [[Harry Potter]] and [[Dudley Dursley]] were [[Attack in Little Whinging|attacked]] by [[Dementor]]s, [[Arabella Figg]] told Harry, a [[wizardkind|wizard]] to keep his wand out in case of another attack, not minding the presence of [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] Mr Prentice as they crossed [[Wisteria Walk]].<ref name="OP1">{{OOTP|B|2}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*When {{OOTP}} was released, many thought Mr Prentice was, perhaps, another member of the [[Order of the Phoenix|Order]] who, like [[Arabella Figg|Mrs Figg]] was assigned to watch over Harry during the summer, given her lack of preoccupation of him spotting Harry's wand. [[J. K. Rowling]], however, dispelled these rumours on her {{JKRS}} by saying "''Mark Evans is... nobody. He's nobody in the sense that Mr Prentice, Madam Marsh and Gordon-Dudley's-gang-member are nobodies, just background people who need names, but who have no role other than the walk-on parts assigned to them''". It is, thus, more than likely that the risk of Mr Prentice noticing the wand was outweighed by the risk of encountering Dementors without a wand at the ready by Mrs Figg.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st}}

'''Ignatius Prewett''' was a [[pure-blood]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who married [[Lucretia Black]].<ref>''[[House of Black|Black Family tree]]''</ref> He was an uncle by blood of [[Fabian Prewett|Fabian]] and [[Gideon Prewett]], as well as their sister [[Molly Weasley|Molly]],<ref>[[Sirius Black]] stated in Ch. 6 of {{OOTP}} that Molly Weasley was his "cousin by marriage". This means that Ignatius could not have been Molly, Fabian, and Gideon's father, as this would have made them first cousins by blood of Sirius [false logic: this merely means that Lucretia Black Prewett (Ignatius' wife) could not have been their mother]. Ignatius was Sirius's uncle by marriage, and if Molly was his niece, this could explain Sirius's comment. See this article's [[Talk:Ignatius Prewett|talk page]] for more information.</ref> and an uncle by [[marriage]] of [[Sirius Black|Sirius]] and [[Regulus Black]]. Ignatius and his wife Lucretia did not have any children of their own. 

Given that Molly gave her third son [[Percy Weasley|Percy]] the middle name "Ignatius", presumably in honour of her uncle, it is likely that she and Ignatius were close.

==Behind the scenes==
*''Ignatius'' is a Roman name altered from its original Etruscan to resemble the Latin ''ignis'', "[[fire]]". It was the name of several saints, including the founder of the Jesuits.<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/ignatius Behind the Name: Ignatius]</ref>
*Given that [[Lucretia Black]] from the [[House of Black|Black Family]] was not disowned and burnt off the Black Family Tree, implies that her marriage to Ignatius Prewett was a "respectable" pureblood marriage.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP|F}} {{Comment|Appears on Black family tapestry}}
