'''Mr Prewett''' was an [[England|English]] [[pure-blood]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and a member of the [[Prewett family]].

==Biography==
He was the brother of [[Ignatius Prewett]].<ref>[[Sirius Black]] stated in Ch. 6 of {{OOTP}} that Molly Weasley was his "cousin by marriage". This means that Ignatius could not have been Molly, Fabian, and Gideon's father, as this would have made them first cousins by blood of Sirius [false logic: this merely means that Lucretia Black Prewett (Ignatius' wife) could not have been their mother]. Ignatius was Sirius's uncle by marriage, and if Molly was his niece, this could explain Sirius's comment. See this [[Talk:Ignatius Prewett|talk page]] for more information.</ref> the husband of [[Molly Weasley's mother|Mrs Prewett]], and the father of [[Molly Weasley|Molly Weasley née Prewett]], and [[Fabian Prewett|Fabian]] and [[Gideon Prewett]]. He was the maternal grandfather of the [[Weasley family|Weasley]] children. He was also the father-in-law of [[Arthur Weasley]]. He could also possibly be the nephew of [[Muriel]].

He may have owned a [[Wizard's Chess]] set<ref>{{PS|B|12}}: Ron's chess set is stated as belonging to his grandfather, but it does not say whether it was his maternal grandfather or his paternal grandfather.</ref> and may also have had a big nose.<ref>[http://e-card.51.net/movie.scripts/Harry.Potter/Harry-Potter-and-the-Prisoner-of-Azkaban.htm| Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (script)]: Fred states that George's nose looks "positively massive" and is corrected that it is his - he says it is a family trait from Molly, implying that one of Molly's parents had a big nose too, though it is unknown as to which parents did.</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{PS}} {{C|Possible mention}}
*{{OOTP}} {{C|Indirect mention}}
*{{OOTP|F}} {{C|Name possibly seen at Black family tree tapestry}}

This '''individual''' (fl. [[1492]]) was a priest and the man who comforted [[Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington|Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington]] just before his execution on the dawn of [[1492]]. Upon denying Sir Nicholas of wearing a hat (extravagant plumed hats were somewhat of a passion of his), the [[wizardkind|wizard]] knew his end was nigh.<ref name="background">[http://www.jkrowling.com/textonly/en/extrastuff_view.cfm?id=11 Extra Stuff - "Nearly Headless Nick"] on [[J. K. Rowling's official site|J.K.Rowling Official Site]]</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual is only mentioned on a [[Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington's ballad|self-penned ballad]] relaying the story of [[Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington]]'s death, that was supposed to make an appearance in the earlier drafts of {{COS}}.

This '''man''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Prime Minister (title)|Prime Minister]] who left office sometime before [[1992]]. He met with [[Cornelius Fudge]], who revealed the existence of the [[wizarding world]] to him. Believing the meeting to be a hoax perpetrated by the opposing political party, he tried to throw Fudge out of the window of his [[Prime Minister's office|office]].<ref name="HBP1">{{HBP|B|1}}</ref>

'''Apollyon Pringle''' was the [[Hogwarts Caretaker|caretaker]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] during the [[1960s]]. He was the [[Hogwarts Caretaker|caretaker]] of Hogwarts while [[Arthur Weasley|Arthur]] and [[Molly Weasley]] were attending, which Molly related to [[Harry Potter]] and [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]] in [[1995]] before the third task of the [[Triwizard Tournament]].<ref name="GOF31"/>

Apparently Hogwarts allowed him to use corporal punishment on students, as Mrs Weasley told Harry that he caned Arthur for being out late, with her even saying that he still had the marks.<ref name="GOF31">{{GOF|B|31}}</ref>

==Etymology==
"Apollyon" is the Greek name for [[Wikipedia:Abaddon|Abbadon]], the spiritual being named as "The Destroyer" in Christian apocalyptic theology.

'''Chroniculus Punnet''' was a [[magic]]al historian and author.<ref name="COSG">{{COS|G}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*''Chroniculus'' is a derivation of the English word ''Chronicle'', meaning "a written account of events and when they happened, ordered by time".<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/chronicle ''Chronicle'' on the Wiktionary]</ref> *''Punnet'' is a pun on the English word ''Pun'', meaning "joke or type of wordplay".<ref>[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/pun ''Pun'' on the Wiktionary]</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*In the console version of {{COS|G}}, Punnet is credited as the wizard who wrote ''[[Hogwarts: A History|Hogwarts, A History]]''. However, a later film prop identifies the book's author as [[Garius Tomkink|Professor Garius Tomkink]], and {{WWHP}} ultimately presents [[Bathilda Bagshot]] as the author.

==Appearances==
*{{COS|G}} {{1st Mention}}

'''Augustus Pye''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and trainee [[Healer]] at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]] in the Dai Llewellyn Ward.<ref name="OOTP22">{{OOTP|B|22}}</ref> He was interested in [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] healing techniques, and used [[stitches]] on [[Arthur Weasley]] when he was admitted to the hospital after he was [[Attack on Arthur Weasley|attacked]] by [[Nagini]]. Presumably, [[Nagini's venom]] made Arthur's wounds impossible to heal in this manner.<ref name="OOTP23">{{OOTP|B|23}}</ref>

During the [[Calamity]], Pye taught trainee [[Magizoologist]]s how to master the [[Stamina Charm]], to help them restore stamina to themselves in combat.<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Augustus" means "great" or "venerable", derived from Latin augere "to increase". Augustus was the title given to Octavian, the first Roman emperor. He was the adopted son of Julius Caesar who rose to power through a combination of military skill and political prowess. This was also the name of three kings of Poland.

'''Argo Pyrites''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]], [[Alchemy|alchemist]] and the author of ''[[Alchemy, Ancient Art and Science]]''.<ref name="lex">"[http://www.hp-lexicon.org/about/sources/jkr.com/jkr-com-trans-very-early-ps.html Very early page of Philosopher's Stone]" on The Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Etymology==
The name Argo derives from the Greek word ''argos'', meaning “swift”.<ref>"[http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?search=argo&searchmode=none Argo]" on The Online Etymology Dictionary</ref> 
In Greek mythology, [[Wikipedia:Argo|Argo]] was the ship on which [[Wikipedia:Jason|Jason]] and his companions, the [[Wikipedia:Argonaut|Argonauts]], sailed on their journey to find the [[Wikipedia:Golden Fleece|Golden Fleece]]. [[Wikipedia:Pyrite|Pyrite]] is a shiny yellow mineral, which is also called Fool's Gold, due to its resemblance to the precious metal.

==Behind the scenes==
*This character is mentioned only on a page from an early draft of {{PS}} which [[J. K. Rowling]] posted on her [[J. K. Rowling's official site|website]].<ref name="lex" /> He may have been related to [[Pyrites]], a [[Death Eaters|Death Eater]] who was included in early drafts of the same book, but was also discarded.
*It is also possible that the Death Eater in question was supposed to be Argo Pyrites, and that the two are one and the same.

==Appearances==
*{{PS}} {{Comment|Early drafts}}

'''Quigley''' was an [[Ireland|Irish]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[Beater]] for the [[Irish National Quidditch team]] during the [[1994]] [[Quidditch World Cup]]. He played in the final against [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team|Bulgaria]] in which he struck a [[Bludger]] towards Bulgaria's [[Viktor Krum]], breaking the [[Seeker]]'s nose. His side won and he and Troy lifted the Quidditch World Cup aloft in the stadium's [[Top Box]].<ref>{{GOF|B|8}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*It is possible that this Beater is [[Finbar Quigley]], who plays for the Ballycastle Bats, as they share the same last name and Ballycastle could refer to either the small town in [[Northern Ireland]] or the village in the Republic of [[Ireland]]. If so, it is likely that he plays Beater for the [[Ballycastle Bats]].

'''Thiago Quintana''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[wizardkind|wizard]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s">{{WW|1920s-wizarding-america-en}}</ref> He, along with [[Shikoba Wolfe]], [[Johannes Jonker]], and [[Violetta Beauvais]], was one of four [[wandmaker]]s who served [[North America]] in the early [[20th century]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

==Biography==
Quintana's [[wand]]s caused a sensation when they were first introduced.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" /> Sleek and unusually long in design, they produced [[spell]]s of "force and elegance". They contained a single [[White River Monster spine|spine]] taken from the back of one of the [[White River Monster]]s native to [[Arkansas]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s" /> Initially, there were fears that the species was being over-fished, but the ecological impact was lessened by the fact that only Quintana knew how to lure the creatures.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" /> He fiercely guarded this secret up until his death, after which wands containing White River Monster spine [[wand core|cores]] were no longer made.<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

'''Edward Rabnott'''<ref>{{OOTP|G}} - NDS version</ref> was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. There were portraits of him hung at [[Hogwarts Castle]]. He had at least three different personalities, who often talked and bickered amongst themselves.

==Biography==
===[[1995–1996 school year]]===
In the [[1995–1996 school year]], Edward's portraits hid a secret passageway from the [[Seventh-floor corridor]] to the fourth-floor. The password to this shortcut was "''Three heads are better than one''." By [[1995]], one of his portraits was covered in cobwebs and inaccessible. Edward had promised to give [[Harry Potter]] the password to his secret passage, only if he could clear the cobwebs off the portrait. As Harry did so, the portrait kept his promise.

==Behind the scenes==
*Edward Rabnott's portrait seem to be a direct homage to [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/2d/Anthonis_van_Dyck_041.jpg ''Charles I, King of England, from Three Angles''], by [[Wikipedia:Anthony van Dyck|Anthony van Dyck]].
*Edward may be a relative of [[Modesty Rabnott]].
*Mr Rabnott may have died sometime prior to [[1995]], as many portraits hung at [[Hogwarts Castle]] depict deceased individuals.
*In the [[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (video game)|video game adaptation]] of {{OOTP}}, Edward was voiced by [[David Coker]].

==Etymology==
The name "Edward" means "rich guard", derived from the Old English elements ead "rich, blessed" and weard "guard". Saint Edward the Confessor was the king of England shortly before the Norman conquest.

*{{PS|F}} {{Portrait}}
*{{COS|F}} {{Portrait}}
*{{OOTP|G}} {{Portrait}}

'''Daniel Radcliffe''' (fl. [[1997]]) was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] actor who had a large part in ''[[Equus]]'', a play that was staged sometime in the late [[1990s]]. There was a poster mentioning him at [[Luchino Caffe]] in the summer of [[1997]].<ref name="DHpt1">{{DH|F1}}</ref>

*This mention is an obvious reference to [[Daniel Radcliffe]], the actor who played [[Harry Potter]] in all the [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]] and who also had a part in the 2007 revival of ''[[Wikipedia:Equus (play)|Equus]]''. It was put on the set as a little inside joke.

'''Radulf''' (fl. [[12th century]]) was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] blacksmith who lived in the same village as [[Goodwin Kneen]]. After [[Gunhilda Kneen]] got a touch of [[Dragon Pox]], Radulf was called in to play ''[[Chaser|Catcher]]'' (Chaser) in a game of ''[[Quidditch|Kwidditch]]'' (Quidditch) against a team from Ilkley. During the game, he took a ''[[Bludger|Blooder]]'' ([[Bludger]]) to the head when old [[Ugga]] failed to intercept it.<ref>{{QTA|R|3}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Radulf" is derived from the Norse elements ráð meaning "counsel" and úlfr meaning "wolf".

He hasn't stopped raging about the Bagman business, he reckons the Ministry did a cover-up, those goblins never got their gold from him, you know —|An exchange between [[Remus Lupin]] and [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]], about Ragnok.|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}
'''Ragnok '''(fl. [[1995]]) was a [[goblin]] employed at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]].
==Biography==
[[File:Ragnok'sOffice.png|250px|thumb|Ragnok's office at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]]]]
Ragnok worked at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]] in the 1990's , and had an office next to [[Griphook]] in the main offices at [[Diagon Alley]].<ref name="WWoHP"/> Ragnok was acquainted with [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]], and seemingly known to [[Remus Lupin|Professor Remus Lupin]] as well.

It seems that Ragnok's leanings were such that Professor Lupin thought he might be amenable to helping the [[Order of the Phoenix]], though when Bill tried to convince him to do so in [[1995]], Ragnok declined, as he was feeling a lot of hostility toward [[Wizardkind|wizards]] at the time. [[Ludovic Bagman|Ludo Bagman]] had recently failed to pay some goblins winnings to which they felt they were entitled, and Ragnok believed that the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] had conspired to hide evidence of this. He expressed his thoughts on the matter very vehemently.<ref name="OP5">{{OOTP|B|5}}</ref>

*{{WWHP}} {{Mention}}

'''Gawain Robards''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as an [[Auror]] for the [[Auror Office]] under the command of [[Rufus Scrimgeour]] during the [[Second Wizarding War]].<ref name="HBP16" />

==Biography==
Following [[Cornelius Fudge]]'s fall from power in [[1996]], Scrimgeour replaced Fudge as [[Minister for Magic]], and as such Robards was promoted to replace Scrimgeour as Head of the Auror Office. Scrimgeour, during his attempts to convince [[Harry Potter]] to become the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]]'s new "poster boy", offered to set up an interview with Robards, knowing he cherished a desire to join the Auror department one day, in exchange for his cooperation, but Harry refused.<ref name="HBP16">{{HBP|B|16}}</ref>

Robards was succeeded (immediately or otherwise) as Head of the [[Auror Office]] by Harry Potter himself following the end of the war. He appeared to have remained, however, working as an Auror; in response to the [[Calamity]] in the late [[2010s]], he assisted in training [[Auror]] members of the then-recently-established [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]].<ref>[[Harry Potter: Wizards Unite]] ([https://wizardsunitehub.info/profession-skill/gawaining-experience/ See here])</ref><ref>[[Harry Potter: Wizards Unite]] ([https://wizardsunitehub.info/profession-skill/the-confusion-hex/ See here])</ref><ref>[[Harry Potter: Wizards Unite]] ([https://wizardsunitehub.info/profession-skill/confusion-hex-repetitions/ See here])</ref> He teaches a prospective [[Auror]] how to cast his version of the very complicated [[Confusion Hex]].

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name "Gawain" is uncertain, from the name of a nephew of King Arthur and one of the knights of the Round Table in Arthurian legend. He was a popular hero in medieval stories such as the 14th-century romantic poem 'Sir Gawain and the Green Knight'. In some Welsh sources he is considered identical with the earlier Welsh hero Gwalchmei, whose name meant "hawk of May". Alternatively the name may have a different Welsh meaning or even a Germanic origin.

The family name "Robards" means "son of Robert" also a Germanic, French and Latvian name meaning "Bright fame".

'''Mr Ross''' was a Scottish [[wizardkind|wizard]] and he and [[Isobel Ross's mother|his wife]], a witch, had at least one child, [[Isobel Ross|Isobel]].<ref name="pottermore">{{PM}} biography of [[Minerva McGonagall]]  (transcription available [http://forums.darklordpotter.net/showpost.php?s=4a2e751bddc00f9618a0b1bb6d9ce6fc&p=481284&postcount=443 here])</ref>

When Isobel became romantically involved with a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] neighbour, [[Robert McGonagall Senior|Robert McGonagall]], she knew her parents would not approve, and thus she chose not to tell them of the relationship. Eventually, the young couple eloped, provoking the Ross' anger to the point they completely severed ties with their daughter.<ref name="pottermore" />

This '''individual''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and the uncle of [[Rowan Khanna]].<ref name="HM45"/>

==Biography==
It can be presumed that he grew up in the [[Khanna Farms|family business]], as he knew enough about woodworking to become a top [[broom-maker]] as an adult. He apparently did very good, meticulous work and was very proud of it, since crafting a single broom would take him a few months and would cost a few thousand galleons. Rowan suggested they could ask his uncle to make one for [[Jacob's sibling]] after they learned the easiest way to enter the [[Forbidden Forest]] unseen was by flying. This suggestion was, however, too time-consuming and costly for it to go anywhere, as Rowan's friend ultimately borrowed a broom from someone else instead.<ref name="HM45">{{HM|4|5}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*It is unknown if this uncle and [[Ollie]],<ref>{{HM|3|Wizarding World Famous}} - mentioned if option ''"It's amazing"'' is chosen when asked about the contest.</ref> an uncle mentioned by name by Rowan, is the same man.

The '''rowboat owner''' was a toothless old [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]. In [[1991]], he lent his [[Toothless old man's rowboat|rowboat]] to [[Vernon Dursley]], so that the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]] and [[Harry Potter]] could get to the [[Hut-on-the-Rock|hut placed on a rock off the sea coast]], and subsequently spend the night there.<ref name="PS3">{{PS|B|3}}</ref> They needed to do so, because Vernon and [[Petunia Dursley]] wanted to escape the grasp of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]]. But they were unsuccessful, as [[Rubeus Hagrid]] appeared and personally delivered Harry's letter.<ref name="PS4">{{PS|B|4}}</ref> It is uncertain whether he returned for the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]], or they returned to the mainland on some other transportation.

'''Barry Ryan''' was an Irish [[wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[keeper]] for the [[Irish National Quidditch team]] during the [[1994]] [[Quidditch World Cup]]. He was one of the team members that [[Harry Potter]] got to see in the [[Top Box]] during the 1994 [[Quidditch World Cup]].

After the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup|World Cup]], Ryan did a spectacular save with his boot against [[Poland]]'s top [[Chaser]], which was accidentally copied by [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]] in his [[fifth year]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]].

As of [[2014]], Barry Ryan did not play for the [[Irish National Quidditch team]] any more.<ref>[http://insider.pottermore.com/2014/03/history-of-quidditch-world-cup-part-two.html "History of the Quidditch World Cup, Part Two to be released tomorrow"] at [http://insider.pottermore.com/ Pottermore Insider]</ref>

'''Albert Sallow''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked at the [[British Ministry of Magic]] in the [[2010s]], in the capacity of [[Unspeakable]].<ref name="WUtrailer">{{WU}} {{see image|File:WU trailer documents ref.png}}</ref>

==Biography==
At some point in his career, he entered the [[Love Chamber]] in the [[Department of Mysteries]]; the log documenting the time of his entry and exit was brought to light during the investigation over the [[Calamity]], as it also showed [[Grim Fawley]] was frequently in the room at odd times.<ref name="WUtrailer"/>

At some point during at least the [[2010s]], Sallow took members of the [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]] on an informal tour of the Department of Mysteries. While on the tour, he taught the task force members about many of the mysterious artefacts kept within the department.<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>

'''Sam''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as an [[Obliviator]] for the [[Magical Congress of the United States of America]] in the [[1920s]].<ref name="fb68">{{FB|S|68}}</ref>

==Biography==
In [[1926]], Sam was tasked with [[Memory Charm|wiping the memory]] of the [[Non-magic people|No-Maj]] [[Jacob Kowalski]] after he entered the MACUSA headquarters, but was intercepted by [[Queenie Goldstein]].<ref name="fb68" /> Queenie, a [[Legilimency|Legilimens]], was able to read Sam's mind and see that he was in relationships with two women at the same time, fellow MACUSA employees [[Ruby (witch)|Ruby]] and [[Cecily]].<ref name="fb68" /> Queenie threatened to reveal his infidelity and was thus able to convince him not to Obliviate Jacob.<ref name="fb68" />

==Physical Appearance==
Sam has brown hair and wears a navy blue blazer with the MACUSA logo on the right side and a white button down shirt.

==Behind the scenes==
*Sam was portrayed by [[Matthew Wilson]] in ''[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]''.

{{Quote|Sanguini, stay here! Here, have a pasty.|Worple to Sanguini at the [[Slug Club Christmas party]]|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince}}

'''Sanguini''' was a male [[vampire]] who attended a [[Slug Club Christmas party]] during [[Harry Potter]]'s [[1996–1997 school year|sixth year]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]]. He was the guest of [[Eldred Worple]]. The tall, emaciated man had dark shadows under his eyes and looked bored with the party until a nearby group of girls attracted his attention. Worple tried to distract him by shoving a pasty into his hand.<ref name="HBP15">{{HBP|B|15}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name Sanguini most likely originates from the Latin word ''sanguineus'', meaning "of blood", "bloody", "blood-coloured", or "bloodthirsty" - a reference to his vampirism. The Latin word ''sanguini'' is the dative singular of the noun ''sanguis'', "[[blood]]", and means literally "to blood" or "for blood." Other possible influences derived from this Latin root include French ''sang ''and Italian ''sangue'', both meaning "blood", and the English words exsanguination, "to bleed out", and sanguine, describing a blood colour or having an active, warm and lively circulation or temper.

==Behind the scenes==
In {{HBP|FA}}, scenes with Sanguini (portrayed by British actor [[Charlie Bennison]]) were shot, but were cut from the final edit of [[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|the film]]. In one photo he is seen with [[Eldred Worple]] talking with [[Luna Lovegood]]. Sanguini can be seen in the background on close observation.<ref name="HBPF">{{HBP|F}}</ref>

Rowling: The final of the 2014 Quidditch World Cup between Bulgaria and Brazil has begun!]</ref> was a [[Brazil]]ian [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as [[Beater]] for the [[Brazilian National Quidditch team]].

==Biography==
He was the [[Beater]] for the [[2014]] [[Brazilian National Quidditch team]]. According to [[Ludovic Bagman]] in a report to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'', American Beaters [[Lucas Picquery|Picquery]] and [[Pringle]] would have to "''find better form''" if they were to best the Brazilians Santos and [[Carlos Clodoaldo|Clodoaldo]] in their semi-final match on [[4 July]], [[2014]].<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[PLACE YOUR BETS WITH LUDO BAGMAN]] (Archived)</ref>

On the final, Brazil versus [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team|Bulgaria]], Santos hit opposing [[Seeker]] [[Viktor Krum]] hard over the head with his [[Beater's bat|bat]] on the 123rd minute. Referee [[Herman Junker]] paused the game and examined [[Omnioculars|Omniocular]] footage to determine if a foul had been committed.<ref name="the-qwc2014-final">{{PM}} - [[2014 Quidditch World Cup final]] (Archived)</ref>

'''Nicholas Saunders''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] circus performer. He was one of the performers whose talents were featured in [[Le Cirque du Vaga Lume]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}} {{see image|File:LeCirqueduVagaLumePoster.jpg}}</ref>

Saunders also adapted the [[William Shakespeare]] play ''[[Twelfth Night]]'' for the [[Shakespeare in Shaftsbury]] event that was held as part of the [[Soho Play Summer Art Festival]] in [[London]] in [[1997]].<ref>''Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 - Behind the Magic'' {{see image|File:ShakespearePoster.jpg}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was named after [[Nicholas Saunders]], a graphic artist who worked on ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince]]'', as well as {{DH|F1}}.

{{Quote|Obedient to Sirius's wish of hearing about anything odd at Hogwarts, Harry sent him a letter by brown owl that night, explaining all about Mr Crouch breaking into Snape's office, and Moody and Snape's conversation.|Description|Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire}}
'''Scouthibou'''<ref>{{GOF|B|26}}; French translation </ref> was a [[brown owl|brown]] [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts school]] [[owl]] that inhabited the [[Owlery]] in the mid-[[1990s]]. 

==History==
In early [[1995]], [[Harry Potter]] sent [[Sirius Black]] a letter on the odd events at Hogwarts surrounding [[Severus Snape]] and [[Alastor Moody]] via this owl.<ref>{{GOF|B|26}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This owl is only named in the French translation of {{GOF}}, by [[Jean-François Ménard]]. The owl remains unidentified in the original English version.
*The suffix "''hibou''" is French for "owl".

{{Quote|Take out the [[Seeker]].|Brutus Scrimgeour's first rule for [[Beater]]s, ''[[The Beaters' Bible]]''|Quidditch Through the Ages (real)}}
'''Brutus Scrimgeour'''<ref name="QoSC" /> was a [[wizardkind|wizard]] and prolific [[Quidditch]] fan. He served as [[headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] at some point<ref name="hp-kinect" /><ref name="mohp" /> and also wrote the book ''[[The Beaters' Bible]]''.<ref name="qta">{{QTA|R}}</ref>

==Biography==
===Life and career===
During his life, Scrimgeour taught at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]],<ref name="QoSC" /> and was eventually appointed [[headmaster]].<ref name="hp-kinect" /><ref name="mohp" />

Scrimgeour was a fan of Quidditch and may have been a [[Beater]] at some point.<ref name="qta" /> He wrote a guide for Beaters, ''[[The Beaters' Bible]]'', and gave a positive review of the book {{QTA}} by [[Kennilworthy Whisp]], saying that it was "''the definitive work on the origins and history of Quidditch''" and that he "''highly recommended''" it.<ref name="qta" />

===Legacy===
Scrimgeour died sometime in or before the year [[1994]].<ref name="DOD" /> Multiple [[portrait]]s of him were thereafter hung within [[Hogwarts Castle]].

One portrait, hung in the [[Trophy Room]], hid a secret passage to the fourth floor.<ref name="ootp-gba">{{OOTP|G}} - GBA version</ref> During the [[1994-1995 school year]], the [[password]] to open this passage was initially "''Beati pacifici'',"<ref name="ootp-gba" /> meaning "blessed are the peacemakers" in [[Latin]].<ref>"[http://www.latin-dictionary.org/Beati_pacifici Beati pacifici]" on Latin-Dictionary.org</ref> This was changed to "''Iunctis viribus''" ("by united efforts" in Latin)<ref>"[http://www.latin-dictionary.org/Latin-English-Dictionary/Iunctis_viribus Iunctis viribus]" on Latin-Dictionary.org</ref> later in the same school year.<ref name="ootp-gba" />

Another portrait of Scrimgeour was hung in the [[Headmaster's office]].<ref name="mohp" />

==Etymology==
[[File:Brutus Scrimgeour.png|250px|right|thumb|Brutus's portrait.]]The name "Brutus" is a Roman cognomen meaning "heavy" in Latin. Famous bearers include Lucius Junius Brutus, the traditional founder of the Roman Republic, and Marcus Junius Brutus, the statesman who conspired to assassinate Julius Caesar.

==Behind the scenes==
*Scrimgeour may have been related to [[Rufus Scrimgeour]], a [[Minister for Magic]] killed by [[Death Eaters]].
*Scrimgeour's portrait was painted by artist [[Steve Mitchell]].<ref>[http://www.stevemitchellscenicartist.co.uk/photo_11369131.html Portrait page] on Steve Mitchell's official site</ref> Mitchell created several portraits for the [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]].<ref>[http://www.stevemitchellscenicartist.co.uk/section694708_572232.html Portrait portfolio] on Steve Mitchell's official site</ref>
*On "The Quest of Sir Cadogan" feature on Disc 2 of the ''[[Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (film)|Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban]]'' DVD, Scrimgeour's portrait appears to be inverted horizontally.
*The phrase ''beati pacifici'', [[Latin]] for "blessed are the peacemakers", is a portion of [[Bible|Matthew 5:9]]. The full verse reads ''beati pacifici quoniam filii Dei vocabuntur'' ("Blessed are the peacemakers: for they shall be called the children of [[God]]").

'''Sebastian''' was a young individual.<ref> [https://www.pottermore.com/news/open-casting-call-for-young-people-announced-for-fantastic-beasts-and-where-to-find-them-sequel Open casting call for young people announced for Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them sequel] from {{PM}}</ref>

==Etymology==
*Sebastian is a name with Greek and Latin origins meaning "venerable; majestic; revered; exalted."
**As a Greek word meaning "venerable one", Sebastos was an honorific used by the ancient Greeks to render the Roman imperial title of ''Augustus'' (being an honorific for Roman emperors that was a translation of the Latin ''Augustus'') that formed the basis of a new system of court titles for the Byzantine Empire.

*Sebasteia was a military-civilian province of the Byzantine Empire .

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual was likely involved with a young [[Newton Scamander]] and [[Leta Lestrange]] as the casting call for these three characters was announced together.

==Appearances==
*{{PM}}

'''Temeritus Shanks'''<ref name="LE">{{HPLE}}</ref> was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He seemed to like reading newspapers, and was interested in knowing the headlines of the day. He believed every word he read in the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'', including the stories about [[Harry Potter]] and [[Albus Dumbledore]] published during the [[1995–1996 school year]]. There are [[portrait]]s of him hung on the walls of [[Hogwarts Castle]].<ref name="OP"/>

==Biography==
===[[1992–1993 school year]]===
In early [[1993]], Shanks had a portrait at the [[Grand Staircase]], hung immediately below the ground-floor landing.<ref name="COSF">{{COS|F}} - Chapter 22 (''The Diary'')</ref>

===[[1993-1994 school year]]===
In [[September]] of [[1993]], Shanks had a portrait on the seventh floor.<ref name="POAG">{{POA|G}}</ref>

===[[1995–1996 school year]]===
By [[1995]], Shanks had a portrait hung at the [[Hogwarts Library]], guarding a shortcut to the fourth-floor corridor, under the password "''No news is good news''". Said shortcut was reserved to the staff only. When [[Harry Potter]], who was being highly discredited by the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' at the time, asked if he could use this secret passageway, Shanks made an exception for the student was constantly featured on the paper. The portrait agreed to give the student the password in exchange for the headline of the day ("''TRAGIC DEMISE OF MINISTRY OF MAGIC WORKER''", concerning [[Broderick Bode]]'s assassination).<ref name="OP">{{OOTP|G}}</ref>

Shanks had another portrait at the [[Grand Staircase]], concealing a secret passage to the [[Clock Tower Courtyard]]. Its password was "''Audaces fortuna iuvat''".<ref name="OP GBA">{{OOTP|G}} - GBA version</ref>

===[[1996–1997 school year]]===
Shanks's portrait was kept at the same place at the [[Hogwarts Library|Library]], but hiding a different shortcut, leading to the [[Grand Staircase]]. The new password was "''Happy Headlines''".<ref name="HBP">{{HBP|G}}</ref> The same shortcut could also lead to the second-floor corridor.<ref name="HBP NDS">{{HBP|G}} - NDS version</ref> When Shanks heard [[Harry Potter]] talking to [[Hermione Granger]] about [[Draco Malfoy]]'s mysterious endeavours at the seventh floor, he gladly told him the new password in order to help him on what he deemed a "big scoop".<ref name="HBP" />

==Personality and traits==
Temeritus Shanks was quite a naive and gullible wizard, believing everything he read on the papers.<ref name="OP" /> Despite this he was brave, speaking [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s name out loud when he was at large.<ref name="HBP" /> He would gladly help students in matters he deemed to be sensational, to the point of giving his password to them despite the passageway being reserved only to the staff.<ref name="HBP" />

==Behind the scenes==
*Shanks may have passed away sometime prior to [[1991]] as many portraits hung at [[Hogwarts Castle]] depict deceased individuals.
*Temeritus was voiced in both the [[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (video game)|video game version]] of {{OOTP}} and the [[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (video game)|video game adaptation]] of {{HBP}} video games by [[Jonathan Kydd]].
*Shanks's portrait was based on a real-world [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/9d/King_James_I_of_England_and_VI_of_Scotland_by_Arnold_van_Brounckhorst.jpg portrait of a young King James I] of England.<ref name="LE"/>

*Owner of [[Shaw News]]{{CB}} |house = |loyalty = [[Shaw family]] }} {{Quote|I’ll expose you for who you are and what you’ve done.|Henry Shaw Senior's threat to [[wizardkind]]|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}} '''Henry Shaw Senior''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Non-magic people|No-Maj]] newspaper magnate and founder of [[Shaw News]]. He was the father of [[Henry Shaw Junior]], a [[wikipedia:United States Senate|US Senator]] during the [[1920]]s, and [[Langdon Shaw]]. While Henry was proud of Henry Shaw Jnr, he did not think very highly of his younger son [[Langdon Shaw|Langdon]], whom he considered a disappointment. ==Biography== ===Early life=== Henry Shaw Senior was born in or before [[1854]]. He became a newspaper magnate by founding and running [[Shaw News]], a company that published several newspapers, including the [[New-York Clarion]]. He also fathered at least two children, [[Henry Shaw Junior]] and [[Langdon Shaw]]. ===The Obscurus=== ====Meeting Credence Barebone==== {{Quote|Your brother and I are busy here, Langdon. Working on his campaign. We don’t have time for this.|Henry Shaw Senior's dismissive attitude|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}[[File:Shaw Family FB1.png|thumb|The Shaw family addressing the Barebone family]] After Langdon Shaw began to believe there was a [[Wizardkind|magical society living amongst them]], he brought [[Mary Lou Barebone]] from the [[New Salem Philanthropic Society]] and her adopted children [[Credence Barebone|Credence]], [[Chastity Barebone|Chastity]], and [[Modesty Barebone|Modesty]] to his father's [[Shaw Tower|office]]. Langdon laid out a portfolio filled with a series of photographic evidence of [[magic|witchcraft]] and told his father of his belief that "strange things going all over" [[New York]]. However, both he and Henry Shaw Jnr dismissed his story. Mary Lou asked to garnish the support of his newspaper company and his older son re-election platform. But Henry Shaw Senior refused, and asked the Barebone family to leave. While they were leaving, Mary Lou's adopted son Credence dropped a leaflet and his older son the Senator handed the leaflet back to him and called him a freak.{{FB|S|38}} ====Attack on the Fundraising Dinner Hall==== {{Quote|Sounds of anguish and panic from the crowd as Shaw Snr fights through the debris toward his son’s torn and bleeding body, his face brutally scarred. Shaw Snr looks devastated as he crouches beside his son.|Henry Shaw Snr reaction about the death of his son|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}[[File:Shaw Sr surprised Fantastic Beasts CC Trailer WM.JPG|thumb|Henry Shaw Senior's horror at witnessing the Obscurial attack his son]] Henry Shaw Snr was present at a rally for his elder son's supporters in [[New York]] in the [[Henry Shaw Junior's fundraising dinner|fund-raising dinner]], which was also picketed by members of the [[New Salem Philanthropic Society]]."[http://www.fantasticbeastsmovies.com/index.php/2015/10/21/video-scene-being-filmed-updated/ Video: Scene Being Filmed (UPDATED)]" from FantasticBeastsMovies.com"[http://www.fantasticbeastsmovies.com/index.php/2015/11/20/pottermore-set-report-3/ Pottermore Set Report #3]" from FantasticBeastsMovies.com"[http://www.bleedingcool.com/2015/11/07/will-it-be-jk-rowlings-fantastic-beasts-or-fascist-beasts/ Will It Be JK Rowling’s Fantastic Beasts – Or Fascist Beasts?]" from Bleeding Cool When his older son the Senator was in the middle of his speech, an [[Obscurus|invisible force]] burst forth from beneath the organ. It soared across the hall, sending tables flying, and throwing people around as it carved a line toward the stage where Shaw Jnr was still standing. Henry Shaw Snr watched in horror as the invisible force threw his son backwards against his poster, and then raised him up high where he was suspended for just a moment in midair before being thrown violently back down onto the stage, dead. In the midst of sounds of anguish and panic from the crowd as Henry Shaw Snr fought his way through the crowd to reach his son's dead body, feeling devastated as he crouched beside his slain son.{{FB|S|58}} ====Obscurial attack on New York==== {{Quote|That thing killed my son — I want justice!|Henry Shaw Snr about Credence's Obscurus|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}[[File:Shaw Sr Fantastic Beasts CC Trailer.JPG|thumb|Henry Shaw Senior witnessing the carnage in New York city]] On the next night of [[7 December]] [[1926]], when Credence unleashed his Obscurus on New York, eventually taking refuge in the [[New York City Subway|subway station]], Shaw fought, along with his other son Langdon, to make his way through the crowd standing before the magical barrier conjured by [[Magical Congress of the United States of America|MACUSA]], declaring his intent to get justice for his son, and ordered his photographers to take as many photographs and vowed to expose [[wizardkind]]. However, come dawn, [[Newton Scamander]] released [[Frank]] the [[Thunderbird]] into the sky, creating a rainstorm laced with [[Swooping Evil venom]] that [[Memory Charm|Obliviated]] all memories of magic from the minds of Shaw and Langdon and every [[Muggle|No-Maj]] in New York.{{FB|S|109}} ==Personality and traits== Henry Shaw Snr was a very serious, ambitious and rational individual, who was strongly focused and dedicated to his role as the leader of a huge media empire and the success of both his newspapers and his eldest son Henry. Regarding his two sons, he was evidently elitist and in favour of Henry massively over Langdon, who he admired for his political ambitions and success as a politician, whilst clearly being contemptuous of Langdon for being less motivated and successful, and being prone to seemingly trivial pursuits and ideas. Initially, being a very serious and sharp individual, he rejected the belief of the existence of witchcraft or Wizardkind in New York City, believing it be irrational nonsense, and thus dismisses the Barebones and expresses disappointment in Langdon for believing it himself, showing he had little time or patience for imagination or unproven things. However, upon his discovery of the existence of Wizardkind and [[magic]] following Creedence's Obscurial form murdering Henry Shaw Jnr at his campaign dinner, he immediately expressed his desire for answers from and vengeance against the Wizarding community, and threatened to expose their magic to the world. He was fiercely dedicated to his family's success and well-being above all else in the world. ==Behind the scenes== *Henry Shaw Senior is portrayed by [[Jon Voight]] in ''[[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them]]''."[http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20151210006476/en/Announcement-Trailer-%E2%80%9CFantastic-Beasts-Find-Them%E2%80%9D-Unveiled Announcement Trailer for 'Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them' to Be Unveiled Worldwide on December 15th]" from ''Business Wire'' ==Appearances== {{Imagecat|Images of Henry Shaw Senior}} *{{FB|S}} {{1st}} *{{FB|F}} *{{PM}} *{{CB}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Shaw, Henry Senior}} [[de:Henry Shaw sr.]] [[de2:Henry Shaw Senior]] [[pl:Henry Shaw Senior]] [[es:Henry Shaw Sr.]] [[fr:Henry Shaw Sr.]] [[pt-br:Henry Shaw Sênior]] [[ru:Генри Шоу]] [[Category:American individuals]] [[Category:Journalists]] [[Category:Males]] [[Category:Muggles]] [[Category:Shaw family|Henry Snr]]"}]}}}}

{{Quote|There’s strange things going on all over the city. The people behind this—they are not like you and me. This is witchcraft, don’t you see.|Langdon Shaw regarding the existence of [[magic]]|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}

'''Langdon Shaw''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[No-Maj]] who lived in the early [[20th century]]. He was the younger son of newspaper magnate [[Henry Shaw Senior]].<ref name="featurette">{{PM}} - "[https://www.pottermore.com/news/8-exciting-clues-from-the-fantastic-beasts-featurette 8 exciting clues from the Fantastic Beasts featurette]"</ref><ref name="description">"[http://www.fantasticbeastsmovies.com/ Full Character Descriptions]" from FantasticBeastsMovies.com</ref> He had at least one sibling, an older brother [[Henry Shaw Junior]] who was elected to the United States Senate in [[1920]].

==Biography==

===Early life===
While his older brother, the senator [[Henry Shaw Junior]], was Shaw Snr's pride and joy, Langdon was viewed as something of a failure and disappointment. This did not stop him from constantly trying to seek his father's approval.<ref name="description" />

===The Obscurus===

====Meeting the Barebones====
{{Dialogue|Langdon|The crazy disturbances in the subway — just look at the pictures!|Henry Shaw Snr|I’d like you and your friends to leave.|Henry Shaw Senior dismissing his son|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}[[File:LookAtTheEvidence.png|thumb|Langdon arguing with his father over the existence of witches in America]]
On [[6 December]] [[1926]], Langdon brought [[Mary Lou Barebone]] from the [[New Salem Philanthropic Society]] and her adopted children [[Credence Barebone|Credence]], [[Chastity Barebone|Chastity]] and [[Modesty Barebone|Modesty]] to [[Shaw News]] meet with his father. Barging into Shaw Snr's office, Langdon laid out a portfolio filled with a series of photographic evidence of [[magic|witchcraft]] and told his father of his belief that "strange things [were] going on all over" [[New York]] and that the people behind these incidents were "[[wizardkind|not like [them]]]," certain that he was giving him the scoop of the century.<ref name="description" /> His father and brother both dismissed his claims.<ref name="description" />

Henry Shaw Senior refused to give Mary Lou the support of his newspaper company and his elder son's re-election platform, and asked the [[Barebone family]] to leave. While they were departing, Mary Lou's adopted son Credence dropped a leaflet, which Henry Shaw Jr handed back to him, while unashamedly and cruelly calling him a freak.<ref name="FBS">{{FB|S}}</ref>
[[File:18425469 1292600117521350 3427835379275088949 n.jpg|250x250px|thumb|left|Langdon tried to tell his father about witchcraft to win his approval]]

====Attack on the Fundraising Dinner Hall====
{{Quote|Witches!|Langdon's reaction after when his brother gets killed|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}Langdon later attended his brother's [[Henry Shaw Junior's fundraising dinner|fundraising dinner]] with his father. While his brother was in the middle of his speech, an [[Obscurus|invisible force]] burst forth from beneath the organ. It soared across the hall, sending tables flying, and throwing people around as it carved a line toward the stage where Shaw Jr was still standing. Langdon watched as the invisible force threw his brother backwards against his poster, and then raised him up high where he was suspended for just a moment in midair before being thrown violently back down onto the stage, dead. In the midst of sounds of anguish and panic from the crowd, his father crouched beside his slain son. Langdon, who was slightly drunk, determinedly and triumphantly stated that this was the work of witchcraft.<ref name="FBS">{{FB|S}}</ref>

[[File:18425203 1292600077521354 5711824014161688619 n.jpg|250x250px|thumb|right|A drunk Langdon right after the attack on the Fundraising Dinner Hall]]

====Obscurial attack on New York====
{{Quote|Langdon, drunk, stares, enthralled and amazed with the spectacle.|Langdon reaction as he watches the Obscurus|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}On the next night, [[7 December]] [[1926]], Langdon was present when [[Credence Barebone]] unleashed his [[Obscurus]] on New York, and [[Magical Congress of the United States of America|MACUSA]] began magically sealing off the subway entrance where Credence had taken refuge. Having seen magic first-hand, Langdon revelled in the spectacle as Shaw Snr vowed to expose the wizarding kind.<ref name="FB111">{{FB|S|111}}</ref> When the dawn of [[8 December]] came, [[Newton Scamander]] unleashed [[Frank]] the [[Thunderbird]], who created a rainstorm laced with [[Swooping Evil venom]], [[Memory Charm|Obliviating]] all [[Non-magic people|No-Majs']] memories of magic, including Langdon's, who stood in the [[Water|rain]] as his expression grew blank.<ref name="FB118">{{FB|S|118}}</ref> 

==Personality and traits==
{{Quote|Shaw Snr and the senator look dubious—all too used to Langdon’s harebrained little projects and interests.|Shaw Senior and the Senator reaction about Langdon|Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them: The Original Screenplay}}Langdon Shaw was an excitable young man with a proclivity for wild ideas. He was frustrated by living in his elder brother’s shadow, and constantly tried to seek his father's approval and attention. He was also excited to try to show he had authority or power. Langdon appeared to have a tendency to drink too much.

==Relationships==
===Family===
[[File:Shaw Family FB1.png|thumb|Langdon with his father and brother]]
Langdon's relationship with his father and brother seemed to be quite poor. His father [[Henry Shaw Senior]] saw him as a disappointment and was rather contemptuous of him, constantly dismissing Langdon and even refusing to listen to anything he said, including his belief in witchcraft, all the while favouring and praising his brother [[Henry Shaw Junior|Henry Shaw Jr]].

==Behind the scenes==
*Langdon Shaw is portrayed by [[Ronan Raftery]] in the [[Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (film)|film adaptation]] of {{FB|R}}.<ref name="description" />
*Initial reports gave this character's name as "Laurence".<ref name="IMDB">[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt3183660/fullcredits/ "Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016): Full Cast & Crew"] at [http://www.imdb.com/?ref_=nv_home IMDb]</ref> His correct name was later released through {{PM}}.<ref name="featurette" /><ref name="description" />

{{Quote|Wales's chances were finally dashed by a stunning Snitch capture by Brazilian Seeker Tony Silva, who performed a spectacular dive in the 131st minute of the match to seize victory from under his counterpart Eurig Cadwallader's nose.|[[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]], "[[BRAZIL VERSUS WALES]]" (''[[Daily Prophet]]'', [[4 June]] [[2014]]).|Pottermore}} 
'''Tony Silva''' was a [[Brazil]]ian [[wizardkind|wizard]] and the [[Seeker]] for the [[2014]] [[Brazilian National Quidditch team]].

On the first match of the quarter-finals, Brazil versus [[Welsh National Quidditch team|Wales]], on [[4 June]], [[2014]], Silva performed a spectacular dive in the 131st minute and caught the [[Golden Snitch|Snitch]] from under rival [[Seeker]] [[Eurig Cadwallader]]'s nose.<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[BRAZIL VERSUS WALES|BRAZIL_VERSUS_WALES]] (Archived)</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Given that "Tony" is a possible diminutive of the Brazilian Portuguese name "Antônio",<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/tony "Tony"] at [http://www.behindthename.com/ Behind the Name]</ref> this might be Tony Silva's actual name.

'''Mylor Silvanus''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]].<ref name="JKR"/>

==Behind the scenes==
Mylor Silvanus was one of two names which [[J. K. Rowling]] considered giving to the [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] [[professor]] in [[Harry Potter]]'s [[fifth year]] at the time she was still planning {{POA}}.<ref name="JKR">"[http://www.hp-lexicon.org/about/sources/jkr.com/jkr-com-trans-jottings1.html More idle jottings (Page 1)]" on the Harry Potter Lexicon</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{Comment|Early drafts (planned only)}}
*{{JKRS}} {{Mention}}

==Etymology==
According to legend, {{w|Melor|Saint Melor}} (called ''Mylor'' in Cornish) was a prince of Brittany whose uncle Rivod murdered his father to seize the throne and first maimed Melor, cutting off his right hand and left foot, but when Melor's prosthetic limbs began working like natural ones, Rivod sent an assassin to kill him. Veneration of Melor spread from Brittany to Cornwall where he has several churches dedicated to him.

Silvanus was derived from the Latin ''silva'', "forest", and was the name of the {{w|Silvanus (mythology)|Roman god of woods}}.<ref>"[http://www.behindthename.com/name/silvanus Silvanus]" on Behind the Name</ref> It was later used as the given name of [[Silvanus Kettleburn]], professor of [[Care of Magical Creatures]].

{{Quote|I could do with an extra day's holiday around August.|Harold Skively in his letter to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''|Daily Prophet Newsletters}}

'''Harold Skively''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who wrote a letter to the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' suggesting that the [[wizarding world]] should celebrate a day to honour [[Merlin]], since he would like an extra day of holiday<ref>[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[31 July]], [[1998]], Page 3</ref>.

==Etymology==
*The name "Harold" comes from the Old English name Hereweald meaning "leader of the army", derived from the elements here "army" and weald "leader, ruler". The Old Norse cognate Haraldr was also common among Scandinavian settlers in England.
*'To skive' is an English verb that means 'to avoid one's assigned work or duty', or 'to slack off'.

==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]''

}}'''Wilbert Slinkhard''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who authored the book ''[[Defensive Magical Theory]]'', which was approved by the [[British Ministry of Magic]] as a suitable textbook for [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] classes.<ref>{{OOTP|B|9}}</ref> Due to the peaceful approaches to confrontation Slinkhard advocated, [[Dolores Umbridge]] found his work useful in her classes during the [[1995-1996 school year]] due to the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry's]] paranoid view that the students were being trained in combat.<ref>{{OOTP|B|12}}</ref>

==Personality and traits==
If the contents of his masterwork are any indication of his personality or views on the subject, Slinkhard was a pacifist, advocating a passive approach to confrontation and discouraging the use of combative spells for even defensive purposes. He deemed "[[counter-jinx]]" an inappropriate term to use for the spells, stating that such was only to make them seem more acceptable. However, Slinkhard appeared to have had very little knowledge on how to adequately defend oneself, and his book was of very little education value to students studying [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]], as it failed to teach in any way how to [[Duelling|duel]] or how to defend oneself against the [[Dark Arts]] or [[Dark Wizard]]s.

==Etymology==
The name "Wilbert" means "bright will", derived from the Germanic elements wil "will, desire" and beraht "bright".

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st mention}}

{{Quote|Yet more controversy in Patagonia: the outcome of the USA versus Jamaica clash is under investigation due to the sudden collapse of Kquewanda Bailey, the Jamaican Keeper, who toppled from her broom shortly before US Chaser Quentin Kowalski scored their ninth goal.|[[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]], "[[USA VERSUS JAMAICA]]" (''[[Daily Prophet]]'', [[16 May]] [[2014]])|Pottermore}}
'''Darius Smackhammer''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[Seeker]] for the [[2014]] [[American National Quidditch team]]. During the fourth match of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup|427th Quidditch World Cup]], US versus [[Jamaican National Quidditch team|Jamaica]], Smackhammer beat Jamaican Seeker [[Shanice Higgins]] to the [[Golden Snitch|Snitch]],<ref name="usa-v-jam">{{PM}} - [[USA VERSUS JAMAICA (I)]] (Archived)</ref> resulting in a narrow victory for the United States.<ref name="usa-v-jam2">{{PM}} - [[USA VERSUS JAMAICA (II)]] (Archived)</ref>

==Biography==
During the USA-[[Brazil]] match running on [[5 July]] (continued from [[4 July|the previous day]]), Smackhammer was assaulted by dual [[Bludger]]s sent by [[Carlos Clodoaldo|Clodoaldo]] and [[Rafael Santos|Santos]], preventing him from immediately reaching the [[Golden Snitch|Snitch]]. He and [[Tony Silva]] subsequently dove simultaneously for the Snitch, both sliding to the handles of their brooms diving at breakneck speed towards the earth and thus to the Snitch. At first it was almost impossible to determine who had really caught the Snitch, but after less than a minute it was apparent that Silva had narrowly beaten Smackhammer to it, resulting in USA being dropped out of the finals.

'''Hippocrates Smethwyck''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] and [[Healer]] at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]]. He was the healer-in-charge of the 'Dangerous' Dai Llewellyn Ward.<ref name="OOTP22">{{OOTP|B|22}}</ref>

==Biography==
After the [[British Ministry of Magic]] employee [[Arthur Weasley]], was attacked when guarding the [[Department of Mysteries]] by [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort's]] pet [[snake]] [[Nagini]] in the [[18 December]] [[1995]], he was immediately sent to [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]] for his injuries to be treated. At some point during his stay, in either late [[1995]] or early [[1996]], he successfully found the [[antidote]] for the highly [[poison]]ous [[Nagini's venom|venom]] which her fangs had infected him with, which healed Arthur Weasley's wounds, fully curing him and allowing him to return home.<ref name="OOTP22">{{OOTP|B|22}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Healing magic]]''': As a professional [[Healer]] employed at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]], Smethwyck was highly accomplished in the art of medical [[magic]], meaning he would have been able to heal his patients with [[healing spell]]s, healing [[potion]]s and other magical remedies. His impressive knowledge of and skill with [[antidote]]s for various [[poison]]s allowed him to find the correct antidote for Arthur Weasley, saving his life from [[Nagini's venom|highly potent snake venom]]. Furthermore, in order to train as a Healer, he would have had [[Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test|N.E.W.T.s]] in [[Potions (class)|Potions]], [[Herbology]], [[Charms (class)|Charms]], [[Transfiguration (class)|Transfiguration]] and [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]], all at least "[[Exceeds Expectations]]" or "[[Outstanding]]" level.<ref name="OOTP29">{{OOTP|B|29}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Hippocrates" is the Latinized form of the Greek name ‘Ιπποκρατης (Hippokrates) which meant "horse power", derived from the elements ‘ιππος (hippos) "horse" and κρατος (kratos) "power". This was the name of a 5th-century BC Greek doctor who is known as the Father of Medicine.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}}

'''Andy Smudgley''' was a reporter who worked for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''.

In [[1991]], he wrote an article covering a [[Break-in of Gringotts Wizarding Bank (1991)|break-in]] at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank]],<ref name="image"/> which was titled "[[GRINGOTTS BREAK-IN LATEST]]".<ref name="PS8">{{PS|B|8}}</ref>

The [[1992|following year]], he wrote an article covering a major breach of the [[International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy]], which occurred when [[Harry Potter]] and [[Ronald Weasley]] flew a [[Flying Ford Anglia]] to [[Hogwarts Castle]].<ref name="cosanglia">{{COS|F}} {{see image|File:Flying Ford Anglia Mystifies Muggles.png}}</ref>

In [[1993]], he wrote an article titled "'It's Sirius!' say the Ministry of Magic," which concerned the escape of [[Sirius Black]] from [[Azkaban]].<ref name"poasirius">{{POA|F}} {{see image|File:EscapeFromAzkabanProphetLarge.jpg}}</ref>

{{Dialogue a-b|Lily Evans|Doesn’t your dad like magic?|Severus Snape|He doesn’t like anything, much.|[[Severus Snape|Severus]] discusses his father with [[Lily J. Potter|Lily Evans]].|Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows}}

'''Tobias Snape''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]<ref name="blood"/> and the patriarch of the [[Snape family]] in the late twentieth century.<ref name="DH33" /> He was the husband of the [[Wizardkind|witch]] [[Eileen Prince|Eileen Snape]] (nèe [[Prince family|Prince]]) and the father of [[Severus Snape]]<ref name="DH33" />.

==Biography==
===Early life===
Tobias was born sometime in the early [[20th century|twentieth century]], into the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[Snape family]].<ref name="HP30" />

===Marriage===
He married the [[pure-blood]] [[Wizardkind|witch]] [[Eileen Prince]]<ref name="HP30" />. He abused her mentally and emotionally, as [[Harry Potter]] saw in Severus Snape's memories during an Occlumency lesson.<ref name="OP26" /> It could be surmised that he was physically abusive as well. Why they began a relationship and got married is currently unknown. Eileen may not have told him about the wizard world before their wedding.

It is possible that the marriage caused Eileen to be disowned by the Prince family, similar to [[Andromeda Tonks|Andromeda Tonks née Black]], who was disowned by her parents and sisters after she married [[Ted Tonks|a Muggle-born man]], and [[Merope Riddle|Merope Riddle née Gaunt]], who was disowned by her [[Marvolo Gaunt|father]] and [[ Morfin Gaunt|brother]] after she mentally enslaved [[Tom Riddle Senior|a Muggle squire]] into marrying her.

The couple lived at [[Spinner's End]], a working-class neighbourhood in [[Cokeworth]], [[England]].<ref name="DH33" />

[[File:Young_Snape_DH2.jpg|thumb|left|Tobias' son, Severus]]

On [[9 January]], [[1960]], Eileen gave birth to their son.<ref name="DH33" /> [[Severus Snape|Severus]] noted during a conversation with his friend, [[Lily J. Potter|Lily Evans]], that his parents fought often.<ref name="DH33" /> They apparently neglected him during his childhood, or were poor, or both. His clothes were mismatched and did not fit properly. When he began his first year of school at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]], he changed into his uniform quickly after getting onto the [[Hogwarts Express]], apparently glad to be rid of his Muggle clothes.

By [[September]] [[1981]], when Severus became the [[Potions (class)|Potions master]] and a [[Head of House]] at the school, Tobias and Eileen no longer resided in the house. As Severus was only twenty-one years old, it is likely that they were still alive but moved away, either together or separately.

==Personality and traits==
According to young Severus, Tobias was not fond of very much of anything, including magic.<ref name="DH33" /> Even so, his son was a talented young wizard before even receiving [[Hogwarts acceptance letter|the Hogwarts letter]]. In 1995, [[Sirius Black]] mentioned that Severus knew more [[curses]] when he arrived at school than many of the seventh-year students did. Tobias might not have tried to ban magic from the home, or Eileen and Severus might have used it whenever he was not around.

==Relationships==
===Family===
Tobias had a very poor relationship with both his wife and his son. When Severus was younger, Tobias frequently shouted at Eileen, and possibly hit her, whilst their son crouched in a corner, crying.<ref name="OP26" /> The unhappy memories of the Snape home would haunt Severus into adulthood.

==Etymology==
''[[Wikipedia:Tobias|Tobias]]'' is the Greek form of the Hebrew name ''Tobiah'' from the biblical books of ''Ezra'' and ''Nehemiah'', meaning "God is good" - which is a big irony, given Tobias's nasty demeanour towards everything in life. In the apocryphal Book of Tobit in the Old Testament, Tobias is assisted by the archangel in driving a demon away from Sarah, who subsequently became his wife.<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/tobias Behind the Name: Tobias]</ref>

[[J. K. Rowling]] has stated that "Snape" is the name of a place in [[England]]<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2000/fall00-etoys.html 2000 eToys Interview - AccioQuote!]</ref>. It also is an English verb meaning "''to be hard upon, rebuke or snub''", derived from the Old Norse "''sneypa''", meaning "''to outrage, dishonour, disgrace''".<ref>[http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/snape "Snape" at Dictionary.com]</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*His treatment towards his son and wife caused the former to despise Muggles in general, given his contempt towards Petunia. He also may not have had stable employment.

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st}} {{Flashback}}

{{Quote|Pity Fijian Seeker Joseph Snuka as he tries to justify his side's bruising 400 - 160 defeat at the hands of tournament favourites Nigeria.|[[Ginevra Weasley|Ginny Potter]]<nowiki>, "Nigeria Versus Fiji" (</nowiki>''[[Daily Prophet]]'', [[14 May]] [[2014]])|Pottermore}} 
'''Joseph Snuka''' was a [[Fiji]]an [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who played as the [[Seeker]] for the [[2014]] [[Fijian National Quidditch team]].

==Biography==
During the second match of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup|427th Quidditch World Cup]], against [[Nigerian National Quidditch team|Nigeria]], Snuka chose to capture the Snitch in the 141st minute, when his team was losing 400 to 10, much to the bewilderment of the commentators, the fury of the Fijian supporters and the jeers of the Nigerians.<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[NIGERIA VERSUS FIJI]] (Archived)</ref>

Snuka had previously been dubbed an egoist by teammates, and his reputation was only tarnished further with his actions during the match. After the match, Fijian manager and trainer [[Hector Bolobolo]]'s only comment was "''I'm going to kill him''".<ref name="PM"/>

==Personality and traits==
Snuka was, according to his teammates, an egoist, and was therefore likely very vain, confident and self-centred.<ref name="PM"/>

==Etymology==
"Joseph" comes from the [[Latin]] "''Ioseph''", which translates, through a variety of translations, to the Hebrew name "''Yosef''", meaning "''he will add". ''Joseph was a common biblical name in both Christian and Jewish societies.<ref name="BtN">[http://www.behindthename.com/name/joseph "Joseph" at BehindtheName.com]</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{Mention}}

'''Minister Leonard Spencer-Moon''' was [[Minister for Magic]] from [[1939]] to [[1948]]. He was elected at least twice.

Spencer-Moon began his career at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] as a tea-boy in the [[Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes]], and rose through the ranks from there. He became Minister for Magic following his predecessor, [[Hector Fawley]]'s, political downfall for not taking [[Gellert Grindelwald]]'s [[Global wizarding war|"For the Greater Good" revolution]] seriously. He proved himself a sound Minister, overseeing a period of great international turmoil in both the wizarding ([[global wizarding war]]) and the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] world ([[Second World War]]). He was also known to have maintained a good working relationship with [[Winston Churchill]], the [[Prime Minister (title)|Muggle Prime Minister]].<ref>{{WW|ministers-for-magic}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Coincidentally or not, "Leonard" was [[Wikipedia:Winston Churchill|Winston Churchill]]'s middle name. Also, Churchill was born into the family of the Dukes of Marlborough, a branch of the Spencer family (Churchill's full surname was, indeed, "Spencer-Churchill").
*Moon may be related to the [[Lily Moon]] sorted before Harry in {{PS}}.

==Appearances==

*{{WW}} {{Mention}}

'''Oraclitus Spheer''' was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He had a [[Portrait]] of himself hung in the [[Gryffindor Tower reading room]], hiding [[Fred Weasley|Fred]] and [[George Weasley]]'s convenience shop. His password was "''Flibbertigibbet''".<ref>{{COS|G}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*Spheer may have passed away sometime prior to [[1992]], as many portraits hung at [[Hogwarts Castle]] depict deceased individuals.
*In {{POA}}, [[Cadogan|Sir Cadogan]] uses ''Flibbertigibbet'' as the password to [[Gryffindor Tower]].

'''Rudolph Spielman''' (fl. [[1920s]]) was a [[Germany|German]]<ref>''[[Lights, Camera, Magic!: The Making of Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald]]'' - ([https://images-na.ssl-images-amazon.com/images/I/810Eau-4J0L.jpg See this image])</ref> [[wizardkind|wizard]] who worked as the [[Head of Incarceration]] at the [[International Confederation of Wizards]]. He participated in [[Gellert Grindelwald's extradition]] from [[Magical Congress of the United States of America|MACUSA]] to [[Europe]] to answer for his crimes, and was the only survivor of Grindelwald's escape.<ref name="COGS3">{{COG|S|3}}</ref>

==Biography==
As Head of Incarceration in [[1927]], Spielman was in charge of overseeing the transfer of Grindelwald to Europe. Prior to boarding the Incarceration Carriage that contained the prisoner and two Aurors, Spielman spoke with MACUSA President Seraphina Picquery, who warned him not to underestimate Grindelwald. He told the President that the wizarding community owed her a great debt for capturing the Dark Wizard before being approached by Abernathy, a MACUSA employee, who presented Spielman with a case that apparently contained Grindelwald's recently discovered wand and also a strange jewelled vial on a chain.<ref name="COGS3"/>

As the carriage set off for the journey to Europe, Spielman examined the vial with interest before noting that Grindelwald no longer had his "silver tongue", MACUSA having cut it out to prevent him from coaxing his guards to side with him. To Spielman's shock and horror, however, "Grindelwald" was subsequently revealed to be a disguised Abernathy, who had swapped places with the real Grindelwald who was at that moment attacking the carriage. Spielman's white-handled wand, as well as those of the two Aurors with him, suddenly pointed themselves at their owner's necks before disintegrating, after which Spielman caught sight of Grindelwald's face peering in. Panicking, Spielman opened the case he held, only to find an infant chupacabra within that proceeded to maul the German wizard's neck, all whilst Abernathy retrieved the vial even as Spielman and the Aurors fought to restrain him.<ref name="COGS3"/>

Eventually, however, Spielman was left as the sole survivor on the carriage as Grindelwald dispatched the remaining Aurors. Taking Spielman by the throat, Grindelwald held him out of the open door of the carriage before letting him go, sending the older wizard plummeting hundreds of feet. Seeing Abernathy's wand, which Grindelwald had dropped after him, Spielman was able to grab it and cast a Slowing Charm mere seconds before he impacted the water. Soaking wet and traumatised, but alive, Spielman could only watch as Grindelwald escaped to wreak havoc once more.<ref name="COGS3"/>

Some time afterwards, Spielman was present at the British Ministry of Magic as part of a committee to discuss the revocation of Newt Scamander's travel ban. He and Torquil Travers were later part of a group that travelled to Hogwarts after Grindelwald's rally in Paris in order to speak with Albus Dumbledore.<ref name="COGS3"/>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Magic]]al mastery''': As [[Head of Incarceration]] for the [[International Confederation of Wizards]], Spielman was a highly capable wizard who was entrusted with overseeing the transfer of [[Gellert Grindelwald]]. Though Spielman was unable to put up any magical resistance as his wand was destroyed, he was able to swiftly cast a [[Slowing Charm]] to save his life without any apparent difficulty whilst using the wand of an enemy wizard, an impressive feat as he presumably had not earned that wand's allegiance.
*'''[[Charm]]s''': Spielman was proficient with charms, with him being able to swiftly cast a successful [[Slowing Charm]] mid-fall as soon as he got a hold of a [[Abernathy's wand|falling wand]], doing so effectively enough to survive an extremely high fall without injury.
*'''[[Non-verbal spell|Nonverbal magic]]''': Spielman was skilful with casting nonverbal spells, notably silently casting a Slowing Charm.
*'''[[Apparition]]''': Being an accomplished adult wizard, Spielman was fully capable of Apparating at will.

==Etymology==
*Spielman is a German occupational surname meaning "minstrel". The name is composed of the words ''Spiel'' "play" and ''Mann'' "man". It originally referred to entertainers and later to medieval travelling musicians.

==Behind the scenes==
*Spielman is played by [[Wolf Roth]] in the [[Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald|second instalment]] of the ''[[Fantastic Beasts (film series)|Fantastic Beasts]]'' film series.<ref name="pm">"[https://www.pottermore.com/news/next-fantastic-beasts-film-reveals-new-characters-including-nicolas-flamel Next Fantastic Beasts film reveals new characters – including Nicolas Flamel]" on {{PM}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{COG|S}} {{1st}}
*{{COG}}

'''Professor Helbert Spleen''' was a [[Healer]] who worked at [[St Mungo's Hospital for Magical Maladies and Injuries]]. He doubled as an advice columnist for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'', answering only the questions which related to health, while [[Grizel Hurtz]], [[Zamira Gulch]], and [[Dempster Wiggleswade]] handled other topics.<ref name="DP">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]: [[1 June]], [[1999]], Problem Page</ref>

==Biography==
In one issue, Spleen replied to a letter from [[Howland Coopey]], diagnosing him with [[Dragon Pox]] based on the symptoms he described.<ref name="DP" />

During the [[Calamity]], a [[Calamity Investigator]] had a meal with Spleen, who showed them several ways to modify the harvesting, handling and incorporation of [[Dittany]].<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Healing magic]]''': Spleen was a professional Healer, meaning he was very accomplished with medical [[magic]], such as with [[healing spell]]s, [[potion]]s and other magical remedies.<ref name="DP"/>
*'''[[Herbology]]''': Spleen was also skilled with handling and using magical medicinal plants, such as [[Dittany]], to which he showed a [[Calamity Investigator]] how to best harvest, handle and utilise the said plant.<ref name="WU"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*The ''Daily Prophet'' referred to Spleen by the title "Professor." This may indicate that he once taught at a wizarding school. This can be, however, just an academic title.<ref name="DP" />

==Appearances==
*''[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]]'' {{1st Mention}}
*{{WU}} {{Mention}}

'''Stebbins''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard]] that worked for the [[British Ministry of Magic]] as an [[Auror]].

==Biography==
In [[1927]], he was tasked with the job of spying on [[Newton Scamander]], but was thwarted when Newt cast the [[Ventus Jinx]] creating a forceful wind that delayed him long enough for Newt to [[Apparition|disapparate]]. Stebbins accompanied [[Torquil Travers]] to [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]] with the group of [[Auror]]s trying to force [[Albus Dumbledore]] to fight [[Gellert Grindelwald]].<ref name="COGS">{{COG|S}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*He is played by [[Bart Soroczynski]] in {{COG}}.<ref>http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7702949/</ref>
*It is possible that he is related to [[Stebbins (Marauder-era)|Stebbins]] from the [[1970s]] and [[Stebbins (Potter-era)|Stebbins]] from the [[1990s]].

==Appearances==
*{{COG|S}} {{1st}}

As for the speed with which he fled from danger.|[[Miranda Goshawk]], "[[The Miserable Ode of Quivering Quintus]]".|Wonderbook: Book of Spells}} '''Quintus Harcourt Ballyfumble Stranger''' was the primary character of [[Miranda Goshawk]]'s poem "[[The Miserable Ode of Quivering Quintus]]". As with all of the characters in these poems, he was based of a real wizard, with his name changed to protect his identity. Quintus was noted for his most unusual name, but perhaps more for his cowardice, and for the speed with which he fled from any danger.{{WBS}} According to Goshawk's "Afterword", the traits Morgan lacked were bravery and daring. ==Biography== The wizard Quintus Stranger was based off of was cowardly and timid, and people knew him for vanishing instantly with any bang, flash, or grunt. Soon he became a joke among his peers, and [[Quintus Stranger's father|his father]] told him that such nervousness could be overcome with perseverance, despite being scared was a natural thing and a feature of every man. Quintus reiterated that he was proud to flee at every danger, for it was wiser to save his own's neck than to give up his safety. It was for this reason that Quintus only used [[Quintus Stranger's wand|his wand]] to shield himself from harm and, eventually, the wand lost its power ([[Miranda Goshawk]] went on to speculate that "''[[Wilting|it died of shame]]''") leaving him wandless. ==Appearances== *{{WBS}} {{1st}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Stranger, Quintus}} [[pl:Quintus Stranger]] [[Category:Males]] [[Category:Wizards]]"}]}}}}

'''Theo Strongarm''' was a [[Great Britain|British]] wizard and a member of the [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]].<ref name="WU"/>

==Biography==
At some point during the [[2010s]], Strongarm joined the Statue of Secrecy Task Force. As part of the task force, he developed a vigorous stirring method that increased the effectiveness of the [[Tonic for Trace Detection]]. This tactic was soon adopted by other members of the task force in order to improve their own potions.<ref name="WU">{{WU}}</ref>

{{Quote|Ora et Labora.|Professor Swott's motto, inscribed on his portrait|Harry Potter|Harry Potter Limited Edition}}
'''Professor Amrose Swott'''<ref name="HPLE"/> was a [[Wizardkind|wizard]]. He was once a [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="cosdvd">{{COS|F}} DVD (Disc 2 - ''Dumbledore's Office'') (see [[:File:Amberose.jpg|this image]])</ref>

==Biography==
[[File:AmberoseSwott.jpg|200px|thumb|left|Amrose Swott as a younger man]]
===Lifetime===
Professor Swott lived in the early [[18th century]].<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|PA}}</ref> He became the [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] at some point.

===Post-mortem===
Professor Swott died sometime in or prior to [[1992]].<ref name="DOD" /> Two [[portrait]]s of him hung at Hogwarts: one depicted a [[Glasses|bespectacled]] young man,<ref>See [[:File:AmberoseSwott.jpg|this image]].</ref> and another, painted in [[1724]]<ref name="HPLE" /> and hung in the [[Headmaster's office]], depicted an older wizard with a long ginger beard.<ref name="cosdvd" /> Swott's name was also carved into a wood panel on the wall of the school's [[Divination]] [[Divination Classroom|classroom]].<ref name="poapanel">{{POA|F}} - see [[:File:Amberose Swott.jpg|this image]]</ref>

In the winter of [[1993]], Swott's name appeared on the [[Marauder's Map]],<ref>{{POA|F}} - Chapter 16</ref> presumably indicating that he lingered at Hogwarts as a [[ghost]] after his [[death]]<ref>In {{HBP}}, Chapter 24, Harry notices on the Marauder's Map that [[Draco Malfoy]] is in a boys' bathroom with [[Myrtle Warren]], thereby confirming that the Map shows ghosts.</ref> or that there is a student named after him.

==Etymology==
"Ambrose" is a name, which ultimately derives from the Greek name ''Ambrosios'', meaning "immortal".<ref>"[http://www.behindthename.com/name/ambrose Ambrose]" on Behind the Name</ref> Swott may have been based on ''swot'', a British slang term, meaning "to study hard" or "one who studies hard."<ref>"[http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/swot Swot]" on Wiktionary</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*It is possible that Swott's portrait is a reference to [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/d/de/JKepler.png a portrait] of [[wikipedia:Johannes Kepler|Johannes Kepler]], a German mathematician, astronomer and astrologer.
*The portrait depicting a younger Swott seems to have been based on a [http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/9/9e/Godfrey_Kneller_Selfportrait.jpg 1685 self-portrait] of [[Wikipedia:Godfrey Kneller|Sir Godfrey Kneller (1646-1723)]].
*The motto inscribed on Swott's portrait, "''Ora et Labora''" (meaning "Pray and Work") was the motto of the Benedictine monks.

'''Tenebrus''' was a [[Thestral]] who lived in the [[Forbidden Forest]]. Part of the [[Hogwarts Thestral herd|Hogwarts Thestral Herd]], he was the first Thestral to have been born in the Forest, presumably to the male and one of the five females initially acquired.

==Biography==
He was the personal favourite of [[Keeper of Keys and Grounds|gamekeeper]] [[Rubeus Hagrid]]. In [[1995]], when Hagrid introduced his [[Fifth year]] [[Care of Magical Creatures]] students to Thestrals, Tenebrus was the first to appear after he called for the herd.<ref name="OOTP21">{{OOTP|B|21}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name Tenebrus is presumably derived from the English adjective ''tenebrous'', which means "dark," "gloomy," or "obscure".<ref>"[http://dictionary.reference.com/browse/tenebrous Tenebrous]" on Dictionary.com</ref> This word is itself derived from the Latin ''tenebrae'', meaning "darkness".<ref>"[http://www.etymonline.com/index.php?search=tenebrous&searchmode=none Tenebrous]" on The Online Etymology Dictionary</ref>
