'''Georgios Xenakis''' was a Greek wizard and a [[Quidditch]] [[Quidditch referee|referee]]. He officiated in the [[Bulgarian National Quidditch Stadium|Bulgaria]] versus [[New Zealand National Quidditch team|New Zealand]] first round encounter at the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup]] in [[Argentina]].<ref name="PM">{{PM}} - [[BULGARIA VERSUS NEW ZEALAND]] (Archived)</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*If this individual's name is indication of anything, he is probably [[Greece|Greek]] or of Greek descent — the name "Georgios" is the Greek form of George.<ref>[http://www.behindthename.com/name/georgios "Georgios"] at [http://www.behindthename.com/ Behind the Name]</ref>
*The surname Xenakis is also Greek, from ''ξένος ['ksenos]'' ("stranger", "foreigner", but also "friend from far away"). Greek artist [[Wikipedia:Constantin Xenakis|Constantin Xenakis]] (born 1931), Greek composer and architect [[Wikipedia:Iannis Xenakis|Iannis Xenakis]] (1922–2001), and Greek gymnast [[Wikipedia:Thomas Xenakis|Thomas Xenakis]] (1875–1942) are some notable people who bore this surname.

{{Quote|Mayor David Yates described London as left "scared, confused and desperate for answers", pledging to uncover the reason for these attacks, find those responsible and prevent any possible repeat.|[[Jamie Wolpert (in-universe)|Jamie Wolpert]], "[[Millennium Bridge|Bridge disaster]] hits London" in ''[[The Guardian]]'' (July, [[1996]])|Harry Potter Limited Edition}}
'''David Yates''' was a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] British politician who, in the mid-[[1990s]], held the office of Mayor of the [[London|City of London]].

==Biography==
===Millennium Bridge disaster===
{{Quote|The police are continuing with the investigation into the cause of the [[Millennium Bridge]] disaster. River traffic has been halted as police search for survivors. The surrounding area remains closed. The Mayor has urged Londoners to remain calm...|A [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] radio broadcast|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)}}

After the collapse of the [[Millennium Bridge]] at the hands of [[Fenrir Greyback]] and a group of [[Death Eaters]], the Mayor urged [[London]]ers to remain calm, for this was a most unusual event.<ref>{{HBP|F}} - Chapter 1</ref> He also addressed ''[[The Guardian]]'', where he described Londoners as having been left "''scared, confused and desperate for answers''" and pledging to uncover the truth behind the disaster (widely speculated among [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]s to have been caused by a fundamentalist political group).<ref name="HPLE">{{HPLE|G}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*The existence of this individual constitutes an anachronism as the office was created by the [[Wikipedia:Greater London Authority Act 1999|Greater London Authority Act 1999]] and the first Mayor of London, [[Wikipedia:Ken Livingstone|Ken Livingstone]], was elected in [[2000]].
*The Mayor's name is an obvious reference to [[David Yates]], the man who directed the last four [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' films]], including ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince]]''.

*{{HPLE}} {{Mention}}

'''Lev Zograf''' was a [[Bulgaria]]n [[wizardkind|wizard]] and the [[Keeper]] for the [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team]].<ref name="GOF8"/>

==Biography==
He played during the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup]]. He played in the final, in which he gave away a penalty for [[cobbing]] [[Irish National Quidditch team|Ireland]]'s [[Chaser]], [[Mullet]] and ended up conceding a total of seventeen goals.<ref name="GOF8">{{GOF|B|8}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character is known only by his surname in the [[Harry Potter (book series)|books]]. His first name is given as "Lev" on a [[Chocolate Frog Card|Famous Wizard Card]] in the [[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (video game)|video game adaptation]] of {{HBP}}.

==Etymology==
The name "Lev" is an antiquated word for "lion" in Bulgarian, now only retained as the name of Bulgaria's main currency unit. It also means "lion" in Russian, functioning as a vernacular form of Leo. This was the real Russian name of both author Leo Tolstoy (1828-1910) and revolutionary Leon Trotsky (1879-1940). In Hebrew the name means "heart".

Lev Yashin (1929 - 1990) is a Russian goalkeeper widely believed to have been the best goalkeeper in the history of football. The Lev Yashin Award is awarded to the best goalkeeper in each World Cup.

A zograf is a person who paints churches (from Greek "zografos"). Several Bulgarians in this walk of life were given this nickname-turned-surname in recognition to their work.

'''Sinistra''' was a [[wizardkind|wizard or witch]].<ref name="JKRS">"[[:File:Early draft workingsJKR.png|''Early draft workings'']]" from {{JKRS}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The name "Sinistra" is the name of a [[Wikipedia:Sinistra|star]] in the constellation [[Wikipedia:Ophiuchus|Ophiuchus]], which probably means that the family, like the [[House of Black]], named their children after those of stars and constellations.

==Behind the scenes==
*Professor Sinistra was apparently considered for the role of [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] [[professor]], as the name was written next to those of [[Enid Pettigrew]] and [[Oakden Hernshaw]]. However, the name was not written with a year next to it, implying that the name may have just been considered.

This '''individual''' worked as secretary to the [[Minister for Magic]], [[Faris Spavin]], in the late [[19th century]].<ref name="PMleakycauldron"/>

==Biography==
In the late 19th century, the Muggle government made plans to flatten the [[Leaky Cauldron]], with the creation of [[Charing Cross Road]]. Faris Spavin made a melancholy seven-hour speech before the [[Wizengamot]] explaining why the Leaky Cauldron could not be saved. During the course of his tedious speech, however, the wizarding community rallied and performed a mass of [[Memory Charm]]s (some say, although it has never been conclusively proven, that the [[Imperius Curse]] was additionally used on several Muggle town planners), so that the Leaky Cauldron was now accommodated in the revised plans for the new road. As soon as Spavin sat down after concluding his seven-hour speech, his secretary presented him with a note describing the developments that had just invalidated his words.<ref name="PMleakycauldron">{{WW|the-leaky-cauldron}}</ref>

==Appearances==

This '''individual''' served as the Head of Magical Cooperation in the [[Transylvania]]n wizarding government.

==History==
[[Percy Weasley]], during the course of his duties as personal assistant to [[Bartemius Crouch Senior|Bartemius Crouch Snr]], Head of the British [[Department of International Magical Cooperation]], had a meeting scheduled with this individual in early [[1995]] to persuade him to sign the [[International Ban on Duelling]].<ref name="GF23">{{GOF|B|23}}</ref>

'''Tufty''' was one of [[Arabella Figg|Mrs Figg's]] part-[[Kneazle]] cats. The other three were [[Mr Tibbles]], [[Snowy]] and [[Mr Paws]]. [[Harry Potter]] saw it (or possibly its picture) when he went to stay with Mrs Figg when [[Dudley Dursley|Dudley]] got to go to places on his birthday. Harry found a hard time being remorseful when Mrs Figg broke her leg after reminding himself that it would be a while before he had to see Mr Tibbles, Snowy, Tufty and Mr Paws again.<ref>{{PS|B|2}}</ref>

This '''individual''' was a witch or [[Wizardkind|wizard]] who became the [[professor]] of [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], for the [[1986–1987 school year]]. 

They were considered far from an improvement of the [[Unidentified 1985-1986 Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher|previous year's professor]], which made [[Tulip Karasu]] wonder whether they would ever learn the [[Boggart-Banishing Spell]] if they continued to teach the subject.<ref>{{HM|3|7}}</ref>

The professor would probably never have continued to teach the subject for the next school year, because of [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s [[Jinx on the post of Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher|jinx]] which ensured the teacher of the subject would have needed to be replaced by the end of the year.

According to [[Jacob's sibling]], this teacher was the worst out of their first five teachers.<ref>{{HM|5}} - normal [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] class</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{HM}} {{1st Mention}}

Many, among them the famous [[Curse-Breaker]], [[Patricia Rakepick]], considered this individual to be an inept teacher.<ref>{{HM|4|4}}</ref>

This '''individual ''' was a [[Wizardkind|witch or wizard]] who became the [[professor]] of [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]] at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], for the [[1989–1990 school year]].

==Biography==
Many considered this teacher to be useless. [[Charles Weasley]] talked about this to his older brother [[William Weasley]], who had graduated Hogwarts the [[1988–1989 school year|previous year]] and had now been working at [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank|Gringotts]] as [[Curse-Breaker]]. As such, Bill had asked [[Albus Dumbledore]] permission to use [[Classroom 3C]] for tutoring students after daily classes were done.<ref name="HM65">{{HM|6|5}}</ref>

By the end of the year, this professor needed to be replaced because of [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]]'s [[Jinx on the post of Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher|jinx]] on the post.

These unidentified '''[[Auror]]s''' were employed by the [[Auror Office]] of the [[British Ministry of Magic]].<ref name="HBP7"/>

==Biography==
They were both waiting at [[King's Cross Station]] on [[1 September]], [[1996]] as a security escort for [[Harry Potter]]. Both were described as grim-faced and dressed as [[Non-magic people|Muggles]] in dark suits. Upon the arrival of Harry and the [[Weasley family|Weasleys]], the Aurors quickly escorted them into the station without speaking, although Harry found his escort's over-protectiveness somewhat irritating.<ref name="HBP7">{{HBP|B|7}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
It is possible that one of them was [[Gawain Robards]].

==Appearances==
*{{HBP}} {{1st}}

This was a [[Hippogriff]] with a chestnut brown coat and a member of the [[Hogwarts Hippogriff herd]].

In [[1993]], [[Hermione Granger]] and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]] approached it during a [[Care of Magical Creatures]] lesson, watched by [[Harry Potter]].<ref>{{POA|B|6}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==

*He/she may be [[Stormswift]], [[Fleetwing]] or [[Hothoof]].
*This may have been the the Hippogriff newly acquired by [[Professor]] [[Silvanus Kettleburn]] in the "[[Magic]]al [[Creature]]s everywhere" quest in {{HM}}.<ref>{{HM}}</ref>

This unidentified [[magic]]al '''[[creature]]''' was owned by [[Rubeus Hagrid]] and lived in his [[Rubeus Hagrid's cabin|hut]]. It was a plant-like creature with an appearance similar to the [[Mandrake]] plant.<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

==History==
It was implied to be an illegal creature, when Hagrid hid it under a tea towel when the [[Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures]], including [[Albus Dumbledore]], [[Cornelius Fudge]] and [[Walden Macnair]] the Executioner, arrived for the disposal of [[Buckbeak]] the [[Hippogriff]] some days after Hagrid's hearing with the [[Hogwarts Board of Governors]].<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

This '''[[crow]]''' sat on the top of a wooden marker, holding [[Buckbeak]] the [[Hippogriff]]. The crow appeared to be a kind of guard, biting [[Harry Potter]] when he tried to free Buckbeak. The crow then flew away when the [[Walden Macnair|Executioner]] used his [[axe]] to cut a [[pumpkin]] from [[Rubeus Hagrid]]'s [[Rubeus Hagrid's pumpkin patch|patch]] in two.<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This crow was portrayed by [[Cheyenne]].

==Appearances==
*{{POA|F}} {{1st}}

{{Quote|It was a Goblin philosopher who said: 'Money is the root of all happiness'.|[[Gringotts Wizarding Bank|Gringotts]] goblin bank teller.|Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (video game)}}
A '''goblin philosopher''' once noted on the importance of [[wizarding currency|money]], considering it the source of all happiness.<ref>{{COS|G}} - GBC version</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This quote is a variant of [[Bible|1 Timothy 6:10]], which states: "For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows." The change of "evil" to "happiness" reflects goblin ideals over [[human]] ones.

{{Quote|I like to take a kip in the corridors when [[Pitts]] isn't watching|The House Elf talking to [[Jacob's sibling]]}}

This '''[[house-elf]]''' worked at [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] in the [[1980s]]. They worked in the [[Hogwarts kitchens|kitchens]] along with the other [[Hogwarts house-elves]]. They were regularly seen stealing naps, whilst leaning against a wall, in a corridor near the entrance to the kitchens, infuriating [[Pitts]], the House Elf tasked with overseeing their actions as well as those of the other elves. When woken by [[Jacob's sibling]], the house-elf panicked, and quickly ran off. While Pitts was aware that one of his elves was taking regular naps in the corridors, he had no idea which elf it was, allowing this elf to get off scot-free.

==Description==
The elf had long, pig-like ears and a pointy, beakish nose. They wore what appeared to be a potato sack emblazoned with a small Hogwarts crest.<ref>{{HM}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*In {{HM}}, waking up this house-elf earns the player one extra energy.

==Appearances==
*{{HM}} {{1st}}

'''C. Williamsum''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[Wizardkind|wizard or witch]] and reporter for ''[[The New York Ghost]]'' in the [[1920s]].<ref name="nyghost-dec6">{{WWMM|1}} {{see image|File:NewYorkGhost-6December1926.jpg}}</ref><ref name="nyghost-dec7">{{CB}} {{see image|File:The New York Ghost - 7 Dec 1926.png}}</ref>

==Biography==
Williamsum wrote an article about a "sinister" [[aura]] puzzling the [[wizardkind|wizarding]] community that was published in the [[6 December]] [[1926]] sunset issue of the paper.<ref name="nyghost-dec6" /> In the [[7 December]] sunset edition, they co-wrote a report with [[M. Carneirus (American)|M. Carneirus]] and [[R. Amorim (American)|R. Amorim]] about top [[Auror]]s being called to [[New York City Hall]] to investigate the death of [[Henry Shaw Junior]], which was published on the front page.<ref name="nyghost-dec7" />

==Appearances==
*{{FB|F}} {{comment|Name mentioned in newspaper}}

'''Erie Yenning'''<ref>{{WU}} ([https://us.v-cdn.net/6031576/uploads/3CZS7223VG6G/screen-shot-2020-07-20-at-4-09-52-pm.png See here])</ref>''' '''(fl. [[2003]]) was a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|wizard or witch]] who worked in the [[Misuse of Muggle Artefacts Office]] at the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]].<ref name="OTP7">{{WU}}</ref>

==Biography==

=== Early life ===
Born somewhere in the [[Great Britain|British Isles]], Erie Yenning was the scion of a family of unknown wizarding descent. Like most other magical children born in the wizarding community of Great Britain, they presumably attended [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] during their formative years,<ref>“Attendance is now compulsory for every young witch and wizard,” [Lupin] replied. “That was announced yesterday. It’s a change, because it was never obligatory before. Of course, nearly every witch and wizard in Britain has been educated at Hogwarts, but their parents had the right to teach them at home or send them abroad if they preferred.”- Remus Lupin, {{DH}}.</ref> and may have chosen to take [[Muggle Studies]], given their future occupation.

=== Working for the Ministry ===
Sometime after they turned seventeen, Erie joined the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] in [[London]] and became an [[Officer]] in the [[Department of Magical Law Enforcement]], in which capacity they worked for the [[Misuse of Muggle Artefacts Office]] along with others such as [[Myra Curio]]. While not as involved with the [[Statute of Secrecy Task Force]] as said colleague, Erie did become friendly with at least one of its members, whom they encountered at the Ministry during working hours. At some point, Yenning gifted this [[Calamity Investigator]] with a set of [[Dragon]]-fire tampered, [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]-made cauldrons that allowed for super-heated potion-making, which, while they normally would destroy most potions during the brewing process, proved to increase the effectiveness of the [[Potent Exstimulo Potion]].<ref name="OTP7" />

==Behind the scenes==
*As the name Erie is unisex, it is uncertain what the gender of this person is.

==Appearances==
*{{WU}} {{1st Mention}}

==Notes and references==

'''M. Carneirus''' was a reporter for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' who wrote a story about the [[Death Eaters|Death Eater]] attack at the [[1994 Quidditch World Cup|Quidditch World Cup]] in [[1994]].<ref>{{GOF|F}} (see [[:File:TerrorattheQuidditchWorldCup.jpg|this image]]).</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This character was presumably named after [[Mauricio Carneiro (real-world)|Mauricio Carneiro]], who worked as a costume illustrator for every [[Harry Potter films|''Harry Potter'' film]] from ''[[Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (film)|Goblet of Fire]]'' onward, and as a costumer for ''[[Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (film)|Order of the Phoenix]]'' and ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|Half-Blood Prince]]''.<ref>"[http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1769188/ Mauricio Carneiro]" on IMDb</ref>

This individual worked in the capacity of '''chief sports writer''' for the ''[[Daily Prophet]]'' in the [[1900s|early 20th century]]. In response to the wizarding world's crescent interest in [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] rugby due to the popularity of [[Squib]] player [[Angus Buchanan]], this individual wrote an article about [[cricket]] (which Buchanan was also adept at) — cricket did not have the appeal to wizards that rugby had, and he described it as a very inferior form of [[Quidditch]].<ref>{{WW|scottish-rugby}}</ref>

This '''witch''' was appointed [[Headmaster]] of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts]]. After her death, her [[portrait]] was hung in the [[Headmaster's office]], in order to give advice to the current head. Her portrait is commonly found left of the headmaster's desk, in the top row between [[Edessa Skandenberg|Edessa Sakndenberg]] and [[Everard]].

The '''Investigative Team''' was the name by which the special response team staffing the [[Major Investigation Department]] of the [[Magical Congress of the United States of America]] was collectively known. Comprised by the [[Director of Magical Security]] and some of the best, brightest and highest-level [[Auror]]s they have in their employ, the Investigative Team was called upon to put to rest national security issues and contain magical emergencies of such a magnitude that unless properly resolved, they could have catastrophic ramifications for not only the wizarding community of America, but all of wizardkind.<ref name="FB22">{{FB|S|22}}</ref><ref name="FB24">{{FB|S|24}}</ref>

==History==
In December [[1926]], an [[Obscurus]] ran on a rampage in the city of [[New York]], prompting President [[Seraphina Picquery]] to call for the involvement of the Major Investigation Department to contain the situation, fearing that if they failed, it would mean exposure and subsequently provoke war between the wizarding and No-Maj worlds.<ref>{{FB|S|201}}</ref>

==Appearances==
*{{FB|S}}
*{{FB|F}}

==Notes and references==

[[Category:Magical Congress of the United States of America employees]]"}]}}}}

column2: President of the Magical Congress of the United States of America
column4:

Quahog]] (c. [[2014]]) |style=President |member_of= |reports_to=[[International Confederation of Wizards]] |seat=[[Woolworth Building]], [[New York]], [[United States of America]] |nominator= |appointer= |appointer_qualified= |termlength= |termlength_qualified= |constituting_instrument= |precursor= |formation=[[1693]]{{PM}} - [https://www.pottermore.com/collection-episodic/history-of-magic-in-north-america-en Writing by J.K. Rowling: "History of Magic in North America: Seventeenth Century and Beyond"] |first=[[Josiah Jackson]] |last= |abolished= |deputy= }} The '''President of the Magical Congress of the United States of America''' was the leader of the [[wizarding world]] in the [[United States of America|United States]], and the highest ranking member of the [[Magical Congress of the United States of America]], which they presided over.{{PM}} - [[RETURN OF HANS THE AUGUREY]] (Archived) ==History== ===Early years=== The Magical Congress of the United States of America (and thus the Presidency) was formed in [[1693]] as a direct result of the [[Salem Witch Trials]] and the menace of the [[Scourers]], almost a century before the [[Non-magic people|No-Maj]] [[Continental Congress]] declared America independent from the [[United Kingdom]] in [[July]] [[1776]]. [[Josiah Jackson]] became the first President of MACUSA. Josiah was thought to be strong enough to deal with the troubles caused by the Salem Witch Trials. The first task of the [[North America]]n wizarding legislature was to put on trial the [[Scourers]], a unscrupulous and brutal band of wizarding bounty hunters and racketeers, executing those convicted of murder, wizard-trafficking, and torture. Josiah Jackson's main priority when he became President was to create and train [[Auror]]s. There were only a select few to start with, with only two of the them surviving to old age. They won the enduring respect of the magic community in North America, which was extended to their descendants. In [[1760]], MACUSA relocated to [[Williamsburg]], [[Virginia]], where its then-President [[Thornton Harkaway]] lived. Harkaway bred [[Crup]]s, which possessed a great aggression towards non-magical people. When the Crups attacked local No-Majs, it led to a great breach of the [[International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy|Statute of Secrecy]] and Harkaway had to step down due to disgrace. MACUSA then relocated to [[Baltimore]], where then-President [[Able Fleming]] lived. However, when the [[Revolutionary War]] began, which led to the arrival of the No-Maj Congress to the city, MACUSA decided to move to [[Washington]]. In [[1777]], then President [[Elizabeth McGilliguddy]] presided over the infamous [[Country or Kind? debate]]. It was an extraordinary meeting which led to the expansion of the [[Great Meeting Chamber]]. They discussed whether to support their community or their country and whether to fight for liberation from the British Muggles. They also debated whether it was really their fight. The argument did not go well and it led to a fight. Pro-interventionists argued that by intervening, they could save lives while anti-interventionists believed that they would reveal their community by intervening and place it in danger. They sought the advice of the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] to find out whether they intended to intervene on their side and they replied with only a four word letter - ''"Sitting this one out"''. McGilliguddy replied with an even shorter message stating ''"Mind you do"''. President [[Emily Rappaport]] created [[Rappaport's Law]], which would enforce strict segregation between the No-Maj and wizarding communities, after the discretions of the dim-witted witch [[Dorcus Twelvetrees]]. Henceforth, wizards were no longer allowed to befriend or marry No-Majs, and penalties of such fraternisation were harsh. Communication was also limited to only if necessary to perform daily activities. During this time, MACUSA worked strictly independently of the No-Maj government, to decrease the possibility of exposure. ===Modern times=== In around [[1987]], the then-President took a trip to the [[Ministry of Magic]] in [[Great Britain|Britain]].{{HM}}, Year 3 The President of MACUSA by [[2014]] and thus leader of American wizarding society was President [[Samuel G. Quahog]]. Following the kidnapping of [[Hans]] the [[Augurey]] by [[United States of America|American]] fans celebrating the [[American National Quidditch team|American team]]'s success in the quarter-finals of the [[2014 Quidditch World Cup]] against [[Liechtenstein National Quidditch team|Liechtenstein]], several terse letters were exchanged between President Quahog and [[Otto Obermeier]], Minister for Magic of [[Liechtenstein]]. Luckily, Hans was returned the following day, [[9 June]] [[2014]], and the relationship between the two countries seemed not to have been too damaged. ==Known Presidents of the MACUSA== ===17th century=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! align="center" width="5%" |# ! align="center" width="11%" |Portrait ! align="center" width="29%" |President of MACUSA
(term of office) ! align="center" width="25%" |Other MACUSA offices held ! align="center" width="30%" |Notes |- | align="center" |1 | align="center" | | align="center" |[[Josiah Jackson]]

? | align="center" |[[Auror]] | align="center" |Served as one of the original twelve American [[Auror]]s before becoming MACUSA's third President. |} ===18th century=== {| class="wikitable" border="1" ! align="center" width="5%" |# ! align="center" width="11%" |Portrait ! align="center" width="29%" |President of MACUSA
(term of office) ! align="center" width="25%" |Other MACUSA offices held ! align="center" width="30%" |Notes |- | align="center" |? | align="center" | | align="center" |[[Thornton Harkaway]]

Left his office in disgrace following a breach of the [[International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy|Statute of Secrecy]] when his pack of Crups savaged several local [[No-Maj]]s. |- | align="center" |? | align="center" | | align="center" |[[Able Fleming]]

{{Quote|Level Three, [[Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes]], incorporating the [[Accidental Magic Reversal Squad]], Obliviator Headquarters and [[Muggle-Worthy Excuse Committee]].|[[Voice of lift at the Ministry of Magic|Voice]] of lift at the Ministry of Magic|Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix}}

The '''Obliviator Headquarters''' was a division of the [[Department of Magical Accidents and Catastrophes]], part of the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] located on Level 3 of the [[British Ministry of Magic Headquarters|Ministry Headquarters]] in [[London]]. The Obliviator Headquarters was the main office for [[Obliviator]]s, wizards who had the task of modifying the memories of [[Non-magic people|Muggles]] if they witnessed incidents caused by magic.<ref name="OOTP7">{{OOTP|B|7}}</ref>

==Description==
Members of the Obliviator Headquarters were employed to modify the memories of Muggles who had, either unintentionally or otherwise, witnessed magic, the existence of the [[wizarding world]], or [[beast|magical beasts]], [[being]]s and [[spirit]]s. They did so by using the [[Memory Charm]], ''Obliviate''. In this capacity, Obiviators were essential when it came to maintaining the [[International Statute of Wizarding Secrecy|International Statute of Secrecy]]. Some, but not all, Obliviators were also part of the [[Accidental Magic Reversal Squad]].

==Appearances==
*{{OOTP}} {{1st Mention}}

{{Quote|We are looking for talented young witches and wizards with a liking for danger.|A recruitment advertisement|Daily Prophet}}
A '''Hit Wizard''' or '''Hit Witch''' was a member of the [[Magical Law Enforcement Patrol|Magical Law Enforcement Squad]] that were trained to deal with highly dangerous combat situations, such as high-risk arrests, riot controls and presumably, hostage situations. As such they were the [[Wizarding world|Wizarding Britain]]'s equivalent of specialist firearms officers .

==History==
A team of Hit Wizards arrested [[Sirius Black]] in [[1981]] when he was thought to have murdered [[Peter Pettigrew]] and twelve [[Non-magic people|Muggle]]s with a single curse.<ref>{{BookChapter|{{POA}}|10|The Marauder's Map}}</ref>

[[Arnold Peasegood]] suffered a minor attack of boils while arresting goblins during the [[Chipping Clodbury riot|riot in Chipping Clodbury]] in [[1992]]/[[1993]]. 

Hit Wizards were also needed to escort the Quidditch team members to safety during the riots that occurred at the [[Puddlemere United]] v [[Holyhead Harpies]] grudge match.

[[Alastor Gumboil]] handled applications for Hit Witches and Hit Wizards from room 919 at the Ministry.

==The job==
The [[Department of Magical Law Enforcement]] maintained squads of trained Hit Wizards and Witches whose job it was to move out at a moment's notice in dire and dangerous situations, be it to disperse the crowd during riots or apprehend dangerous wizarding criminals once they had been located.

While Hit Wizards were trained to fight Dark Wizards, just like the [[Auror]]s, the latter appeared to differ in that unlike Hit Wizards, Aurors were more of an elite force whose abilities went far beyond simply arresting suspects such as investigation, concealment and disguise, stealth and tracking, poisons and antidotes, etc., whereas Hit Wizards appeared to be primarily a fighting and controlling force, and not trained to investigate crime.
=== Job requirements:===
*17 years of age or older
*Five or more [[Ordinary Wizarding Level|O.W.L.s]] including [[Defence Against the Dark Arts]]
*Not of nervous disposition<ref>[[Sirius Black|<nowiki/>]][[1981|Daily Prophet]] newsletters - Issue 2</ref>
===Benefits include:===
*Starting salary of 700 [[Galleon]]s per month
*[[Ministry of Magic]] [[broomstick]]
*Regular bed at Saint Mungo's<ref>[[Peter Pettigrew|<nowiki/>]][[Non-magic people|Daily Prophet]] newsletters - Issue 2</ref>

==Known Hit Wizards==
*[[Alastor Gumboil]]
*[[Arnold Peasegood]]<ref name="DPNL">[[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|Daily Prophet Newsletters]], Feb 8th 1999, p. 2</ref>
*[[Cerberus Langarm]] (formerly)

==Behind the scenes==
*Hit Wizard is a play on the term "hit man."
*While the difference between Hit Wizards and Aurors were never explicitly stated in the books, in which Hit Wizards has a single reference of being the ones who arrested the suspected [[Death Eaters]] and dangerous mass murderer Sirius Black, [[The Daily Prophet (real-world)|contemporary writings]] from Rowling makes references to a [[Chipping Clodbury riot|riot]] in [[Chipping Clodbury]] in [[1999]], which Hit Wizards were involved in sorting out. This suggests that whilst the two differed in that whilst the Aurors  trained extensively in methods of criminal investigation, intelligence gathering and crime prevention, Hit Wizards by contrast was primarily a fighting and controlling force. In Muggle terms, the distinction would be roughly comparable to that of the Homicide and Major Crime Command, and the specialist firearms officers of the [[Metropolitan Police]]. In the US, the equivalent of this would be the differing roles of elite paramilitary units (e.g. SWAT) compared to national criminal investigative bodies (e.g. FBI),
*It is interesting to note that while Harry, Ron and Neville became Aurors after the Second Wizarding War immediately without the [[Nastily Exhausting Wizarding Test|N.E.W.T.]] requirements and Auror training, that both Harry and Ron can actually qualify for the entry requirements of becoming a Hit Wizard, in that they both have seven [[Ordinary Wizarding Level|O.W.L.s]] including one in Defence against the Dark Arts, are 17 years or older and are not of nervous disposition. Neville can also qualify for this, with the only minor exception for his achievement of only four O.W.L.s, instead of at least five.

{{Quote|The wand of chestnut is attracted to witches and wizards who are skilled tamers of magical beasts, those who possess great gifts in Herbology, and those who are natural fliers. However, when paired with dragon heartstring, it may find its best match among those who are overfond of luxury and material things, and less scrupulous than they should be about how they are obtained. Conversely, three successive heads of the Wizengamot have possessed chestnut and unicorn wands, for this combination shows a predilection for those concerned with all manner of justice.|[[Garrick Ollivander]]'s notes on [[wand wood]]s.|Pottermore}}
These '''three individuals''' were [[wizardkind|wizards]] who headed the [[Wizengamot]] in successive terms in office. Prior to their education in the magical arts, they bought their [[wand]]s (presumably at [[Ollivanders|Ollivanders Wand Shop]]), and the three of them were chosen by wands of [[Chestnut (tree)|chestnut]] and [[unicorn hair]], the combination, as [[Garrick Ollivander]] noted, showing interest in matters of justice and law.<ref name="pottermore">{{PM}} wand wood information (transcription available [http://archive.is/20130109195708/pottermorespoilers.tumblr.com/post/9770067306/wand-woods here])</ref>

This format is deprecated, and in the future the new format will always be used."}},"query":{"normalized":[{"from":"Advisor_to_the_Minister_for_Magic","to":"Advisor to the Minister for Magic"}],"pages":{"78470":{"pageid":78470,"ns":0,"title":"Advisor to the Minister for Magic","revisions":[{"contentformat":"text/x-wiki","contentmodel":"wikitext","*":"__NOTOC__
{{Conjecture}}
[[File:Cornelius Fudge.jpg|thumb|right|[[Cornelius Fudge]], an advisor with little to no political influence]]
This '''advisor to the Minister for Magic''' was an ''ad hoc'' position created in the administration of [[Rufus Scrimgeour]] to allow the outgoing [[Minister for Magic]], [[Cornelius Fudge]], to remain in the government in some capacity. Other than advising the Minister, Fudge's only known duty was to liaise with the [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[Prime Minister]], a tradition that Scrimgeour did not take himself due to the increasing business from the [[Second Wizarding War]].<ref name="HBP1">{{HBP|B|1}}</ref> It is unknown if the position was continued after the [[Fall of the Ministry of Magic]] and Scrimgeour's death, as [[Death Eaters]] had no use for muggle communications. While many other positions with the Minister for Magic's [[Minister for Magic and Support Staff|Staff]] and among the Heads of Department advised the Minister, this position was created solely for that purpose, and seems to have no other political power whatsoever.

==Known advisors==
* [[Cornelius Fudge]]<ref name="HBP1"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*{{PM}} mentions that 18th-century Minister [[Unctuous Osbert]] was significantly influenced by by [[pure-blood]]s of wealth and status, chief among them [[Septimus Malfoy]], effectively making Malfoy the ''de facto'' Minister for Magic, while Osbert was accused of being little more than Malfoy's puppet.<ref name="PM">{{PM|the-malfoy-family}}</ref> Septimus Malfoy, however, is never outright said to have ''formally'' worked at the Ministry as an advisor to Osbert.

The '''Head of the Muggle-Born Registration Commission''' was a position of power within the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]] for a short amount of time. It was created along with the [[Muggle-Born Registration Commission]] when [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] was indirectly in control of the Ministry during the height of the [[Second Wizarding War]], and is the leading power within this organisation. The only head of the Muggle-Born Registration Commission was [[Dolores Umbridge]], the founder of the commission. It was never intended to be a permanent committee; however, former members were recognised for being part of the Commission.

==History==
[[File:Umbridge-2-.jpg|220px|thumb|left|Dolores Umbridge, the only Head of the Commission]]
On [[1 August]], [[1997]], [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] and his [[Death Eaters]] took over the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]]. [[Minister for Magic]] [[Rufus Scrimgeour]] was tortured and then killed, the [[Imperius Curse]]d [[Pius Thicknesse]] was installed as a puppet in his place, and the Death Eaters began a campaign against their enemies, notably [[Muggle-born]]s. They were ordered to register with the [[Muggle-Born Registration Commission]], which convicted them of stealing [[magic]] from "real" [[Wizardkind|wizards and witches]] ([[pure-blood]]s) and imprisoned them in [[Azkaban]], though the entire trial was unfair and [[Muggle-born]]s were punished whether the evidence proved them guilty or not. Some were threatened with the [[Dementor's Kiss]], some were imprisoned, and some were stripped of their wands and jobs, and reduced to being [[Wandless|street beggars]]. Those who refused to register, such as [[Edward Tonks|Ted Tonks]], were pursued by [[Snatchers]], sometimes fatally. Dolores Umbridge, in her position as the Head of this department, enjoyed her newfound authority and sadistically tormented the many Muggle-borns; she assigned many of her subordinates to produce anti-Muggle [[Mudbloods and the Dangers They Pose to a Peaceful Pure-Blood Society|pamphlets]] in an autonomous manner, and seemed rather unpopular due to her tyrannical and sadistic manner.

The position was eliminated after Voldemort was killed by [[Harry Potter]] and the Commission was disbanded in [[May]] of [[1998]], its Head arrested, trialled and jailed in [[Azkaban]] for crimes against Muggle-borns, some of whom did not survive the ordeals of the prison themselves.<ref>[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2007/0730-bloomsbury-chat.html J.K. Rowling and the Live Chat, Bloomsbury.com, July 30, 2007]</ref>

==Duties==
{{Main|Muggle-Born Registration Commission}}
*The head of the Commission conducted the trials and directed the efforts to round up [[Muggle-born]]s, which was performed by [[Snatchers]].
*Oversaw the creation of pamphlets and similar propaganda to alert the magical community to the dangers of Muggle-borns. One such pamphlet showed a rose with a frown on its face, representing [[pure-blood]]s and a weed choking the flower, representing the Muggle-borns. The title of this particular pamphlet was ''[[Mudbloods and the Dangers They Pose to a Peaceful Pure-Blood Society]]''.

==See also==
*[[Muggle-Born Registration Commission]]
*[[Dolores Umbridge]]
*[[Mudbloods and the Dangers They Pose to a Peaceful Pure-Blood Society]]

Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic
column4:

[[1994]] - [[2 May]], [[1998]] |institution=[[British Ministry of Magic]] |incumbent= |style=Senior Undersecretary |member_of= |reports_to=[[Minister for Magic]] |seat=[[Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic's office]], Level 1, [[British Ministry of Magic Headquarters|Ministry of Magic]], [[Whitehall]], [[London]], [[England]], [[Great Britain]] (Scotland Pl, Westminster, London SW1A 2BD, UK) |nominator= |appointer=[[Minister for Magic]] |appointer_qualified= |termlength= |termlength_qualified= |constituting_instrument=[[British Ministry of Magic]]
formation {{c|possibly}} |precursor= |formation=[[1707]] {{c|possibly}}This is when the [[British Ministry of Magic]] was founded, so it is possible that this posision was founded at this time too. |first= |last= |abolished= |deputy= }} [[File:Dolores Umbridge sign.png|250px|thumb|Plaque outside of Umbridge's office]] The '''Senior Undersecretary to the Minister for Magic''' was a high-ranking position in the bureaucracy of the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]], serving as the principal assistant to to the [[Minister for Magic]].{{OOTP|B|8}} [[Dolores Umbridge]] was the only person known to have held the title, serving under [[Cornelius Fudge]], [[Rufus Scrimgeour]],{{HBP|B|16}} as well as then [[Pius Thicknesse]],{{DH|B|12}} until she was arrested and imprisoned in [[Azkaban]] for her crimes against [[Muggle-born]]s in [[1998]].[http://www.the-leaky-cauldron.org/2007/7/30/j-k-rowling-web-chat-transcript J.K. Rowling Web Chat] ==Known Senior Undersecretaries== *[[Dolores Umbridge]] ==Real World Connections== The style of the title reflects the Ministry's appropriation of standard British Civil Service hierarchy and labelling of posts. ==Behind the scenes== *During [[Harry Potter]]'s [[Careers Advice]] session, when [[Minerva McGonagall|Professor McGonagall]] supported [[Albus Dumbledore]]'s return to Hogwarts after his dismissal, Umbridge went into hysterics and proclaimed that Minerva had plans to make Dumbledore Minister for Magic and that she would become his Senior Undersecretary by usurping Umbridge's position, accusations that Minerva took as offensive. *In general, there are distinct differences between the organisation of the [[British Ministry of Magic]] and the British muggle government. One of the few Ministry of Magic positions that might be directly linked with a Muggle counterpart is that of ''Senior Undersecretary to the Minister of Magic''. In the British Muggle government, under each {{W|minister (government)|minister}} is a civil servant who holds the title {{W|Permanent Under Secretary of State}}. This person is the senior civil servant in that ministry and is responsible for both the day-to-day operations and routine administrative matters in that {{w|Ministry (government department)|ministry}}. If the two positions are indeed similar, it provides some insight into Dolores Umbridge and her time in the Ministry. As a {{w|civil servant}} she would presumably be beyond "political" matters, and would be expected to be loyal to the Ministry as an institution and not to a particular Minister of Magic. This would explain why she retained her position under several different Ministers of Magic. If there is indeed a {{w|civil service}} in the Ministry of Magic, it would also explain why she could not be easily dismissed from her position at the Ministry after her time at Hogwarts - until, that is, she was tried and convicted of criminal charges. This would also explain why [[Arthur Weasley]] also managed to retain his position after [[Pius Thicknesse]] became Minister of Magic. ==Appearances== *{{OOTP}} {{1st}} *{{OOTP|F}} *{{OOTP|G}} *{{HBP}} *{{DH}} *{{DH|F1}} *{{DH|G1}} *{{PM}} *{{WW}} *{{LEGO|Y2}} *{{LEGO}} *{{HPV|CH}} ==Notes and references== {{Reflist}} {{Minister for Magic and Support Staff}} [[pl:Starszy Podsekretarz Ministra Magii]] [[pt-br:Subsecretário Sênior do Ministro da Magia]] [[ru:Старший заместитель министра магии]] [[Category:Minister for Magic's Support Staff]] [[Category:Ministry of Magic positions]] [[Category:Politicians]] [[Category:Ranks and titles]]"}]}}}}

}}'''Ortiz O'Flaherty''' was a [[wizardkind|wizard or witch]] who wrote the highly-acclaimed book ''[[Big Foot's Last Stand]]'' about the [[Great Sasquatch Rebellion of 1892]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s">"[https://www.pottermore.com/collection-episodic/history-of-magic-in-north-america-en History of Magic in North America: 1920s Wizarding America]" on {{PM}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Ó Flaithbheartaigh ''was an Irish clan based most prominently in what is today County Galway. The clan name originated in the 10th century as a derivative of its founder Flaithbheartach mac Eimhin.<ref>https://www.wikiwand.com/en/%C3%93_Flaithbheartaigh</ref><nowiki> The surname  O'Flaherty is the Anglicised form of the Gaelic name Ó Flaithbheartaigh. The name "Flaithbheartach" comes from the old Gaelic elements "flaith(eamh)" - meaning ''prince, ruler" </nowiki><ref>http://www.surnamedb.com/Surname/O'Flaherty</ref>

"Ó" ('oh') is a Gaelic prefix used to mark out that the person in question is male (for females, 'Ní' was used). Of course, this does not mean that Oritz is male, as the practise has been dropped over the years.

The '''Frog Choir''' was a singing group of [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry|Hogwarts students]] conducted by [[Professor]] [[Filius Flitwick]]. They usually practised in the [[Great Hall]]. The choir is quite talented, being able to both sing fluently in [[Latin]] as well as polyphonically.

The [[Hogwarts orchestra]], also conducted by [[Filius Flitwick]] plays alongside the Frog Choir sometimes. It played waltz music at the [[Yule Ball]] of [[1994]] before the [[Weird Sisters]] came rocking on stage. It also played [[The Hogwarts March]] before the beginning of the [[Triwizard Tournament#The Third Task|Third Task]] of the [[Triwizard Tournament]] that year.
==History==
===Creation===
The Frog Choir was presumably founded sometime during [[Celestina Warbeck]]'s time at Hogwarts ([[1928]]-[[1936]]) as a result of [[Celestina Warbeck's mother|her mother's]] frequent letters to the school demanding, among other artistic pursuits, a choir.<ref name=PM />

===1980s===
[[File:Frog Choir in Hogwarts Mystery.jpeg|250px|thumb|The choir in Hogwarts Mystery]]
At some point during the [[1986–1987 school year]], Professor Flitwick announced in the [[Great Hall]] that there would be auditions for the Choir, as two members had left.<ref>{{HM|3|The Frog Choir}}</ref>

[[Tulip Karasu]] felt her toad [[Dennis (toad)|Dennis]] to be depressed, and that joining the Choir might cheer him up; since Tulip admitted to be a terrible singer, she asked [[Jacob's sibling]] to audition with her toad. Jacob's sibling agreed to do so and after bonding with Dennis over several events, one of which was playing pranks on [[Irma Pince|Madam Pince]], practised with the [[Weird Sisters]].<ref>{{HM|3|The Frog Choir}}</ref>

===1990s===
[[File:Flitwick conducting.png|250px|thumb|left|Professor Flitwick and the choir performing]]
On [[1 September]] [[1993]], the choir led a presentation of ''[[Double Trouble|Something Wicked This Way Comes]]'' during the [[Welcoming Feast]] after the [[Sorting ceremony]]. The choir members sang while carrying [[toad]]s (one of which was [[Trevor]], [[Neville Longbottom]]'s toad<ref>[http://www.imsdb.com/Movie%20Scripts/Harry%20Potter%20and%20the%20Prisoner%20of%20Azkaban%20Script.html ''Prisoner of Azkaban'' script] on IMSDb</ref>) which croaked during the song, and were accompanied by a harpsichord, a drum, a harp and flutes. While [[Filius Flitwick]] joined the feast, the choir retreated from the Hall after the song.<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

[[File:Umbridge inspecting Flitwick.jpg|250px|thumb|right|Flitwick and the choir's inspection]]
In [[1995]], [[Dolores Umbridge]] was put in charge of observing teachers and their lessons and inspected one of Flitwick's choir practices in the [[Great Hall]]. As she watched, Flitwick turned and smiled at her while conducting, as though waiting for her to praise the Frog Choir, though she just got out a pink measuring tape. She seemed pleased and impressed, before embarrassing Flitwick with a measuring tape.<ref name="OOTPF">{{OOTP|F}}</ref>

In early October [[1996]], the choir had an emergency practice that forced Professor Flitwick to retreat from [[Hogsmeade|Hogsmeade Village]] back to [[Hogwarts Castle]]; it is unknown if there actually was a Choir Practice or if Flitwick was merely using it as an excuse to avoid Slughorn. At the end of the [[1996–1997 school year|school year]], Flitwick had a rehearsal with the choir in the [[Great Hall]] late in the evening. As they sang the English and Latin song, ''[[In Noctem]]'', clouds rolled in around the school and the [[Battle of the Astronomy Tower]] was soon to begin. Midway through the session, [[Minerva McGonagall]] interrupted and told Flitwick to wake the incumbent [[Potions Master]], [[Severus Snape]].<ref name="HBPF">{{HBP|F}}</ref>

==Known songs==
*[[Double Trouble]]
*[[In Noctem]]
*[[Christmas at Hogwarts]]
*[[We Wish You a Merry Christmas]]
*[[The Most Magical Yule Ball of All]]
*[[I Cast a Spell on Father Christmas]]

==Known members==
*[[Filius Flitwick]] (conductor)
*[[Trevor]]
*[[Merula Snyde's mother]]<ref>{{HM|3|The Frog Choir|4}}</ref>
*[[Chester Davies]]<ref>{{HM|3|The Frog Choir|3}}</ref>
*[[Merula Snyde]] (possibly)<ref name="HMoutcome">In {{HM}}, during a time-limited side-quest, Jacob's sibbling has the option to get on the Frog Choir or suggest Merula as a member.</ref>
**[[Dennis (toad)]]<ref name="HMoutcome"/>
*[[Jacob's sibling]] (possibly)<ref name="HMoutcome"/>
**[[Dennis (toad)]]<ref name="HMoutcome"/>
*[[Celestina Warbeck]] (possibly)<ref name=PM />
*[[Unidentified Choir Member (I)]]
*[[Unidentified Choir Member (II)]]

==Behind the scenes==
*The name is a bit of a misnomer in that the students hold toads, which are similar to, but not the same as frogs.
*The choir does not appear in any of the books, making its first appearance in {{POA|FA}}. It was added by director [[Alfonso Cuarón]] and [[J. K. Rowling]] admitted that she simply loved the idea.
**Cuarón considered having [[little people]] play an organ in the [[Great Hall]] along with the choir but J. K. Rowling ultimately rejected this idea.
*In {{POA|FA}}, the [[Canon|non-canon]] character [[Bem]] is part of the Frog Choir.
*In {{HM}}, during a time-limited event to complete "The Frog Choir" Achievement, if the player reached Task 3 of the 4th Side Quest in time, they would be offered to be the new Choir member by Flitwick, having the option to accept or recommend [[Merula Snyde]] instead.
*In the GBC [[Harry Potter video games|video game versions]] of [[Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone (GBC)|''Philosopher's Stone'']] and [[Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (GBC)|''Chamber of Secrets'']], there is one [[Music Classroom]] featured on the Fifth Floor of [[Hogwarts Castle|Hogwarts]]. Aside from used for classes [[Music]] and [[Muggle Music]], it may be a possible place for the Choir to practise, though the choir is also known to practise in the Great Hall, as shown in {{OOTP|FA}}.
[[File:Chorus.jpg|250px|thumb|right|The choir performing at the Theme Park]]
*During the opening celebrations of {{WWHP}}, there was a performance of ''The Hogwarts March'' and ''[[Double Trouble|Something Wicked This Way Comes]]'' by the Choir, directed by [[Warwick Davis]], just like in the movies.
*During festive season, frog choir performs a bunch of special Christmas songs, in the theme park, hogsmeade.

The '''Hogsmeade choir''' was a singing group which sang [[Christmas]] carols on the [[High Street]] of [[Hogsmeade]] in [[December]], [[1993]]. All of its members were [[goblin]]s and at least [[Unidentified goblin stockbroker|one]] worked for [[Gringotts Wizarding Bank|Gringotts Bank]].<ref name="POAF"/>

==History==
===December [[1993]]===
During the [[Christmas holidays]], the [[Hogsmeade]] choir performed a [[Christmas]] carol, but they were interrupted by a [[Cloak of Invisibility|cloaked]] [[Harry Potter]] then by the following [[Hermione Granger]] and [[Ronald Weasley|Ron Weasley]].<ref name="POAF">{{POA|F}}</ref>

==Known Members==
*[[Unidentified goblin stockbroker]]<ref name="POAF"/>
*[[Unidentified Goblin Caroler (I)]]<ref name="POAF"/>

==Behind the scenes==
*They are played by [[Rusty Goffe]], [[Binde Johal]], and many unknown actors.

This '''orchestra''' was a musical group comprised of students from [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]]. They would sometimes play by themselves, but also as public entertainment, and accompany the [[Frog Choir]]. The orchestra was comprised of [[saxophone|saxophonists]], [[violin]]ists, [[cello|cellists]], [[flute|flutists]], [[drums|drummers]], [[harp]]ists, [[tuba|tubists]] and [[harpsichord]]ists. In the [[1990s]], its conductor was [[Filius Flitwick|Professor Flitwick]].

==History==
===1993-1994 school year===
[[File:Flitwick conducting.png|250px|thumb|left|The orchestra and the [[Frog Choir]] lead a presentation of ''[[Double Trouble|Something Wicked This Way Comes]]'']]
On [[1 September]] [[1993]], the orchestra and the [[Frog Choir]] led a presentation of ''[[Double Trouble|Something Wicked This Way Comes]]'' during the [[Start-of-Term Feast]] after the [[Sorting ceremony]]. The choir members sang while carrying toads (one of which was [[Trevor]], [[Neville Longbottom]]'s toad<ref>[http://www.imsdb.com/scripts/Harry-Potter-and-the-Prisoner-of-Azkaban.html ''Prisoner of Azkaban'' script] on IMSDb</ref>) which croaked during the song, and were accompanied by a harpischord, a drum, a harp, and flutes. While [[Filius Flitwick]] joined the feast, the choir and the orchestra retreated from the Hall after the song.

===The Triwizard Tournament===
[[File:Flitwick Yule Ball.png|200px|thumb|right|Flitwick beginning the performance at the [[Yule Ball]]]]
In the [[1994–1995 school year]], the [[Triwizard Tournament]] was held at the school and the orchestra played just before the third task for public entertainment. These songs included ''[[The Hogwarts March]]'', which was recited frequently. The choir also performed at the [[Yule Ball]] on [[24 December|Christmas Eve]]. Flitwick led the orchestra as they played a waltz at the beginning of the dance, but they stopped when the [[Weird Sisters]] took over from them.

==Behind the scenes==
*Neither the choir nor the orchestra appear in any of the books, making their first appearance in {{POA|FA}}. It was added by director [[Alfonso Cuarón]] and [[J. K. Rowling]] admitted that she simply loved the idea. Cuarón considered having [[little people]] play an organ in the [[Great Hall]] along with the choir but this idea was rejected by Rowling.
*The orchestra in all instances is made up a collection of students from the Aylesbury Music Centre, as it is situated close to Pinewood Studios where the majority of the scenes are filmed.<ref name="aylesbury">[http://www.bucksherald.co.uk/lifestyle/entertainments/bucks-musicians-to-perform-at-festival-1-611402 ''Bucks Herald'' - Bucks musicians to perform at festival]</ref>

==Appearances==

*{{GOF|F}}

'''Zombie Ghost Train''' were a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] [[Australia]]n psychobilly and gothabilly band.<ref name="Wikipedia">[[Wikipedia:Zombie Ghost Train|"Zombie Ghost Train"]] on [[Wikipedia:Main page|Wikipedia]]</ref>

In [[1997]], when [[Harry Potter]], [[Ronald Weasley]] and [[Hermione Granger]] fled from [[Attack at the Burrow|Bill and Fleur's wedding]] to [[London]], they passed a [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] wearing a Zombie Ghost Train leather jacket.<ref name="DHI8">{{DH|F1}} - Chapter 8</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*[[Wikipedia:Zombie Ghost Train|Zombie Ghost Train]] was a real-life band active in the mid-to-late [[2000s]] until their disestablishment on [[26 April]], [[2009]]. A reference to them in the [[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1|first part of the film adaptation]] of {{DH}} is, therefore, anachronistic, as the film is set in [[1997]]-[[1998]].

==Appearances==
*{{DH|F1}}

The '''Weird Sisters''' were a very popular band in the [[wizarding world]], whose music was frequently played on the [[Wizarding Wireless Network]]. Despite their name, all eight known members were male.

Many individuals were fans of the Weird Sisters in the [[Wizarding world]], including [[Ginevra Weasley]] and [[Nymphadora Tonks]].

==Overview==
===Known band members===
*[[Heathcote Barbary]] - [[Rhythm guitar]]
*[[Gideon Crumb]] - [[Bagpipes]]
*[[Kirley Duke]] - Lead guitar
*[[Merton Graves]] - [[Cello]]
*[[Orsino Thruston]] - [[Drums]]
*[[Donaghan Tremlett]] - [[Bass]]
*[[Myron Wagtail]] - Lead singer
*[[Herman Wintringham]] - [[Lute]]

===Known songs===
*"[[Do the Hippogriff]]"<ref name="gofF">{{GOF|F}}</ref>
*"[[Magic Works]]"<ref name="gofF"/>
*"[[This Is the Night]]"<ref name="gofF"/>

==History==
===1985–1986 school year===
By the [[1985–1986 school year]], Hogwarts students [[Myron Wagtail]] and [[Kirley Duke]], accompanied by [[Orsino Thruston]], had formed the band, and wanted to perform in the [[Hogwarts Castle]].<ref name="HM2">{{HM|2|Become an Honorary Rocker}}</ref>

After the performance, Wagtail informed [[Jacob's sibling]] that they found a talented newcomer, [[Donaghan Tremlett]].<ref name="HM2"/>

===1986–1987 school year===
In [[1986–1987 school year]], the band mentioned that [[Jacob's sibling]], being known as an unofficial "[[Curse-Breaker]]", had been one of their sources of inspiration. They helped them practise their [[Frog Choir]] audition on the [[Training Grounds|training grounds]]. They then encouraged Jacob's sibling to sing in front of [[Severus Snape|Professor Snape]] to test their nerves. They watched and praised them for having done a great job.<ref name="HM3">{{HM|3|The Frog Choir}}</ref>

===1994–1995 school year===
Upon the announcement of the [[Yule Ball]], one of the rumours discussed in [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], was that [[Albus Dumbledore]] had booked the Weird Sisters for the ball, which turned out to be true.<ref name="GOF22">{{GOF|B|22}}</ref>

On [[25 December]], [[1994]], the band performed in the [[Great Hall]] on a [[magic]]ally-appearing stage. Among the band's instruments were a set of drums, several guitars, a cello, a lute, a double bass and some bagpipes. During this performance, [[Harry Potter]] noted that all members of the band were extremely hairy and all wearing black robes that had been artfully torn.<ref name="GOFF22">{{GOF|B|23}}</ref>

===1995–1996 school year===
In [[1995]], the band was popular enough that the marriage of their bass player, [[Donaghan Tremlett]], made front-page news in the ''[[Daily Prophet]]''.<ref name="OOTP14">{{OOTP|B|14}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*In {{GOF|FA}}, the band which performs at the Yule Ball deliberately goes unnamed throughout the film because of a legal dispute between the film studio and Canadian folk band Wyrd Sisters.<ref>[http://www.canada.com/vancouversun/news/arts/story.html?id=ece18f65-1eb9-4829-9e2b-1d50a0dca298 Wyrd Sisters keep fighting the good fight] at canada.com (archived)</ref> The band is simply introduced as "The band that needs no introduction!", by [[Albus Dumbledore]].
**Thirteen years after the film's release, despite the legal dispute, [[Warner Bros.]] used the name to identify a trio of teenage witches in the 2018 Netflix Original Series, {{w|Chilling Adventures of Sabrina (TV series)|''Chilling Adventures of Sabrina''}}.
*Members [[Merton Graves]] and [[Herman Wintringham]] do not make an appearance in the film.
*In {{GOF|FA}}, piper Gideon Crumb plays keyboards as well as bagpipes. In the book series, however, there is no mention of the band having a keyboard player.
*The band's songs were written by [[Jarvis Cocker]], who plays singer Myron Wagtail. "Do the Hippogriff" was a collaboration between Cocker and rhythm guitarist [[Jason Buckle]] (Heathcote Barbary).
*The Scottish band {{w|Franz Ferdinand (band)|Franz Ferdinand}}, self-professed fans of the books, were originally invited to play the Weird Sisters.<ref>[http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1492215/20041012/franz_ferdinand.jhtml Franz Ferdinand To Play Ugly Sisters In Next 'Harry Potter' Flick?], MTV</ref>
*In an interview, [[J. K. Rowling]] stated that the instruments that they played included bagpipes, cello and electric guitar and that they were Harry Potter's favourite band.<ref name="royalhall">J.K. Rowling at the Royal Albert hall, [http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2003/0626-alberthall-fry.htm available on Accio Quote!]</ref>
*At least as portrayed in the [[Harry Potter (film series)|''Harry Potter'' films]], the Weird Sisters are considered to be a [[wizard rock]] band.<ref name="pts135">{{HPPS}}, Page 135</ref>
*All appear on [[Chocolate Frog Card]]s at the Harry Potter Exhibition.

===Etymology===
*The term "''Weird Sisters''" was the name given to the three prophetic witches in the play "Macbeth," by [[William Shakespeare]] ("weïrd" being Old English for "fate" or "destiny").
**Macbeth, stated to be quite possibly the favourite Shakespeare play of [[Harry Potter (book series)|''Harry Potter'' series]] author [[J. K. Rowling]],<ref name="leakymugglenet">[http://www.accio-quote.org/articles/2005/0705-tlc_mugglenet-anelli-3.htm The Leaky Cauldron and Mugglenet Interview]</ref> had another allusion in {{POA|F}}, where the [[Frog Choir]] sings ''"Double Double Toil and Trouble"'', a direct quote from the play.
**Interestingly, the Spanish edition of the books refers to the band by the name ''las Brujas de Macbeth'', meaning "Macbeth's Witches".
*As it is unconfirmed as to from where J. K. Rowling got the idea for the band's name, other possibilities include:
**A variant of the name, ''{{w|Wyrd Sisters}}'', was used as the title of a 1988 ''Discworld'' novel by {{w|Terry Pratchett}}.
**A play on the heavy rock band, Twisted Sister.

===Portrayers of the Weird Sisters===
*[[Jarvis Cocker]] (of {{w|Pulp (band)|Pulp}}) as [[Myron Wagtail]] – vocals
*[[Jonny Greenwood]] (of {{w|Radiohead}}) as [[Kirley Duke]] – lead guitar
*[[Jason Buckle]] (of {{w|All Seeing I}}) as [[Heathcote Barbary]] – rhythm guitar
*[[Steve Mackey]] (of Pulp) as [[Donaghan Tremlett]] – bass
*[[Steven Claydon]] (of {{w|Add N to (X)}}) as [[Gideon Crumb]] – keyboards and bagpipes
*[[Phil Selway]] (of Radiohead) as [[Orsino Thruston]] – drums

}}A '''part elf''' is, presumably, an individual with both [[human]] and [[house-elf]] ancestry.

==Known part elfs==
*[[Irma Dugard]] - half-elf
*Circus Arcanus half-elves<ref>{{COG|S|41}}</ref>

==History==
In the [[1990s]], some [[Ravenclaw]] students, including [[Robert Hilliard]], speculated that [[Filius Flitwick]] was part elf because of his stature, although they never asked him about it.<ref>[[Pottermore Introductions to Hogwarts Houses]] (Archived from {{PM}})</ref> In fact, he was [[half-goblin|part-goblin]].<ref>[https://www.pottermore.com/explore-the-story/filius-flitwick Explore the story: Filius Flitwick] at {{PM}}</ref>

==See also==
*[[Half-goblin]]

==Behind the scenes==
*It is also unknown if they inherited the special form of [[House-elf magic|elf magic]] from their non-human ancestor. Irma Dugard possessed a weak form of magic, though it is unclear if it was of the human or house-elf kind.
*It is likely interbreeding between humans and [[erkling]]s or [[yumbo]]es is possible as well, as both species are described as "elvish" (and thus presumably closely related to normal elves). Moreover, it would also be possible that humans could cross-breed with [[Red Cap]]s, [[Leprechaun]]s and [[Imp]]s, as all three, while not explicitly stated to be related to elves, are markedly similar to them.
*Students confusing Flitwick for a part-elf may have been inspired by [[J. K. Rowling]]'s earlier comment that she thought the early movies' version of Flitwick "looked like an elf" (and thus far more non-human than she initially intended).

==Appearances==
*{{PM}} {{1st Mention}}
*{{COG|S}} {{1st}}
*{{COG}}

{{Quote|Among those who claimed to have invented this revolutionary spell was the German warlock Garvin Lügner, who insisted that he had invented it as a side-effect of his discovery of Instant Darkness Powder.|[[Miranda Goshawk]], ''[[Book of Spells]]''.|Wonderbook: Book of Spells}} 
'''Garvin Lügner''' (fl. [[18th century]]) was a [[Germany|German]] [[warlock]] who invented the [[Instant Darkness Powder]], presumably intended as a variant of [[Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder]]. However, unlike the true substance, which provides absolute darkness, Garvin's powder merely slightly dimmed the lights.

However, this did not discourage Garvin from falsely claiming he had invented the [[Wand-Lighting Charm]], ''Lumos'', to remedy the effects of his powder. The Wand-Lighting Charm was actually invented in [[1772]], by [[Levina Monkstanley]], a [[Great Britain|British]] [[Wizardkind|witch]].<ref name="WBoS">{{WBS}} - see [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9LNQV7cGIA&feature=relmfu this video]</ref>

==Etymology==
*"Garvin" is a name of Old English origin, and its meaning is "''spear-friend''". ''Lügner'' is also the German word for "liar".

==Appearances==
*{{WBS}} {{1st}}

'''Chancellor of the Exchequer''' is the title held by the British Cabinet minister who is responsible for all economic and financial matters. 

[[Alistair Darling]] was the Chancellor of the Exchequer by [[July]] [[1996]], and had been one of several people who tried unsuccessfully remove the portrait of [[Ulick Gamp]] from the wall in the [[Prime Minister's office]].<ref>{{HBP|B|1}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*[[:File:TheGuardian.png|A prop version]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' made for the [[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (film)|film version]] of ''[[Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince|Half-Blood Prince]]'' establishes that Alistair Darling was Chancellor in 1996 rather than 2007-2010, and thus the real-world Chancellors are not be the same as in the ''Harry Potter'' universe.

{{Dialogue a-b-a|Lee Jordan|And the Quaffle is taken immediately by Angelina Johnson — what an amazing Chaser that girl is, and rather attractive too—|Professor McGonagall|JORDAN!|Sorry, Professor. Just a fun fact.|[[Lee Jordan|Lee]] commentating at a [[Quidditch]] match.|Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone}}

'''Quidditch commentators''' provide live commentary during [[Quidditch]] matches. As it can be difficult for spectators to visually follow the extremely fast played sport, commentary is audible throughout the [[Quidditch pitch|stadium]]. There are often two commentators working together as a team.<ref name=QWC>{{QWC}}</ref>

==Voice Amplification==
[[Ludovic Bagman]] used the spell [[Amplifying Charm|Sonorus]] to commentate on the final of the [[Quidditch World Cup]] in [[1994]] between the [[Irish National Quidditch team]] and [[Bulgarian National Quidditch team]].<ref>{{GOF}}</ref>

The '''Ice Knight''' was an [[Piertotum Locomotor|animated]] [[suit of armour]] that guarded the [[Cursed Vaults]] on the fifth floor of [[Hogwarts Castle]].<ref name="HM"/>

==History==
In the [[1984–1985 school year]], [[Jacob's sibling]] had a vision of the Ice Knights. [[Rowan Khanna]] researched it in the summer holidays, but was not able to find any information.<ref name="HM"/>

When Jacob's sibling, [[William Weasley|Bill Weasley]] and another student eventually found and opened the vault, the Ice Knight immediately attacked them, freezing two of the students. Jacob's sibling was eventually able to defeat it using offensive [[spell]]s.<ref name="HM"/>

Four years later, Jacob's sibling returned with Bill when they were completing [[Cadogan|Sir Cadogan]]'s agenda, initiating a second duel with the Ice Knight, who lost a second time.<ref name="HM">{{HM}}</ref>

}}'''Shikoba Wolfe''' was an [[United States of America|American]] [[wizardkind|wizard or witch]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s">{{WW|1920s-wizarding-america-en}}</ref> Wolfe, along with [[Johannes Jonker]], [[Thiago Quintana]], and [[Violetta Beauvais]], was one of the four [[wandmaker]]s who served [[North America]] during the early [[20th century]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

==Biography==
Of [[Choctaw|Chocktaw]] descent, Wolfe was best known for crafting [[wand]]s that were intricately carved. Wands made by Wolfe contained [[Thunderbird]] [[Thunderbird tail feather|tail feathers]] as [[Wand core|cores]] and were generally believed to be extremely powerful, but difficult to master. They were especially sought after by practitioners of [[Transfiguration]].<ref name="pottermore-1920s" />

==History==
Shikoba Wolfe was mentioned on a Shikoba Wolfe Fine Wands advert in [[The New York Ghost]] in [[1926]].<ref>{{see image|File:New York Ghost - 2 December 1926.jpg}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*This individual's gender is left unspecified on Pottermore. Various official translations vary the gender. In its native language of Choctaw it is gender neutral, however historically its more often used as a female name.

'''Salomé Lestrange''' (née '''Volant''') was a [[Wizardkind|witch]] and a member of the [[pure-blood]] [[Lestrange family]]. She married [[Falco Lestrange]] and had two daughters with him, [[Eglantine Lestrange|Eglantine]] and [[Leonie Tremblay|Leonie]].<ref>{{COG}} {{see image|File:LestrangeFamilyTree HighRes.png}}</ref>

==Etymology==
Salomé is an Aramaic name which was related to the Hebrew word שָׁלוֹם (shalom) meaning "peace".

{{Quote|Meanwhile, the second brother journeyed to his own home, where he lived alone. Here he took out the stone that had the power to recall the dead, and turned it thrice in his hand. To his amazement and delight, the figure of the girl he had once hoped to marry, before her untimely death, appeared at once before him. Yet she was sad and cold, separated from him as by a veil. Though she had returned to the mortal world, she did not truly belong there and suffered. Finally the second brother, driven mad with hopeless longing, killed himself so as to truly join her.|[[Beedle the Bard]], ''[[The Tale of the Three Brothers]]''.|The Tales of Beedle the Bard (real)}}
[[File:3brothers02_woman.jpg|thumb|right|Cadmus is haunted by his lost [[love]]]]
According to [[The Tale of the Three Brothers|legend]], this '''woman''' was in love with [[Cadmus Peverell]], and was set to be married to him before her untimely death. Although Cadmus attempted to use the [[Resurrection Stone]] he had taken from [[Death (The Tale of the Three Brothers)|Death]] to bring her back to the world of the living, she was unable to fully return to life, existing as "neither [[ghost]] nor truly flesh".<ref name="DH34">{{DH|B|34}}</ref> In his despair, Cadmus committed suicide in order to be with her again.<ref name="DH21">{{DH|B|21}}</ref><ref name="TBB">{{TBB|E}}</ref>

==Behind the scenes==
*The [[House of Gaunt]] are direct descendants of [[Cadmus Peverell]], so it is certain that Cadmus had at least one child in his lifetime. It is not specified if this woman was the mother, or if Cadmus had fathered children from a previous or later relationship. If this woman is the mother of Cadmus Peverell's child/children then she is a direct relative to Tom Riddle Jnr. However, as [[Albus Dumbledore]] believed that, in reality, the [[Deathly Hallows]] had not been gifts from [[Death (The Tale of the Three Brothers)|Death]] but rather inventions of the [[Peverell family|Peverells]] themselves, it is also possible that the circumstances of Cadmus' death were embellished somewhat with the passing down of the legend. Yet, it could be true that he created the Resurrection Stone before his fiancee died, likely in childbirth with his heir, and so he committed suicide after the use of his creation taunted him with her solid, undead figure.
**It is possible that she did not exist, and her existence was simply fictionalised by Beedle to explain Cadmus' death. Because there is no way Beedle knew what was really happening, so it is safe to assume that the account in his tale are simply from Beedle's own fancy.
*In the consoles versions {{LEGO|Y2}}, the woman becomes playable only when [[Cadmus Peverell]] uses the [[Resurrection Stone]] at some dangerous events.
*The woman of the story bears some resemblance to the Ancient Greek character of Eurydice. In the myth, Eurydice hoped to marry the musician, Orpheus, but was tricked by a satyr into being bitten on the foot by a poisoned snake on her wedding day. Like Cadmus, Orpheus attempts to being her back from the dead, but sadly fails.

These '''individuals''' were the [[Muggle]] parents of a [[Unidentified 2000s Hogwarts student|child]] who was a [[Wizardkind|witch or wizard]]. They lived in the early [[21st century]].<ref name="Video">[https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=mHjRnuLXayg Youtube] </ref>

== Biography ==

At one point in between [[1998]] and [[2004]], they had a [[Unidentified 2000s Hogwarts student|child]]. When their child was young, they were taken on holidays. Their child soon began to cause strange things to happen, but when they told their parents, they laughed and thought they had to be seeing things.<ref name="Video" />

At the age of eleven, their child found out about their magical heritage by [[Rubeus Hagrid]], and began attending [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]].<ref name="Video" />

==Appearances==
*{{MA}} {{1st}}

This '''old man''' was seen by [[Harry Potter]] while out shopping with the [[Dursley family|Dursleys]]. Harry remembered how this man had been talking to himself while Harry and the Dursleys passed. [[Petunia Dursley|Mrs Dursley]] quickly pulled [[Dudley Dursley|her son]] aside. [[Vernon Dursley|Mr Dursley]] went into a long speech with the family about what he would like to do with people like this tramp. Harry remembered this man when he encountered [[Bartemius Crouch Senior|Barty Crouch Snr]] talking to himself in the [[Forbidden Forest]] after Harry had been informed about what he would face in the final task of the [[Triwizard Tournament]].

The '''nine biological siblings''' of [[Modesty Barebone]] lived with her and their [[Modesty Barebone's biological mother|mother]] and [[Modesty Barebone's biological father|father]] in a tenement in the [[The Bronx]] in the [[1910s]] and/or [[1920s]].<ref name="fb96">{{FB|S|96}}</ref> However, Modesty was adopted by [[Mary Lou Barebone]], a [[Muggle|No-Maj]] anti-[[magic|witchcraft]] activist, possibly because the family had more children than they could care for or were magical.<ref name="fb96" /> Afterward, Modesty missed her brothers and sisters, and would talk about them to her adoptive brother [[Credence Barebone|Credence]].<ref name="fb96" />

Modesty's fate after the death of her adoptive mother is unknown, but it is possible that she returned to her biological family.

==Appearances==
*{{FB|F}} {{Mention}}
*{{FB|S}} {{Mention}}

Chief [[Barberus Bragge]] had a group of '''advisors'''. 

During a [[Quidditch|Cuaditch]] game in [[1269]], Chief Bragge released a [[Golden Snidget]] onto the field, and offered the player who captured it one-hundred and fifty [[Wizarding currency|Galleons]]. In protest, [[Modesty Rabnott]] summoned the Snidget to her and fled the game. After she was caught, Bragge had to be calmed down by his advisers to prevent him to turn [[Modesty Rabnott|Modesty]] into a horned toad, or worse. Rabnott was only then fined ten [[Wizarding currency|Galleons]].<ref>{{QTA|E}} - Chapter 4 (''The Arrival of the Golden Snitch'')</ref>

This '''individual''' worked as a groundskeeper of the [[Chudley Cannons training grounds|training grounds]] of the [[Chudley Cannons]] [[Quidditch]] [[Quidditch team|team]].

When [[Chudley Cannons]] [[Keeper]] [[Gordon Horton]] was training alone and was attacked by a [[Hippogriff]] that had been nursing an egg in a nearby [[Old Bell Tower|bell tower]], this groundskeeper heard terrible screeching coming from the pitch and fled for help, ending up calling the [[British Ministry of Magic|Ministry of Magic]].<ref>{{FBC|1}}</ref>

These '''Goshawks''' were the six siblings of [[Miranda Goshawk's father|Mr Goshawk]] and their respective husbands and/or wives. Two of them never married or had any children, but the rest had [[Miranda Goshawk's cousins|children of their own]].

Through their brother, [[Miranda Goshawk's father|Mr Goshawk]], they have a [[Miranda Goshawk's mother|sister-in-law]], and [[Goshawk sisters|nine nieces]], including [[Diadema Goshawk|Diadema]], [[Romilda Goshawk|Romilda]], [[Tangwystl Goshawk|Tangwystl]] and [[Miranda Goshawk]].<ref name="WBoS">{{WBS}}</ref>

They were both murdered by [[Tom Riddle|Lord Voldemort]] on [[Hallowe'en]] in [[1981]], while trying to protect their infant son. See their individual articles for more information:

'''Aurélie Dumont''' was a [[France|French]] [[Wizardkind|witch]] who attended [[Beauxbatons Academy of Magic]]. She was pen-friends with [[Penny Haywood]], and the two shared an interest in [[Potions (class)|Potions]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 1">{{HM|2|Hosting the Beauxbatons|1}}</ref> In the [[1980s]], she visited [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]] to search for an [[Alchemy|Alchemical]] artefact.<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 3">{{HM|2|Hosting the Beauxbatons|3}}</ref>

==Biography==

===Early life===
Aurélie attended [[Beauxbatons Academy of Magic]],<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 1"/> where she constantly felt overshadowed by her brother, [[Davet Dumont]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 3"/>

====Visiting Hogwarts====
At one point during the [[1985–1986 school year]], Aurélie visited [[Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry]], supposedly considering a transfer. Penny introduced her to [[Jacob's sibling]], who proceeded to give her a tour of the [[Hogwarts Castle|castle]] alongside [[Rowan Khanna]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 1"/> However, they soon noticed that Aurélie was acting suspicious and seemed to be searching the school for an item.<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 2">{{HM|2|Hosting the Beauxbatons|2}}</ref> When confronted by Jacob's sibling, Aurélie admitted that she came to Hogwarts hoping to find an [[Alchemy]]-related artefact.<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 3"/>

After reading about alchemy, Aurélie and Jacob's sibling realised that the artefact was most likely a [[Nicolas Flamel's chalice|chalice]] that belonged to [[Nicolas Flamel]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 3"/> However, they soon were asked to visit [[Albus Dumbledore]]'s office, where he encouraged Aurélie to stop comparing herself to her brother and informed her that if the chalice did exist, it was not hidden at Hogwarts. She decided to pursue Alchemy not to outdo her brother, but because she enjoyed the subject. Afterwards, she said good-bye to Jacob's sibling and Penny, and returned to Beauxbatons.<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 4">{{HM|2|Hosting the Beauxbatons|4}}</ref>

==Magical abilities and skills==
*'''[[Potion]]s''': Aurélie was highly talented in the [[magic]]al art and [[science]] of brewing potions. She was the best [[Potioneer]] in her class at [[Beauxbatons Academy of Magic]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 1"/>
*'''[[Alchemy]]''': Aurélie had considerable skill in Alchemy, a particularly esoteric and complex branch of magic. Indeed, Albus Dumbledore himself praised her talents, noting she was already greater than her brother.<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 1"/>
*'''[[Duelling]]''': Aurélie had considerable skill in duelling and was able to hold her own against [[Jacob's sibling]].<ref name="HM Beauxbatons 2"/>
*'''[[Care of Magical Creatures]]''': Aurélie had considerable skill in the taking care of [[Abraxan]]s, especially the ones owned by [[Olympe Maxime]].

==Possessions==
*'''Wand''': Aurélie owned a [[wand]], which was of unknown length, [[wand wood]] and [[wand core]]. She most likely purchased her [[wand]] from a French [[wandmaker]] before starting her education at Beauxbatons.

==Appearances==
{{Imagecat|Images of Aurélie Dumont}}

The '''Potter memorial''' is a statue at the centre of the village square in [[Godric's Hollow]]. From a distance, it appears as an obelisk, carved with the names of people who died in a war (presumably [[Non-magic people|Muggle]] casualties of World War I or II). While Muggles can see only this obelisk, a [[Wizardkind|witch or wizard]] can see that the memorial changes into a statue of a [[Potter family|family]] as he or she approaches: [[James and Lily Potter|James, Lily]], and an infant [[Harry Potter]].<ref name="DH16"/>

==History==
Harry Potter and [[Hermione Granger]] visited Godric's Hollow during Christmas of [[1997]] while they [[Horcrux hunt|hunted Voldemort's Horcruxes]] in order for Harry to see where he had been born (and lost his parents) as well as possibly where Dumbledore left [[Godric Gryffindor's sword]] for them. They visited the memorial, as well as Harry's parents graves.<ref name="DH16">{{DH|B|16}}</ref>

==Description==
[[File:Godric's Hollow.jpg|232x232px|thumb|The memorial]]
It is remarked that in the winter the snow looks like knit caps on the heads of the statues. The infant Harry is said to look content in his mother's arms.<ref name="DH16"/>

*{{DH}} {{1st}}
